story:
Our story:

The Emmy nominated - BEACON HILL the SERIES  is back by popular demand for Season Two with longer episodes, positive LGBTQ representation, juicy romance, intrigue and political drama...all spearheaded by our Executive Producer Crystal Chappell, the Emmy Winning actress and producer of "Otalia" , Days of our Lives and Venice the Series fame.

Hi. My name is Jessica and I’m one of the Creators and Producers of BEACON HILL the SERIES. Our story began in the summer of 2013. My writing partner Linda and I were talking about some of the television shows that we missed.  Shows like The West Wing and Dallas, ER and Dynasty.  We were also lamenting the loss of so many daytime dramas that had been cancelled in recent years.

Soon we were daydreaming about the kind of show we’d love to see.  Something smart with great dialog that focused on strong female relationships.  We enjoy politics so that had to be included.  But we also missed those old soapy dramas and we wanted to see shows that delved deep into relationships between star crossed lovers and families who harbor secrets.  And finally, we wanted to see ourselves represented on the screen.  Strong, successful women who just happen to be gay.

We wanted to watch a drama.  A drama full of political corruption and intrigue, family connections and betrayal, and of course—there had to be romance. Lots of romance.

So as crazy as it sounds, we decided to write and produce the show ourselves.

In 2014 we were extremely fortunate to partner with Emmy winning actress and producer Crystal Chappell—who has produced her own Emmy-winning drama Venice the Series, which is now entering its sixth season.  We were lucky enough to have a dream cast of daytime actors who came on board and brought our show to life.

We self-funded Season One and were thrilled by the overwhelming response.  That first season received three daytime Emmy nominations, including one for Outstanding New Approaches Drama. We could not have been more proud of the incredible work of the entire cast and crew, and everyone who helped make our dream come true.

Who we are:

We run Bella Books, one of the largest independent lgbtq book publishers in the US.  Bella focuses on publishing stories by women, written for women. Our goal is always to promote storytelling that tells our stories—through books and now through film. We want to create content that show both women and men in all of their wonderfully complex and layered possibilities. Beacon Hill is the first of what we hope will be many productions.

Season Two:

So Beacon Hill is finally back for Season Two with an amazing script.  In addition to the great cast coming back from Season One, we’re absolutely thrilled about the new actors joining in on the fun.  We’re welcoming the incredible Marem Hassler of Riley Parra fame, Hillary B. Smith from  One Life to Live and General Hospital, Jacob Young of All My Children, Bold and Beautiful and General Hospital and Nadia Bjorlin from Days of our Lives and Venice.

Why are we crowdsourcing this season?

Creating content out of the mainstream of television is always a challenge. Shows that feature lgbtq characters present even more challenges when trying to find a path through the traditional route of streaming and broadcast television. That’s why we’re producing it ourselves. We are passionate about telling our stories. Stories that matter. Stories that entertain.  But as you know, filming a big sweeping drama with an amazing cast of actors is expensive. Filming on location in Boston is even more so. 

What will the money be used for?

Our cast is split between east and west coasts and we have to get them all to the same New England location. Travel for the cast and crew for Season Two is over $10,000. Hotels for everyone to stay during filming, which this year is nine days, will be $13,000. So you can see how things start to really add up.

Longer Episodes Please!

After season one, we heard from our fans. They wanted longer episodes! And we want to make our fans happy. But longer episodes mean we need more production and post production funds. In addition to hotel and travel, all of the money raised will go to cover our production costs like cameras, lighting, and sound equipment rentals.  It will be used to pay the crew and incredible cast for all of their hard work and long hours spent creating magic. Then of course we have to feed our cast and crew for those nine days – 3 meals a day. This production follows SAG/AFTRA rules, which means we are doing things by the book. We have to have liability insurance which is a must when filming on location. We have wardrobe, hair & makeup and transportation costs. Once filming is done we need funds for post-production that include editing, sound, music and color correction so that everyone’s hard work ends up looking and sounding good.

This is where you come in. We need your help making Season Two a reality. Our Season Two script is AMAZING. It’s full of SURPRISES, PASSION, ROMANCE and yes—it has the answer to the longest cliffhanger ever—Who’s at the damn door?

And did I mention the episodes are longer? So I’m asking you to help us make this the BEST Season EVER! Help us bring Season Two of Beacon Hill to life. We promise an amazing ride.

We’re grateful for every single penny that comes our way. No amount is too small or too big! And we have some wonderful perks and incentives to show our gratitude.

We have lunches, meet and greets with cast and crew. We have set visits and even some early viewing of Episode One! We have the usual but always awesome Beacon Hill swag like shirts and hats and hoodies.  And of course whiskey glasses so that you can drink like Claire! And we have unique and personalized one-of-a-kind perks that include phones calls with cast members.

If you haven’t watched Season One of Beacon Hill, we invite you to take a look now!  Visit https://BeaconHillTheSeries.com for trailers and episodes from last season.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us get the word out that Beacon Hill is back! Let people know about this campaign.

Thanks so much for your help – and for joining the Beacon Hill team!

story:
FIRST, A THANK YOU!

We are so excited to share this project with you all. Thank you for taking the time to support our journey!

WHY THIS STORY?

Our idea originated after several years of working together at a gym in the center of Hollywood. After too many ridiculous moments that left us speechless, we took action to bring to life our hilarious, very mutual, experiences. The theme surrounding our story is rooted in all of the characters individual desires to get to the "top." Whether or not that's in the entertainment industry or just trying to get ahead in life, Eclipse explores the idea of questionable morals proving just how far these characters are willing to go to reach their version of "success." Eclipse is a hybrid between The Office meets Broad City with a dash of Rupaul's Drag Race. Trust us. You. Will. Laugh. 

MEET THE CAST!

Andy Allen (The Misanthropic Boss)

Casey Cassinelli (The Party "Girl") 

Monette Moio (The Innocent Newbie)

Sara Spadacene (The Arguable Kleptomaniac)

Fabian Valenzuela (The Narcassistic Trainer)

WHAT YOU WOULD BE HELPING US ACHIEVE! 

Your contribution would help to pay for the necessary and experienced crew we need to create the most professional and quality final-product. 

WHERE YOUR MONEY WOULD BE GOING! 

  • ​$2000 for location rentals
  • $1000 for equipment rental
  • $2000 for payment of crew members and final editing team 

BONUS!

If you donate over $500 you will receive a *Producer* credit! 

THE IMPACT!

Family and Friends: By investing in our vision, you are helping us create something truly special and personal to us. You will allow us to generate a series that will make you all laugh while simultaneously granting us the opportunity to help reach our dreams. Thank you again!

story:
Folklyfe is a web series which focuses on early American heritage and folk culture, and how it can be translated into a modern lifestyle. The program follows Nichole Gerding, 18th Century Food Historian, Domestic Skills Interpreter, and Proprietress of Thankful Sage Farm School. In each episode, Nichole and her family highlight a heritage skill or tradition (blacksmithing, bread making, etc.) by giving a brief history, seeking out masters and makers of said skill (when appropriate), and demonstrating how to integrate some aspect of it into everyday life.

Folklyfe's mission is to identify and educate about heritage skills and forgotten arts for viewers to use towards a simplified lifestyle with historic underpinnings.

 

It is our intention to release content weekly. Two weeks of the month, there will be a larger episode which focuses on its own topic or heritage skill. The other two weeks of the month will highlight a shorter "mini-sode". These mini-sodes will capture heritage recipes, traditions, garden minutes, and other old good things in short bite sized videos. 

We launched our first episode on March 20, 2017, the first day of Spring! It's the season of warmth, fresh insights, and with a little work- endless possibility; a perfect start to this adventure. Please join us, like and subscribe! 

https://youtu.be/zq5JgcHzKf0

Consider contributing and sharing our campaign!

story:
What is The Bride of Murdery Heights?

Part Jane Austen, part Jane Eyre, The Bride of Murdery Heights is a sketch comedy show that ran at the UCB Theatre in New York City. It’s a sketch show by women, about women, starring Kelsey Bailey (UCB Harold Night), Tessa Hersh (Above Average Presents), Jon Monje (Late Night with Seth Meyers), Alexis Pereira (The President Show, Broad City), Alexis Rhiannon (UCB Lloyd Night), Devin Ritchie (Above Average Presents), Chris Burns (Straight Marriage), and Cian Smith (Funny or Die).

Who are we?

We are three comedy writers and actresses who have been writing and performing together for over a year. More specifically:

Erin Fenton is a writer for the UCB Maude team The Foundation. She is one half of the comedy duo Fenton & Grace, creators of the webseries Dear Lord. Her work has been covered by Vulture, WhoHaHa and Comedy Cake.

Aimée Lutkin is a writer and performer on Magnet sketch team Chico Splits. She was on UCB House Improv Team This Old House. She writes for blogs.

Jaime Lutz is a writer and comedian who improvises on the former UCB house team Blush. Additionally, she is the cohost of "Dead Meet," a comedy podcast, and is a regular joke contributor to Funny or Die. As a journalist, she’s written for outlets including The Boston Globe, ABC News, Glamour Magazine, and The Star-Ledger. You can find more about her at www.jaimelutz.com.

What’s special about Murdery Heights?

We wrote The Bride of Murdery Heights out of a desire to create a comedy show about a genre we loved. There's a lot of pressure on comedy writers who are women to write about being a woman, to fill that niche in a writer's room. But we wanted to write about ghosts.

This is a kind of story we are really familiar with: gothic romances and social satire written by 19th century women who were exploring feminist issues in the most batty way imaginable (seriously, read Wuthering Heights. Shit’s wild). We love our characters, including a monstrous Old Money nobleman, a deranged, consumption-addled take on Emily Bronte, and a lesbian who keeps trying to explain to other people what exactly that is. And we love our story. This web series isn’t just a series of sketches: it’s a mystery, a romance, and a 19th century horror story. AND IT’S A COMEDY!

Great - but why film it?

Filming the show allows us to bring it to a wider audience, to show to people who can’t travel to New York, as well as to submit to festivals. In addition to the web series, we are also editing Murdery Heights as a short film, which will give us the opportunity to submit it for even more opportunities. Finally, filming allows us to place these characters in the rolling hills and ballrooms they belong in. 

What are the costs? 

We’ve already spent more than $5,000 on production, including $1713 for space rentals, $800 for sound, $1500 for filming, $500 for props and costumes, and $500 for miscellaneous costs, including paid production assistants.

We have an agreement to pay our editor $1,000, and we expect that there will be some small additional post-production costs. We also want to submit to as many festivals as possible, which we estimate will cost us $500.

All told, that's a budget of $6,500 for a nine-episode web series and 30-minute short film. Our goal is to cover just $2,500 of that through this campaign, though any donations above our goal will go toward our additional costs.

Timeline

Pre-production: March 2017 ✔ 
Filming: April - September 2017 ✔
Editing: December 2017 - January 2018
Estimated Release: February 2018
Festivals: TBD 2018 and 2019

Risks and challenges

We’ve already filmed all the raw footage and we’ve secured a discounted rate for editing. The riskiest expense for us, at this point, is festival submissions; we obviously can’t guarantee Murdery Heights will get into anything we submit, though we believe we have a quality product that stands out from the pack.

There is also always the risk of hidden costs for which we are not accounting.

I can't give money. How else can I help?

Spread the word! Tell people about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, email, Snapchat, or old time-y parchment!

Thank you!

story:
Emma & Christy - Webseries Pilot

What is it about?

The Emma & Christy webseries will follow two best friends as they navigate through life, romance, and adulting in a way that is comedic and unconventional. 

The Pilot

One night Emma & Christy get together to share life's mishaps. Christy learns she needs to stay current with the dating scene and Emma is shaken up after discovering her boyfriend's unusual preference of adult entertainment (hint: it involves stuffed animals!). Christy comes up with the wild idea for them to team up as business partners and enter the mysterious world of Plushies. If they learn to balance out each others strengths and weaknesses, they might find what they've both been searching for.

 

Who We Are

 

Why It's Important To Us

With this project, we wanted to first make people laugh and enjoy themselves, cuz who doesn't want that?! BUT, we also wanted to touch on  subjects that are still taboo and shameful in today's society. Something like, oh I don't know, sex and sexual preferences to start with. Another theme of our story will be Emma and Christy's journey from a place of weakness to female empowerment. Through our story, we hope to broaden perspectives, erase prejudices and encourage acceptance of one another. 

 

What You're Helping Us Achieve

  • Our goal is to raise $4,000 in 45 days in order to have the funds to shoot our pilot episode. 

This will help us hire a production crew that includes:

  1. DP (Director of Photography) - $500
  2. Production Crew- (camera op, 1st assistant camera operator, gaffer, grip & electric) - 1,500
  3. Camera - (rentals) 1K
  4. Sound - (boom op, equipment rentals, sound mixer) - $700
  5. Lighting - equipment rentals - $400
  6. Post Production (color correction, music (original), editing) - 1K
  7. Catering, crew has gotta eat! - $200

  • By supporting this campaign, you are helping us achieve our goal in its entirety. Without your help we will not be able to start production, complete the pilot and show you this awesome story! That'd be such a lame ending!

  • With your help, we will be able to bring this project to life! Our goal is to start production by the end of the summer. 

 

Showing our gratitude & appreciation 

We are very thankful for each person that helps us get closer to our goal.

Donations & Perks

The awesome perks are to your right. You probably already took a peek at those (it's ok, we don't judge, lol). We want to say that we appreciate you and hope that you will find the T-shirt and hat a great new addition to your already fabulous wardrobe! 

If We Exceed Our Goal

If we raise more money than our goal, we will use the money towards shooting more episodes of the series. Our ultimate goal is to turn Emma & Christy into a multi season web series. 

We are more than confident that we will reach our goal and hopeful that we will exceed it, all thanks to you.

If We Don't Reach Our Goal

This project means a lot to us and if we don't reach our goal, we will use what we have to start production. It may take us longer than planned, but we'll get it done. We want this project to be amazing, and it will be, but we don't want to be left broke and possible in debt in doing so. 

Questions?

Please email us at emmaandchristy@gmail.com

Follow us on Instagram - @emmaandchristy 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially, but we do ask that you still help us by spreading the word. Please share our campaign on social media: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, Myspace (is that still a thing?), any place you think is helpful! THANK YOU!

We are very thankful for each person that helps us get closer to our goal.
Donations & Perks
The awesome perks are to your right. You probably already took a peek at those (it's ok, we don't judge, lol). We want to say that we appreciate you and hope that you will find the T-shirt and hat a great new addition to your already fabulous wardrobe! 
If We Exceed Our Goal
If we raise more money than our goal, we will use the money towards shooting more episodes of the series. Our ultimate goal is to turn Emma & Christy into a multi season web series. 
We are more than confident that we will reach our goal and hopeful that we will exceed it, all thanks to you.
If We Don't Reach Our Goal
This project means a lot to us and if we don't reach our goal, we will use what we have to start production. It may take us longer than planned, but we'll get it done. We want this project to be amazing, and it will be, but we don't want to be left broke and possible in debt in doing so. 
Questions?
Please email us at emmaandchristy@gmail.com
Follow us on Instagram - @emmaandchristy 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to help financially, but we do ask that you still help us by spreading the word. Please share our campaign on social media: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, Myspace (is that still a thing?), any place you think is helpful! THANK YOU!

story:
About the Project and Its Creators:

Hi! This is Priscilla Barnes and Ted Monte, creators and proprietors of Villa Priscilla. We think the crazy antics of operating a vacation rental would make a great TV series, so we are hoping to shoot a sizzle reel to shop around this concept to networks.  We are so grateful for IndieGoGo's help with our fundraising for this endeavor.  Pledges from backers will help us tremendously with expenses like paying for equipment, crew, editing, music, set decor, hair & make-up, props and much more. It will also help feed everyone on set during filming and go toward the many other expenses we have during this project. We have some cool perks in exchange for pledges.  Even a chance to stay at our Vacation Rental and have a nice home-cooked dinner made by us. We thank everyone for their support in funding our project.

story:
Roofs – It’s what we do!

Have you ever used Home Advisor? Thumbtack? or any other service that puts you in touch with a professional contractor to undertake a project of yours? 

There was a time when people opened the yellow pages to find a contractor, but those days are long gone.  These days, people go to the web.  Customers ‘Google’ roofing services or they go to Home Advisor, Thumbtack or other sites or apps.  That’s all fine to a point but it’s all somewhat random.  These online marketplaces are mostly ‘jack of all trades’. 

Roofhub.com is different.

There are over 120 million houses in the United States and millions of commercial buildings.

Every one of them has a roof.  It’s important!

The roof is the building’s first line defense against the elements.  The roof is the most abused part of any building so when you need a roofing service you want to ensure that you get the best service available, and that means verified professionals you can rely on.

The roofing industry employs tens of thousands of roofing contractors, materials suppliers, inspectors and salespeople. 

Have a roofing contractor check your roof.  After a storm, it may look OK but check out this video:

Roofhub.com is an online marketplace connecting roofing customers with roofing professionals and the market for such a service is vast! 

Customers join for free and can submit roofing requirements.  All requests are stored in their account with full history of services:

The Roofhub team been developing Roofhub for the past 15 months and it is just about ready for market, but to build and launch a site like this takes time and money.  A lot of both.

Not only is Roofhub a place for customers looking for roofing professionals but it is also a powerful promotional opportunity for advertisers and sponsors, trades and realtors.

Divided into unique sections, advertisers and sponsors can place target ads for their industry in single or multiple states. 

Roofhub is not only a resource for customer requiring roofing services but is also an evolution of the yellow pages for the roofing industry.

Roofhub.com employs a powerful automated leads management system designed to handle thousands of transactions daily connecting customers, contractors, suppliers, realtors and advertisers; in fact, everyone connected with or requiring of the roofing industry  When a customer requests a quote, the system workflows match that customer with top professionals; providing the best possible service. 

Every customer, contractor, sponsor, investor, realtor and trade member gets their own account within the Roofhub platform.  Every member has a unique experience.

The site is free to customers and very low cost to contractors while offering unlimited opportunities for sponsors.

We are seeking funds to bring this system to market and are offering amazing incentives to roofing contractors, realtors, trades, advertisers and people like you to participate in our launch.  Our goal is to be number 1 in the roofing / leads management business.

Is this a great opportunity?  You bet it is!!

Thumbtack.com raised over $273 million in funding and are looking for another $140 million.  They have a market value of $1.3 BILLION. 

Hundreds of millions of dollars have been raised for numerous online market places which transact billions of dollars daily.  None so far have addressed the roofing business directly, until now.

As of right now, we're not looking for that kind of money.  We're looking for staffing and launch money to prepare ourselves for the big venture money and to build the business.

Funding

We have developed a system that can dominate the roofing business:

  • We need $75,000 to fund further development of the system, and to increase our staffing, add additional server capabilities and to raise additional funds through Venture Capital Funding.
  • Roofhub is an advertising and marketing powerhouse and every donation will mean placement of your name or advert on our site.  Small donations get a listing on the Honor Roll but larger donations will get lifetime ad placements in single or multiple states.  
  • If we don't achieve our entire goal, money will still go towards our Venture Capital campaign.  Sites like Thumbtack have raised hundreds of millions of dollars in Venture Funding resulting is massive valuations.  Roofhub can achieve the same.  It's that powerful.

Why Roofs Are Important

Roofs shouldn't be handled by a one size fits all approach taken by Home Advisor or Thumbtack:

  • Roofs need specialists because a bad roof ruins the building.  When you have a problem, you need a qualified expert to fix the issue.
  • Roofhub was built using years of experience in the roofing industry.  Roofing Contractors are verified by Roofhub before being supplied with roofing leads
  • Roofhub is built on state of the art technology that is evolving all the time.  Our team is not satisfied with being second best.

Risks & Challenges?

There is no risk.  Roofhub is not going away.  Your donation sees your advert or your name on the site forever.  As Roofhub grows, that donation will only increase your exposure.  Having a Roofhub account will keep you informed of all developments, provide you with feedback as well as giving you a voice in our development and growth.

  • Our challenges are about marketing, staffing and promotion.  Our technology is awesome.  Right now we host Roofhub.com on our dedicated server but long term, we will move it to a dynamic hosting platform that will allow for unlimited growth.  Services like Amazon Web Services, Rackspace and others are being considered.
  • Our team includes roofers, web and CRM programmers, marketers and video professionals.  With your help, there is nothing we cannot achieve.

Everyone reading this will have a roof over their head

The potential for Roofhub.com is huge.  Very few things are more important than having a roof over your head and those roofs needs quality service.  Even if you can't contribute to our campaign tell others about it:

  • Please tell your friends, colleagues, real estate agents about our campaign.
  • There are numerous tools to share our campaign.  Mention it on Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms.

story:
10 years ago I sat my father down and explained how people would watch film, tv, and sports in the future. After listening to my story Dads eyes got wide. "This is going to be big!" he said, "you're going to change the world!" 

 Laughingly I told him I appreciated his support, but I didn't have any money to build the systems I was talking about.  Besides, all the huge internet corporations were well on their way. They should have things working properly in the next few months....

 10 years later we still don’t have the options Dad and I spoke about on that day. The industry is ready to evolve, and the power needs to be given back to the people. 

 

What are the issues?? 

 

 The problem is that we are only seeing what they want us to see. We only get to watch the things that have been approved by the board of whatever corporation has the money to produce these things. 

 Sure we have youtube. But why are the artist that I watch a few hours every week earning at or below the poverty line? If people like watching their videos where is the money for additional content? How long will it be before the cost of creating is too much and the creators stop creating? 

Don’t think the money isn’t there. Billions of people stream video every day. Billions with a B. Someone is making a lot from what people are watching. But its not the creators. 

“If you’re a series regular on a network TV show, you’re getting a good amount of money, Yet you can have half a million followers on YouTube and still be working at Starbucks.” - Alice Marwick, assistant professor of communication at the University of North Carolina 

The world needs an unfiltered variety of content, and the creators need funding to create!

 

 Building the change

 telly:D will put people and corporations on a level playing field in a way the world has never seen before, but we have to build it first!

 

 We are starting from nothing. By that I mean we have no code of our own, no server space to host with. What we do have is a goal, a solid plan, a domain and a logo to rally around. To me this is a huge advantage. Starting from scratch allows us to create exactly what we need. Working together we will look to the future, we can put the building blocks exactly where we need them to form a strong foundation.

  Taking a stand with the BIG guys who control the industry wont be easy.  It means we will need our own code. It means our own servers, and an app to tie it all in. But it also means dollars.   

  We need $1.5 million dollars. But you are not alone! If we had 1 cent for every time someone saw Charlie Bit My Finger we would have over $8 million, and I know you saw the video….

  Together, for the cost of a Starbucks, we can escape the claws of the industry and shape our own future! Together we can build the freedom that you deserve. 

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

 We understand that any money, even a dollar, can be a lot depending on your situation. You can still help be a part of the movement without a funding donation. Share the campaign. The more eyes we have on this, the stronger we become.

 You could also head over to tellyd.com and signup for the beta. At the end of the day we are nothing without the people. When the time comes you could become a tester, a content consumer, even a producer! As long as you participate the community will grow!

story:
We all know Koreatown in LA or the 3 Chinatowns in NYC, but have you heard of Cermak Chicago? Or Hmong in Milwaukee? What about Japanese in Grand Rapids, Michigan? Asian stories in the US have largely been California and NYC-centric. Do a quick Google search for Asian Americans in the Midwest and we guarantee disappointment. Do a Youtube search and you might not make it to the 2nd page of results. 

Our mission is to document an Asian narrative that's largely been untold. The Midwest is so often painted as a bland, uninteresting region where nothing ever happens. However, this stereotype has surpressed a lot of Asian voices that do exist in Middle America. It's time we get some #MidwestRespresentasian. 

We're a mighty team of 30 creatives, filmmakers, marketers, storytellers, and students from across the Midwest region who are coming together to create this project. We've gotten seed funding of $1000 from Project Pengyou, a flagship initiative of the Golden Bridges Foundation that fosters U.S.-China youth leadership, however, with a 3 episode docuseries that spans the Midwest across Illinois, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, and Ohio, we still need your support to help tell the best version of this untold narrative. 

The episodes we’re looking to produce are by topic as followed:

  • Socioeconomics + Politics (video 1)
    • Introduction
    • Where we live
    • What the towns/neighborhoods look like
    • Schools we go to
    • Family backgrounds
    • Encounters with discrimination/racism
  • Dating/Relationships (video 2)
    • Personal stories
    • Biracial dating
    • Identity and dating
    • What a typical date looks like
    • Subtle asian dating
  • International and Asian Americans (video 3)
    • Personal identity and perceived identity
    • Discrimination/presentation as “asian asian”
    • Misunderstandings
    • Differences between groups
    • Travelling to the “motherland”

Our hope for the series is that as we make these introductory episodes, there will be more opportunity and resources to continue to make more episodes. Some of the topics we’d love to explore include Midwest food culture, family histories, and Hmong Americans.

The crew is quite large (about 30 people strong), so we'll let the directors show their faces. 

We're still in the process of finishing up our casting process, but here are the individuals that we've already casted and for some, already interviewed. We're carefully selecting individuals was different backgrounds and stories to represent Midwest Asians. We understand that we won't be able to cover all grounds, but we're working our hardest to do so. For example, we are looking to cast one more person who is a Hmong American and identifies with the LGBTQ+ community in Madison, WI.

We've gotten $1000 seed funding from Project Pengyou, a flagship initiative of the Golden Bridges Foundation that fosters U.S.-China youth leadership, which is enough to cover food costs for teams to go to locations in the Midwest to shoot.  However, we're unable to compensate for all travel expenses, equipment, and distribution costs for the project right now. All filmmakers that are part of the project are also volunteering days of their time and getting time off from work to take part. We want to be able to compensate for their time on this project as well. We'd love to pay for music use rights from Asian music companies like 88Rising, compensate our amazing graphic designer who's working on all the title cards and transitions, give our marketing team a budget to spread this narrative out into the world, and so much more.

Here's a scallion pancake funds chart that shows where this boba fund is going. 

    We know you all love a good perk, and we love providing them! We've got all your favorite perks, from a meme package to t-shirts to behind the scenes reels, and more! Here are the details:

    Azn meme pack - $1

    We love a good Subtle Asian Traits meme, and guess what, we know the founders! We'll include a compilation of the founders' favorite SAT memes to add to your arsenal!

    Digipack - $5

    A digipack will add in the AP on AP logo, a wallpaper background, and exclusive stills from the shoot with that 4k aesthetic that even your tiger mom would approve of. 

    The Poster Pack - $10

    We'll throw in the memes, digipack and your very own film poster! You'll get to choose the design you want, and we will email it to you!

    Thank You Pack - $15

    While we're shooting, we're going to make a video compiling thanks yous from cast and crew while they're on their shoots. From the bottom of our bubble teas, we love you more than Gong Cha and KFT combined. 

    Director Interview Pack - $20 

    Our directors took a lot of time researching and formulating questions that shaped the series, and this pack will let you into their minds. We'll send you this 15 minute interview with the 3 directors on why they chose these questions and who they had to talk to to formulate them. 

    Boba Gang Pack - $50

    We love our boba/bubble tea, and we know you do too. For this pack, we'll throw in a $25 gift card to KFT to charge your milk tea addictions!

    Sticker Pack - $75

    When we were kids, we collected stickers of our favorite animes and cartoons. Bubbly stickers were also the best. For this pack, we'll give you a curated collection of 10 laptop stickers! This package of stickers will include milk tea, AP on AP series logo, baos, Anti Social Social Club, and more! 

    Meet the Director Pack - $100

    Maybe the video interview isn't enough AND you want the milk tea. Well, how about a 1 hour interview with the directors themselves? You get 1 full hour to ask whatever questions you want about the series and how it all came together. And you can do it while sipping on your matcha sesame milk tea from KFT while you do so.

    Associate Producer Pack - $500

    So you want to be a producer. That is so generous of you! We know if you're donating that much, you've gotta want some extra perks right? Well we're going to throw in everything in the above bundle, as well as feature you as an associate producer in the end credits and give you a AP on AP t-shirt. To top it all off, we'll mail you a handwritten thank you from the directors, because truly, thank you so much! 

    Executive Producer Pack - $1000

    I think you might've missed the casting of Crazy Rich Asians, because wow you've helped fund 1/5 of our project! So at this point, you're basically family, I mean how else could we perceive this momentous donation? We're gonna feature you as an executive producer in the end credits, give 3 AP on AP t-shirts, and give you an IMDb credit. Above all, we'll mail you a handwritten thank you from the directors and signed by the crew, because you're officially an AP on AP family member and we couldn't thank you enough!

    Crazy Broke Asian Pack - $0

    Not all of us are crazy rich asians, and we understand that completely! Therefore, we're gonna break down the ways you can help out. And we sense there's a giveaway involved if you share this campaign! 

    • Share this Indiegogo link to 1 social platform and tag us in it.
    • For every like you get on your post, you get entered once into the giveaway.
    • For every tag you get on your post, you get entered twice into the giveaway. 

    And what's the giveaway? It's a $50 gift card to the boba shop of your choosing! This is limited to boba shops that have gift cards, mind you. But this would include KFT, Gong Cha, Chatime, Coco, and others in similar fashion. So share this with your friends, your family, your Facebook friends, your Wechat friends! This is a story we really want to get made, and we would be so grateful for your shares!

Azn meme pack - $1
We love a good Subtle Asian Traits meme, and guess what, we know the founders! We'll include a compilation of the founders' favorite SAT memes to add to your arsenal!
Digipack - $5
A digipack will add in the AP on AP logo, a wallpaper background, and exclusive stills from the shoot with that 4k aesthetic that even your tiger mom would approve of. 
The Poster Pack - $10
We'll throw in the memes, digipack and your very own film poster! You'll get to choose the design you want, and we will email it to you!
Thank You Pack - $15
While we're shooting, we're going to make a video compiling thanks yous from cast and crew while they're on their shoots. From the bottom of our bubble teas, we love you more than Gong Cha and KFT combined. 
Director Interview Pack - $20 
Our directors took a lot of time researching and formulating questions that shaped the series, and this pack will let you into their minds. We'll send you this 15 minute interview with the 3 directors on why they chose these questions and who they had to talk to to formulate them. 
Boba Gang Pack - $50
We love our boba/bubble tea, and we know you do too. For this pack, we'll throw in a $25 gift card to KFT to charge your milk tea addictions!
Sticker Pack - $75
When we were kids, we collected stickers of our favorite animes and cartoons. Bubbly stickers were also the best. For this pack, we'll give you a curated collection of 10 laptop stickers! This package of stickers will include milk tea, AP on AP series logo, baos, Anti Social Social Club, and more! 
Meet the Director Pack - $100
Maybe the video interview isn't enough AND you want the milk tea. Well, how about a 1 hour interview with the directors themselves? You get 1 full hour to ask whatever questions you want about the series and how it all came together. And you can do it while sipping on your matcha sesame milk tea from KFT while you do so.
Associate Producer Pack - $500
So you want to be a producer. That is so generous of you! We know if you're donating that much, you've gotta want some extra perks right? Well we're going to throw in everything in the above bundle, as well as feature you as an associate producer in the end credits and give you a AP on AP t-shirt. To top it all off, we'll mail you a handwritten thank you from the directors, because truly, thank you so much! 
Executive Producer Pack - $1000
I think you might've missed the casting of Crazy Rich Asians, because wow you've helped fund 1/5 of our project! So at this point, you're basically family, I mean how else could we perceive this momentous donation? We're gonna feature you as an executive producer in the end credits, give 3 AP on AP t-shirts, and give you an IMDb credit. Above all, we'll mail you a handwritten thank you from the directors and signed by the crew, because you're officially an AP on AP family member and we couldn't thank you enough!
Crazy Broke Asian Pack - $0

Not all of us are crazy rich asians, and we understand that completely! Therefore, we're gonna break down the ways you can help out. And we sense there's a giveaway involved if you share this campaign! 

Share this Indiegogo link to 1 social platform and tag us in it.
For every like you get on your post, you get entered once into the giveaway.
For every tag you get on your post, you get entered twice into the giveaway. 

And what's the giveaway? It's a $50 gift card to the boba shop of your choosing! This is limited to boba shops that have gift cards, mind you. But this would include KFT, Gong Cha, Chatime, Coco, and others in similar fashion. So share this with your friends, your family, your Facebook friends, your Wechat friends! This is a story we really want to get made, and we would be so grateful for your shares!

story:
Hello.  I’m Dr. X and I’m a fictional character. The Super Squad is an homage, if you will, to the zombie genre from last five decades!! From Zombie to Hell of the Living Dead to Resident Evil, Feeding off the brilliance of Bruno Mattei, Claudio Fragasso, Godfrey Ho, and other master filmmakers, The Super Squad has something for everyone! 

It is my goal to capture the true essence of these films. Romantic comedy?  Zombie parody? You decide!

 

Now a little about the Super Motley Crew....

https://www.youtube.com/user/bohabb


www.lightscameradead.com

story:
Miss Misery is the story of anxious millennials using the overabundance of dating options available to them to avoid their real problems.

The Project

Amy and Jay have been dating for three years and hit a slump. Amy has stopped showing up for her job at the laundromat. Jay is noodling through a graduate degree in ethnomusicology. They really need to talk. But you know what sounds a lot more fun? Having sex with other people.

Meanwhile Lee, Amy's best friend, proves that sex with randos isn't any easier. Lee's exhausted by the grind of Instagram upkeep and the management of a million half-baked Tinder and Bumble convos. And now she’s shook up by the offer of a promotion that might take her away from a dream career she's basically never pursued. Her solution? Just date harder.

This is where Miss Misery starts, and it goes just as badly as you would imagine. Awkward dates, confusing threesomes, illegal crushes on neighbours and coworkers, and running into your boss at a sex club – it's misery.

Based on true stories and slightly exaggerated anecdotes, this is a sitcom-style web series of four 15-minute episodes that tells a full narrative arc from start to finish.  Made by a team of award-winning writers and producers, this project is years in the making and very close to our hearts.

 

Our Story

Two years ago, we (Jade and Steve) were living together and talking about our successes and humiliations of dating. We also talked a lot about TV, and movies, and what we liked and what we didn’t. There was so much good material in our own lives, we started to develop a kind of shorthand – "that's content!" It seemed obvious. We had to make a show.

We knew we could make something that reflected the truth, good and bad, of what we saw and experienced. While so many shows and films focus on dating, they didn’t necessarily get into the realities of either short or long-term relationships.

Having both experimented with open relationships, we decided polyamory would be a good way of exploring a wide range of dating dynamics – and a theme was born. We agreed that depicting one single character would allow us to riff on short-term dating, while depicting a couple would let us get into the complexities of long-term relationships – the less flashy parts of love, like honesty, communication, and being brave enough to open up about your wants and fears.

We've been writing scripts and tinkering with plot points and puzzling out themes for this show for the last two years, and now we're finally super excited to complete it and show it the world!

 

What We Need & Next Steps

We have all four episodes written, we have actors cast, locations scouted, an amazing cinematographer on board, and an incredible crew. What we need is to secure this final part of our funding so we can begin shooting in earnest.

The amount we need to to do that is $19,500 (CDN). This will cover producing, shooting and basic post-production for  four 12-17 minute long episodes. Here’s how it will be spent:

Breakdown

  • Cast and crew: 38%
    We need to pay our cinematographer, sound recordist, stylist, and assistant director for 10 days of shooting. We also need to pay our actors for time taken off work.
  • Equipment: 15%
    Lighting equipment, camera equipment, hard drives, wardrobe and set design.
  • Post production: 25%
    Editing and sound editing, sound mixing etc. .  
  • Other production costs: 15%
    Craft, transportation, other incidentals.
  • Indiegogo Perks/Fees: 7%
    Printing totes, t-shirts, posters and paying the designers.

The Impact

We have everything set up (aside from funding) to film this series, and we are so committed to making it happen. If we don’t reach our goal of $19,500, the money raised will go towards the first steps of filming. Even if it means taking longer to produce, or having to find other fundraising methods for post-production, we will make sure Miss Misery is completed.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, or you already have and want to do more, here are some ways you can help us complete Miss Misery. 

  1. Join us on facebook, and invite or tag your friends, react to posts and share them! 
  2. Follow us on instagram
  3. Share this campaign, using the buttons on the top right, on your facebook, twitter or other social media accounts. 
  4. Email this page, this very one you are on, to people you think may want to know more, may be interested in the project, or may be able to donate.
  5. Talk about the project IRL (in real life) with your friends, family, dates or lovers.


Core Team

 
Jade Blair - Co-Creator, Cast (Lee), Producer

Jade is a writer and filmmaker based in Toronto. Her previous film experiences includes producing and writing the award-winning, CSA nominated documentary After the Last River. She has also worked on numerous shorts and music videos. She was awarded a spot in LIFT's filmmentor program, and has a degree in Cultural Studies from McGill. Her writing has appeared in Vice, Fashion, Hazlitt and the Establishment, amongst others. 

 
Stephen Thomas - Co-Creator, Cast (Jay)

Stephen has lived all over the world and published over 100 short stories. His writing has appeared in The Atlantic online, McSweeney’s, Hazlitt, VICE, Toronto Star, Canadian Art, and many other places. He has degrees in cognitive science and creative writing and is a co-founder of Double Double Land. His 2016 book of short stories, The Jokes, was shortlisted for the Metatron Prize for Rising Authors of Contemporary Literature. His essay, "The Legion Lonely," was Hazlitt’s most popular piece of 2017. He’s been awarded a Truman Capote Scholarship, an Edward F. Albee Foundation Fellowship, and grants from the Ontario Arts Council and the Toronto Arts Council. 


Aley Waterman - Cast (Amy), Music/Score, Writer

Aley is a writer, musician, and curator from Newfoundland. She is going to U of T in the Fall to do her MA in Creative Writing. In Newfoundland she made an album with her band Galaa with a musicNL Sound album grant and taught English at Memorial University. She is a curator for Trampoline Hall, and most recently her writing has been featured through Metatron and the monthly showcase “Amazing New Stuff.” She is ever excited about creative collaboration, she loves Toronto, she loves swimming, she is open to the idea of open relationships but has never successfully been in one, yet. 


Alison MacMillan - Editor, Producer

Alison is a film editor and producer based in Toronto, Canada. She has edited a few shorts including Fowl for LIFT’s Filmmentor program in 2016, and an episode of the anthology series Friendship in 2017. She produced the CBC short documentary Billsville in 2016, which screened at the International Festival of Films on Art, the Toronto Jewish Film Festival, among other festivals. Alison has also worked in a number of TV editorial departments, and as VFX coordinator on the show The Expanse.

story:
The Production Crew of Wake The Fuck Up Needs Your Help!

We LOVE our show, Wake The Fuck Up, and we know you do too! Our fans know that even a show as belovedly low-brow as ours has a lot of talent and hard work behind it! If you lend us a hand, you will get the greatest gift on Earth...another season of Wake The Fuck Up!  Donate anything you can to keep us going strong!  It's all appreciated!

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous donations will go towards preservation and production needs like hard drives, hosting, editing time, DV tapes and SD cards and other related equipment rentals or purchases.  It will also allow us to keep bringing you quality programming by funding travel compensation and craft services for guests and volunteer crew.  After all these items are addressed, remaining funds will go towards launching and hosting a podcast-only version of the show on Podbean and iTunes!  Of course we have some fun perks to give you guys and gals for helping us, in an affordable range for every budget!

The Impact

Wake The Fuck Up has documented the amazing Appalachian art and performance culture for years, and we have our eye on so many more interesting, talented guests!   You can contribute to the documentation of our unique history with even just one dollar!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just don't have the means to contribute, we totally understand!  But that doesn't mean you can't help!  Share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social networks by using the share tools at the top right of the page!

We thank you for tuning in all these years, and for checking out our IndieGoGo campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Welcome true believers! We’re Pixel Brain Productions, and we’re here to chew bubble gum and produce Bagged & Bored Season Two... and we're all out of bubble gum. So let's get to it - with your help of course!

Our origin story begins with a healthy dose of video games, comic book culture, and a penchant for visual storytelling. This led us to our very first film, entitled Zach Cooper’s Epic Speedrun, a video game caper that quickly developed a rabid cult following and would become the catalyst for our YouTube channel. We’d go on to provide humorous original content, industry quality short films, and promotional material for various comic cons and local businesses. What we lacked in funds, we made up for in creativity, dedication, and a sheen of professionalism.

In fact, these traits are what led comic shop owner Brian Barrow to offer us a rare opportunity to shoot inside his store, The Destination. A concept for a quick comedy sketch was developed and shot, featuring Louisville comedians Kent Carney and Jake Reber heckling customers at the store. After realizing the potential of both the comic shop location and the talent we had to work with, 7 episodes were developed, and Bagged & Bored started production in the fall of 2014.

Our series began with no budget, no fans, and a handful of actors; but all of that changed when the first few episodes were released in 2015. While it was initially compared to Kevin Smith’s Clerks, our show found its own niche with a strong emphasis on surreal visuals mixed with kinetic storytelling. Factor in the combination of strong character performances with authentic pop culture references, and audiences were thrilled to see what would happen next. Don't believe us? Check out the trailer for Season One. And feel free to binge all 7 episodes back-to-back!

The show also resonated with many people in the Louisville arts community. Before we knew it animators, illustrators, musicians, costume designers, and dozens of actors were wanting to donate their skills to be a part of the series. This influx of talent helped shape the remaining episodes into what they are today. By the end of 2015, it became apparent that this was no longer a simple weekend hobby for a few people - it was a full on commitment, with a loaded arsenal of talent, and a super devoted fan base that craved more. If we wanted to continue the story at the pace and quality we set with our later episodes, then we would need a lot of extra help, resources, and most important of all, funding.

What We Need & What You Get

There’s a phrase we like to say about Pixel Brain projects: “It’s a labor of love, cause it sure ain’t a labor for money!”  We were fortunate during Season One to have had so many people who were passionate enough about the project to donate their time and skills. Cast and crew would skip meals, sacrifice sleep, miss out on opportunities at our day jobs, and we’d pay out of pocket for additional props and gear.  

Our “guerrilla style” has led us to getting the most out of our creativity; heck we managed to shoot and produce SEVEN high quality episodes on a shoestring budget and lived to tell about it! We are positive we can achieve NINE epic episodes in Season Two with a bare bones budget of $12,000.
 

This budget would be used for the following

  • Equipment/Lighting kits
  • Props and Set Construction
  • Wardrobe & Costuming
  • Locations
  • Catering (we'd really like to eat this time)
  • Hard drive/media storage
  • Commission artists for our original comic book title cards
  • Compensation for our loyal actors and the long crazy hours they give us

Oh, then of course there is YOU, the loyal backer! With your contribution you will receive NINE hilarious episodes of an awesome web series and the gratification of knowing that you’re helping to make Louisville a bastion for creative endeavors like this! Not to mention all the perks you can find in the sidebar!

    The Impact

    Bagged & Bored is more than just a web series, it has become a platform for many artists to get recognized for their talents and abilities. It has also provided them with opportunities to experience things they never thought they would… such as prancing downtown in a Power Girl costume or spending an entire day play-fighting in the wilderness! The potential for more episodes of Bagged & Bored is an exciting prospect for many comedians, actors, and artists who have yet to be involved in the show’s production but would very much like to!

      Risks & Challenges

      Just like any production, things can get delayed and shoots can be postponed due to factors beyond our control. As much as we'd love for Bagged & Bored to be our full time jobs, sadly it is not. We have and will continue to do our best to stick to a solid shooting schedule, but life and work can occasionally slow us down.

      One major lesson we learned while filming the first season, is to film the entire new season all at once, as opposed to episode by episode. While we had a clear vision for Season One, it was still very much like paving a path as we walked it.  It became a start-stop process due to new talent or locations suddenly becoming available to us. In other words, we did not start Season One with all of our “tools in the toolbox.” This time we will!

      Regardless of any setbacks we might experience, hard work and perseverance is what separated this show from many other passion projects. We always make sure to follow through, and we want to keep that momentum going by continuing the story we started in Season One. Disappointing ourselves and our loyal fans is not an option. We will make Season Two!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know not everyone can donate to us, but maybe you know someone who can! Share, Share, Share! Spread the word to your friends and family (and coworkers, and pets, and imaginary friends,  and your dentist's receptionist, and all other acquaintances both casual and familiar).

      Support us in other ways here:

      • Subscribe to our Youtube channel to keep up with our content. And make sure to watch all 7 episodes of Season One!
      • Too excited to wait for your cool perks? You can get unique Bagged & Bored merch RIGHT NOW! At our Online Shop.
      • Follow us on your Social Media Channel of choice: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube
      • Check out The Destination Nation Network and their cool shows and podcasts to hear many exclusive interviews with the cast & crew.
      • For a "snapshot" of our seven-episode first season, check out our Trailer for Season One:

Factor in the combination of strong character performances with authentic pop culture references, and audiences were thrilled to see what would happen next. Don't believe us? Check out the trailer for Season One. And feel free to binge all 7 episodes back-to-back!
The show also resonated with many people in the Louisville arts community. Before we knew it animators, illustrators, musicians, costume designers, and dozens of actors were wanting to donate their skills to be a part of the series. This influx of talent helped shape the remaining episodes into what they are today. By the end of 2015, it became apparent that this was no longer a simple weekend hobby for a few people - it was a full on commitment, with a loaded arsenal of talent, and a super devoted fan base that craved more. If we wanted to continue the story at the pace and quality we set with our later episodes, then we would need a lot of extra help, resources, and most important of all, funding.


What We Need & What You Get
There’s a phrase we like to say about Pixel Brain projects: “It’s a labor of love, cause it sure ain’t a labor for money!”  We were fortunate during Season One to have had so many people who were passionate enough about the project to donate their time and skills. Cast and crew would skip meals, sacrifice sleep, miss out on opportunities at our day jobs, and we’d pay out of pocket for additional props and gear.  Our “guerrilla style” has led us to getting the most out of our creativity; heck we managed to shoot and produce SEVEN high quality episodes on a shoestring budget and lived to tell about it! We are positive we can achieve NINE epic episodes in Season Two with a bare bones budget of $12,000. This budget would be used for the following

Equipment/Lighting kits
Props and Set Construction
Wardrobe & Costuming
Locations
Catering (we'd really like to eat this time)
Hard drive/media storage
Commission artists for our original comic book title cards
Compensation for our loyal actors and the long crazy hours they give us

Oh, then of course there is YOU, the loyal backer! With your contribution you will receive NINE hilarious episodes of an awesome web series and the gratification of knowing that you’re helping to make Louisville a bastion for creative endeavors like this! Not to mention all the perks you can find in the sidebar!



The Impact
Bagged & Bored is more than just a web series, it has become a platform for many artists to get recognized for their talents and abilities. It has also provided them with opportunities to experience things they never thought they would… such as prancing downtown in a Power Girl costume or spending an entire day play-fighting in the wilderness! The potential for more episodes of Bagged & Bored is an exciting prospect for many comedians, actors, and artists who have yet to be involved in the show’s production but would very much like to!



Risks & Challenges
Just like any production, things can get delayed and shoots can be postponed due to factors beyond our control. As much as we'd love for Bagged & Bored to be our full time jobs, sadly it is not. We have and will continue to do our best to stick to a solid shooting schedule, but life and work can occasionally slow us down.
One major lesson we learned while filming the first season, is to film the entire new season all at once, as opposed to episode by episode. While we had a clear vision for Season One, it was still very much like paving a path as we walked it.  It became a start-stop process due to new talent or locations suddenly becoming available to us. In other words, we did not start Season One with all of our “tools in the toolbox.” This time we will!
Regardless of any setbacks we might experience, hard work and perseverance is what separated this show from many other passion projects. We always make sure to follow through, and we want to keep that momentum going by continuing the story we started in Season One. Disappointing ourselves and our loyal fans is not an option. We will make Season Two!


Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everyone can donate to us, but maybe you know someone who can! Share, Share, Share! Spread the word to your friends and family (and coworkers, and pets, and imaginary friends,  and your dentist's receptionist, and all other acquaintances both casual and familiar).
Support us in other ways here:

Subscribe to our Youtube channel to keep up with our content. And make sure to watch all 7 episodes of Season One!
Too excited to wait for your cool perks? You can get unique Bagged & Bored merch RIGHT NOW! At our Online Shop.
Follow us on your Social Media Channel of choice: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube

Check out The Destination Nation Network and their cool shows and podcasts to hear many exclusive interviews with the cast & crew.
For a "snapshot" of our seven-episode first season, check out our Trailer for Season One:

story:
Short Summary

The series is Created by Sian Laycock & Joel Stephen Fleming from 13th Street Films, an independent production company from Brisbane, Australia. We are huge fans of Australian comedy and are inspired to make the next great Aussie Comedy Series.

We need your help to make this heartwarming and hilarious story come to life. Your donations would create opportunities for dozens of passionate actors and hard-working crew members/filmmakers.

SERIES SYNOPSIS

Welcome to Wrigleton is a six part, half-hour comedy mockumentary, similar in format to shows such as The Office, or Parks and Recreation, but what makes it stand apart from these shows is its uniquely Australian quality. We follow Clint Wrigleton, the ineffectual, yet highly zealous Mayor of the fictional Australian town of Wrigleton.

Clint loves his town, his family; dispirited wife, Laura, and rebellious teenage son Max, and adores his people, the colourful ensemble of ‘Wrigletonian’s’. Their economy has previously relied on the passing tourists heading to the rivalling town of Lake Splendid. Unfortunately, a new highway upgrade redirecting traffic directly to Lake Splendid has meant that they are now dire straits.

This allows the perfect opportunity for Clint’s polar opposite, the suave and charming property developer, Gary Garrison, to swoop in from Lake Splendid and propose a brand-new Mega Mall development that would mark the end of Wrigleton as they know it.

Clint must battle against an ever-shifting public opinion as towns-people begin to fall to Garrison’s charm. He does so by coming up with a variety of schemes each more desperate and ridiculous than the next.

Set to the backdrop of a town event, be it the Bush Dance or the Rugby Cup, each episode follows a new attempt by Clint and his helpers to draw visitors to Wrigleton, from illegal highway diversions, to Ghost Tours and forged Banksy street art, all in an effort to save the towns economy, and, by default, it’s identity.

What We Need 

We need to raise $10,000 so that we can produce an industry level Television Pilot. Your donations would go towards gear, locations, transport and catering for the week long shoot.

What You Get

We have an array of amazing perks for fans and friends alike:

  • Advanced online Screeners
  • A ticket to the Premiere screening event THURSDAY AUGUST 8 2019 at New Farm Cinemas Brisbane
  • Wrigleton Worms team t-shirts
  • Become a featured extra in the Pilot
  • Score a walk on role in the Pilot
  • Become an Executive Producer

story:
SONNIGSBURG
a supernatural drama

Sonnigsburg is a mystery; a town in the woods that hasn't been visited for seventy years. Or so the legend goes. Nearby is the town of Mount Sunshine – and it’s there that our main character, Savannah, stops on her way to research Sonnigsburg.

Savannah’s ex, Jade, has called her out of the blue, eight years after breaking-up and desperate for help – but when Savannah arrives in town and her past begins to catch up with her, the history of the town begins to seep through the cracks and she realises that the residents of Mount Sunshine are all haunted in their own way.

Photo: Ann Truong as Savannah, episode 1 - Sonnigsburg

FROM RAGS TO FANCIER RAGS

                               
Rock Bottom Productions has gone from short films to two great seasons of webseries Going Our Way (Season 1 and Season 2) and now we are hitting the big time, C31. That's right, we're getting on TV.  

But we need your help to do it! 
Creator and Executive Producer Fiona Bulle is an award-winning feature film producer. She produced the film "41" and its director, Glenn Triggs, is shooting the pilot episode of Sonnigsburg.  



WHERE THE MONEY GOES

We will be updating you as we go as to where and on what we use the funds, including what we are up to in the filming process.

Specifically, we need your help to secure locations, make-up, fuel, equipment-hire, props, costumes and, most importantly of all... food!

But really, when it comes down to it ....you'll be helping us make sure that when this goes on TV in 2015, it looks, sounds and feels great! Your donations will help that.

NB:  The cast and crew are all doing this for free. All the hard work we are putting in is for us to gain valuable experience - and from the goodness of our hearts. Believe us when we say it's hard work because it really is, but it's also oh-so-much fun and extremely rewarding. But while we are working for nothing, some things still cost money.

Photo: Petra Elliott as Jade - episode 1, Sonnigsburg

CAST AND CREW

Everyone involved has donated so much time and effort and sleepless nights and crazy days to be a part of this fantastic production and we want you to know who they all are; we want you to know who you are helping.

CAST

Savannah = Ann Truong
Jade = Petra Elliott
Alfred = Don Bridges
Ashan = Dushan Philips
Frank = Ian Stenlake
Lily = Maree Shefford
Norman = Soren Jensen
Patricia = Nadia Andary
Matt = Gavin Williams
Kathleen = Juliene Vanner
Maxwell = Sam Eddy
Harrison = Dennis Manahan
Lucy = Daniela Lucchetti
Olivia = Eryn Saunders
Creepy Schoolgirl = Olivia Sprague
Michael = Ethan Oppy
Ivan = Josh McCraith
Anne = Michelle Dowling
Jessica = Olivia McCraith
Rachel = Gemma Matheson
Kyioshi = Chris Masters Mah
Terry = Marcus Schneider

CREW

Executive Producer/Writer(Ep1&5)/Camera = Fiona Bulle
Producer/Tech Director/Gaffer/Location Manager = Gordon Boyd
Producer/Script Editor/Production Manager/1st AD = Serenity DeAngeles
Writer(Ep3&6)/Producer = Keith Gow
Writer(Ep2&4)/Director(Ep3)/Editor/Producer = Alex Scott
Director(Ep2)/Producer = Meaghan Bell
Director(Ep1)/Camera/Editor = Glenn Triggs
Director(Ep4,5&6)/Editor = John Erasmus
Composer = Geoffrey Boyd
DOP = Bernard Winter
Camera = Aldi Godjali
Camera = Felicia Smith
Sound Designer/Mixer = Elliott Klein
Sound = Gillian Lee
Best Boy = Karla Engdahl
Runner/3rd AD = Caitlyn Barclay
PA = Ari Sgouros
PA = Sam Eddy
2nd AD = Legion
Accountant = Jeff Stricke

So as you see... lots of mouths to feed.


REWARDS

Give generously and get some great rewards! Check them out and decide what is right for you.

$5 - Thanks for the donation!
$10 - The Teaser
$20 - Sonnigsburg Badge
$30 - Behind the Scenes Polaroids
$40 - How about a MUG?
$50 - What a Gorgeous Cast!
$50 - DVD in your Collection!
$60 - Take Your Seat!
$70 - Get the SHIRT!
$80 - SIGNED DVD anyone?
$90 - How about a SIGNED Poster?
$100 - How about a SIGNED CANVAS?
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 1
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 2
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 3
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 4
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 5
$200 - ULTRA LIMITED 6
$350 - ULTIMATE PERK



CAN'T GIVE? THEN SHARE

If you can't contribute money, you can still help. 

Help us get the word out there via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, Word of Mouth, and even Carrier Pigeon if you know where to find a good handler.

Tell all your friends, family and colleagues and use the share buttons below.
Sonnigsburg will be Australia's first Supernatural show to hit TV! We want to make it the best we possibly can, and we will... but it will be so much better with your help!

And not only share with your circles but share what you have said and done back to us on Facebook. 
We love hearing what people are doing and saying about our fabulous project.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Darci Nalepa and Jessie Fisher.  We are local actors in Chicago.  This campaign is exciting and important to us because of the light we see ignited in our fellow female artists' eyes when we have pitched it.  We have gathered a diverse and extremely talented group of women for both on and off camera to help make this funny and unique comedy a reality. 

Our cast includes:

Jessie Fisher (Once, upcoming Harry Potter and the Cursed Child on Broadway)

Darci Nalepa ( Stephen Cone's Henry Gambles Birthday Party)

Sadieh Rifai (The Patriot on Amazon Prime)

Kristina Valada-Viars (Off Broadway, Steppenwolf)

Emjoy Gavino (creator of the Inclusion Project)

Cruz Gonzalez (Lela and Co. at Steep Theatre, The Chi)

Sasha Smith (Chicago PD)

Plus other talented, local actors

 

But we need your help for the final step of this project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

It is important to us to not only feature the work of the artists in this community, but to compensate them as well.  Often, we are asked to volunteer our time for the possibility of recognition.  The validation of compensation means something.  It says "your art means something, your time and energy are valuable".   But giving that validation requires some support.  Besides paying our artists, your contribution will cover all production fees.  This includes permits, props, costumes, union fees, post production editing and sound...the list continues to grow.   But we are excited to attack this challenge with professionalism and hopefully, your support!

The Impact

Your contribution would mean you stand with us when we say the voices of diverse women in the arts world are of value.   Does this world need more actors?  Maybe not.  But by donating to our project, you are saying the world needs more artists and leaders.  We may be making a comedic series here, but we are showcasing women as leaders on all fronts.  Any opportunity to demonstrate that in our world matters and you could be one of those leaders right now!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute to this project with financial support, but there are other ways you can help!  If you are interested in donating a meal, please contact us at ladycops17@gmail.com.  Also, please pass this site on to friends and family who you think would be excited about supporting this project!

story:
Welcome Adventurers!

About our web series: This D&D party needs to fill the place of a missing player. Unfortunately for them, each prospective player ends up being awful in some way. From meta-gaming to being straight up rude, D&D&D wants to explore each kind of awful tabletop RPG player that you'll probably encounter in your lifetime.

Dungeons & Dragons & Dumbasses is a short form web series dedicated to bringing this fantasy role playing game to life, embracing the good and the bad of the game, and contribute to the community of D&D players around the world. Our goal is to create entertaining stories with high production value and explore all the possibilities D&D offers for the screen. All the money we raise from this campaign goes into creating our episodes (everything from costumes, to props, to food and pay for our crew) and making this series possible.

 

Meet the Crew:

Cameron Melka: The Creator/Editor/Dungeon Master

 

Lizzy Stiller: The Director

 

Ethan Beretz: The Cinematographer

 

Katie Sarrels: The Producer

 

The Breakdown

Here's the deal. We've got the stories, and we're writing as many as we can. We just need enough money to take a break from our day jobs to film each episode. So here's what goes into each episode:

Equipment - $100 (We have most of it, but we'll need a few lights and sound equipment.)

Food - $250 (Survival purposes.)

Locations/Permits - $0 for the next episode, (but we may need some for future episodes.)

Actors - $500 (They gotta be convincing!)

Costumes/Props: $250 (Two new characters for the next one!)

Makeup: $100 (Because what's D&D if everyone is human?)

Crew: $600 (So they can afford to take the days off.)

Total: $1,800

So, we've set our goal for $2,000. If we do raise above the $1,800, it will go towards greater special effects, better costumes, etc. If we don't quite make the goal, the good news is we can still make it! But those same things will have to be reduced in quality. We want to make the best product we can, and we could not do it without your help, so we've come up with a bunch of cool thank yous if you donate. If you give $5, we'll shout you out because you're awesome! If you give $50, you'll get a signed character sheet from your favorite character! If you give $200, you get a free dice bag! And there are more gifts for all the donations in between. Anything helps!

 

What Perils Lie Ahead?

We want to make one of these a month. For the resources required, that's ambitious, but we believe we can make it happen. If we have to skip a month, we will, but we'd like to not have to. IF that is the case, we'll be sure to keep you updated every step of the way. 

The budget is somewhat flexible, so we can adjust our production to a certain degree. Our team has experience on a multitude of project types and know how much problem solving is a part of the job description. If there's a way to make the next episode, we will find it. We will make it. And it'll be glorious.

 

Roll Initiative!

We want to build a community around this project and what we do. If you like our content, want to share this campaign, put us on your Christmas wishlist, anything and everything helps!

We also understand if you're a bit short on gold or silver pieces, but you can help in other ways! Share us on social media. Tell your friends. Tell your enemies. Hell, even tell that weird guy that you sometimes play D&D with.

Reach out to us on Twitter, @DnDnDumbasses, if you have ideas, questions, or just want to say hi! We're just a group of people wanting to do something we love while creating something for others to enjoy, so if you like our stuff, we want to know!
