The budget is somewhat flexible, so we can adjust our production to a certain degree. Our team has experience on a multitude of project types and know how much problem solving is a part of the job description. If there's a way to make the next episode, we will find it. We will make it. And it'll be glorious.
 

Roll Initiative!
We want to build a community around this project and what we do. If you like our content, want to share this campaign, put us on your Christmas wishlist, anything and everything helps!
We also understand if you're a bit short on gold or silver pieces, but you can help in other ways! Share us on social media. Tell your friends. Tell your enemies. Hell, even tell that weird guy that you sometimes play D&D with.
Reach out to us on Twitter, @DnDnDumbasses, if you have ideas, questions, or just want to say hi! We're just a group of people wanting to do something we love while creating something for others to enjoy, so if you like our stuff, we want to know!

story:
MAXX

In high school my friend and I wrote a short story called "Maxx"that would send my school into a frenzy. I remember looking at the friend and telling her this could be a show! Only 6 years later its finally happening . With you help we can market the series and pay those who put time aside to create this show.

 

THE STORY OF SPELLBOUND

Spellbound, will put teens in real danger with real consequences with a splash of magic and the supernatural.

    Set in the town of Clifton, Spellbound follows Four  teens as they try to uncover the truth about themselves and their past.

    With this web-series the idea is to take a cinematic approach. By the end of each season the viewer will have a feature film to watch. Each character no matter how small has a large purpose in the series.

    This is a character driven show with an equal serving of emotion and action. The Core four group are Witches and Warlocks. With that said more supernatural beings will be making appearances in the show.

THE TEENS 

MAXX -sixteen, Maxx is  the youngest in the core group, but he doesn't show it. He is a definite nerd, he spends most of his time in button ups and khakis. He can tell you the radius of Jupiter, but he can't have any kind of normal conversation with anyone other than his friends. He is the leader of the core group of friends. Maxx is very powerful, sadly he doesn't know it. He practices Red Chaos Magic. This magic is even harder to control then Black Magic. He is always unsure of himself until he realizes how to use his magic.

 

ORA -seventeen, Ora is the most mature of the group, she wears black and has a gothic look. She has great one-liners and has a monotone voice. Ora practices Black Magic and has trouble controlling it. Ora becomes friends with Maxx in Preschool. They find out that they both practice magic in elementary,where they meet Danny. She has Maxx’s safety as her top priority at all times. 

 

DANNY-eighteen , Danny is the oldest of the group and the most immature. He wears anything flashy. He practices Yellow Magic. For his powers to work he needs to cypher from something or someone else. He is also cared for by his mother after his father dies. His mother is very protective of Danny, due to the way his father died. His dad was overwhelmed by his powers. Danny practices the same magic as his dad. This scares his mother so she tries to keep him close to her as much as possible.

 

Avasa -eighteen, Avasa is the half older brother of Maxx. He has a necklace that he can’t take off.  Given to him as a child by his father to protect him. He wears edgy clothes with eyeliner. He practices White Magic. This allows him to persuade anyone to do anything. In Avasa’s younger years he was abused by his foster parents. Due to this he doesn't let people get close to him and has a hard time trusting people. 

 

Harris Grey, eighteen, Harris works for his father. He will do anything to make him happy. So when Ora does a spell on him he recognizes it as magic and with his father's help goes after her and her friends. After a while he sees that his father is the problem. So he goes against him and joins the core group.

 

THE ADULTS

The adults in this show will not be the center of the show, but they will be very present.

 

Lisa, late 30’s - Lisa is the main caretaker for Maxx. She practices Green Magic. She takes her job of keeping Maxx very seriously. Lisa grew up in Clifton; she’s never left. She works at the local grocery store. Lisa is a witch, but only uses her magic when she must.

 

ROSE, early 30’s- Rose  “Woman In Red” is Lisa’s younger sister and Maxx’s mother. She practices Red Chaos Magic; her powers are usually too much for her. Rose wants to be a good person but she battles with herself. On the night Maxx was born she killed Roman’s wife and Avasa’s mother. This sends Roman into a rage, he decides to lock her away. He goes with her to insure she never leaves. While she is in the Contemporaneous she only gets angrier. She plots her revenge for when she gets free. When Maxx makes his way to her, she sees a way out.


Roman Krell , early 30’s - Roman was the head of the covenant. Roman can practice all magic, this makes him the most powerful warlock. He has an affair with Rose. When she becomes pregnant with Avasa he tries to get her to reverse it. Instead she hides the child from him. After finding out he doesn't love her and won't leave his family Rose loses her mind. He uses his magic to create an amulet to protect his son Avasa. After, he locks himself and Rose into the contemporaneous.

 

WISTERIA VICE,early 40’s - Wisteria practices Green Magic, she was Romans’s closest friend and after his disappearance she took over. She was good friends with Lisa and Rose and after finding out Rose is in the Contemporaneous she agrees to help Lisa get her out.

 

RICHARD GREY,  late, thirties - Richard (Mr.Grey)is Harris’s father . He works a secret organization that hunts witches.  After his son  runs into a witch (Ora) in school he helps him track down her and her friends.

 

THE TWISTED TWINS

The Twisted Twins are the children of Wisteria, they are both powerful on their own but unstoppable together. The two get their name due to them always being together and odd things happening around them. They are known to be very mischievous. 

 

Victoria Vice- seventeen, Victoria is a natural beauty, she practices Purple Magic. This allows her to control time and move through time when she wants. She can rip holes in time and space for a short period of time. Victoria is her brother's keeper. She always wants him to be calm to keep others safe. She is very close to her mother as well as a perfectionist. She becomes very close to Avasa and tries to figure him out. This makes her Brother a little jealous.

 

Victor Vice-seventeen, Victor is a very odd teen, he doesn’t like to talk to anyone other than his sister. He can control dark matter, death and is a telepath. He loves his sister and will do anything for her. She is the only one that can calm him down. He doesn’t like to share her and when he can he keeps her close. Victor’s abilities can be too much for him at times.

 

SPELLBOUND IN THE FUTURE 

Spellbound is meant and designed to last for generations, with enough story to last far longer than five seasons. The hypothetical seasons will follow the same teens as they find out more about themselves and their past as well as their future. Rose and Avasa would be anti-heros for the season; they join forces when they must, if they don't fight each other first. With Roman he will be coming as a man out of time. Each season would pose a new villain and problem for the teens to overcome. The seasons would run as a sequel,with it being one year later. Each season finale will end with a cliffhanger. Each character has the potential to have their own fan base just as the show does.

story:
We are revolutionizing TV watching. It is time to put the viewers as drivers and no longer passengers. The how of story telling has evolved starting with plain TV, then home video thru VHS & DVD, and now online streaming. Aside from the medium, the way in telling a story also changed when reality TV came into fruition. This passion project merged these two developments allowing our imagination to roam and challenge the possibilities of developing this new method.

This project aims to launch 6 episodes staring July 23. After every episode, the team only has one week to tally the votes, finalize the script, shoot and edit. This fundraising campaign will assist the team for a seamless production process and enhance the ability to deliver quality results. 

We want this to be a start of something new. Something that will enhance the viewing experience and take story telling to greater heights. We are inviting you to join the ride with us. 

Plot: 

Miguel is a customer service rep from Bakersfield who got laid off and sees this opportunity to pursue his fiery passion to be an actor. He has teamed up with his childhood friend, Aiden, a rapper wannabe who is based in Los Angeles. Both are equipped with perseverance, they go through the ropes of finding their voice in the internet sphere to be online superstars. 

Creators:

Adam: He began his love for performing while distracting himself from business studies at Temple University. There was an elective available in "Dramatic Improv" which caught his interest and ultimately, his soul. After graduating with a degree in marketing, he left Philly to pave his way as an actor. He recurred on the HBO series 'Getting On' where he played a medical resident. In 2016, he found UCB as his training ground to work on material and explore his creativity. Currently, he performs around LA with the indie team Happy Hooligans. He plays a variety of characters from the everyday man to the absurdist. His Tinder dates often wonder who he really is.

 

Rommel: He is a budding actor. His passion with acting and telling stories have been thriving since he was kid growing up in the Philippines. When he moved to the US more than decade ago, this passion has been growing. He finished the improv program at UCB and currently taking a 2-year Meisner program. 

The only way for this project to start a trend is to let everybody know that this is being made. Please share it on your social media, subscribe on our Youtube channel, and let the awareness begin. 

Thank you! :)

story:
Summary

Polk Fiction is a sitcom pilot written by Erik Deckers and Jack Lugar, and is produced by Toni Deckers. Erik is an award-winning humor columnist, novelist, and playwright, and Jack is a recovering Hollywood sitcom writer.

Our entire cast and crew are deeply committed to this project, but would greatly appreciate the help and support of our family, friends, fans, and fellow creatives. Your contribution allows us to not only make this project, but will allow us to push towards our dream shopping the series.

What the Show is About

Years ago, Alex Polk wrote the Great American Novel, Lost In Indiana, under a pen name, but when she realized it was going to make her famous, she decided to stay hidden by opening a bookstore, Polk Fiction. She's managed to keep her secret for several years, even keeping it from her family and closest friends. But her secret is threatened when she hires her idiot nephew to work in the bookstore.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $10,000 to produce the pilot episode of Polk Fiction. This will help us pay the cast and crew for their work on the show. Shooting is expected to take four days, and this will allow us to pay for everyone's time and skills.
  • We're offering several perks for supporters at every level, including shout-outs in the credits, copies of the book used in the show, and even a chance to attend the cast-only screening of the pilot.

The Impact

Film and TV has always had a home in Florida. Our community is filled with working actors who are highly skilled and well trained in their craft. We consider ourselves fortunate to work with such a talented group of people and have them be a part of our project. 

We want to help show that Florida has an excellent talent pool of not only actors and performers, but filmmakers, sound producers, and musicians. 

Polk Fiction is set in Indiana, where Erik and Toni both grew up. It was important for us to tell a story revolving around our home state and the charm that surrounds it.

Although this is their first sitcom, the two have successfully created business books, novels, albums, singles, and syndicated humor columns.

Risks & Challenges

This is Erik's and Toni's first sitcom, and we realize there are a lot of things we need help with. So we immediately recruited several experts to help fill in the gaps and consulted people who were more than willing to lend their expertise. We are so grateful to everyone for their advice and experience.

Erik's writing partner, Jack, is a former sitcom writer in Hollywood who now lives in Indianapolis. (He even ran for Congress once!) And our director, Stanley, and director of photography, Jared, have made several movies and TV shows; and our cast have been in a variety of movies, shows, and commercials.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help us out by sharing this on your social networks a few times or telling your friends in person. Ask them to support the show, share it, and tell their friends.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Meet the Cast

When Toni isn't acting or producing Polk Fiction, she spends her time performing as a jazz singer around Orlando, teaching musical theater and piano, working as a voice actor, and working with her music producer in LA, developing original songs.

 

A Florida native, Landon started acting in Orlando theatrical productions in the early 2000s, has since been in dozens of regional and national commercials, and most recently worked on the independent film, Critical Thinking, directed by John Leguizamo.

 

 

 

Bryan has been around the film and television industry since the age of 14, and not only discovered a passion for acting but for voice overs as well. Bryan built his own studio to record voiceovers from home, and loves to complain about the Orlando Magic in his free time.

 

 

Eden Shultz is an actor and writer, with her roots in the theater. She is best known for her work on The Right Stuff, Counselors, Anonymous (2019), Know the Signs (2015) and Burp (2016). She loves spending time with her dog, Baci, and is an expert at Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.

 

 

 

Born Dimitreus Castro in New York City, and raised in the Bronx, Demi discovered at an early age his lifelong passion for acting and singing. He is known for The Resident (2020), The Right Stuff (2020), Five Feet Apart (2019), MurderRx (2019), Arkansas (2020), Bloodline (2015) and Testament (2014).

 

 

 

Clint has been an entertainer starting when he was in school. While he started in musical theater, he has continued to pursue film and television. Clint also has had a radio and hosting career since he was a junior in high school but acting has always remained his priority.

story:
WHAT is this?

 Cathy in Real Life Season 2 is a live-action comedy web series parody of the classic Cathy cartoon strip.  

The original comic strip featured a working single woman struggling with the "four basic guilt groups" of life—food, love, family, and work. According to Wikipedia, "Cathy's characteristics and issues made fun and fed into negative stereotypes about women. "

Season 1 accumulated over 10,000 views on YouTube and was an official selection of several prestigious film festivals including Dances With Films, CineFest, IFS, and LA Comedy Fest.

      

 

WHAT is the plot?

After 34 years in the Sunday Funnies, Cathy was canceled! Ack! Now that she's updated her image she's ready to take on the world of on-screen acting! She's hired a documentary crew to follow her around and film her journey trying to crACK Hollywood. Why? Well, it worked for Lisa Kudrow on the Comeback! We'll follow Cathy with guest star roles on parodies of your favorite TV shows, from the BACKhelor to BlACK  Mirror. It's going to be ACKciting!

WHY is this important?

Are you tired of media that makes you feel bad about yourself? I can't read a magazine or watch a movie without  feeling ugly. If you're like me, you want entertainment that leaves you feeling better about yourself.  This is why we need Cathy! In comparison, she will make anyone feel better about themselves.

Also, there is an unfair representation of women in the Entertainment Industry.  The number of women working in film remains low, and the only solution  is to keep creating content by women and starring women.  The more people see women protagonists, the more they can re-train themselves to relate to women. This series is important because it creates roles for women. The cast is almost all female.  Also, this series explores the changing definition of feminism and the different opinions as to what should and shouldn't be considered funny and does it in a very fun, non-threatening manner. 

WHAT WE NEED!

We finished shooting but need funds for editing and festival fees! 

For every $300 we raise we can edit 1 episode. We have 10 episodes to edit. So we need to at least raise an additional $3,000

WHO are we?

Susan Sassi - Creator/Producer/Cathy IRL


Susan Sassi has been independently writing and producing for close to 8 years. Her musical, Victorian Courting and Zombies, ran at the 2014 Hollywood Fringe Festival where it enjoyed a sold-out run and was given a shout out on NPR and Lemon Lounge.  Some of her previous projects includes Cathy IRL Season One, Private Midnight, Lost Love Scenes, and Previous Tenants. Her projects were an official selection of Dances with Films, CineFest, IFS, LA Comedy Fest, Big Apple Film Fest, New Film Makers, andTwin Rivers Film Festival, where it won Fifth Place. 

Sara Werner - Director

Sara is an award-winning director whose work contains positive ulterior motives of helping others, with a strong focus on activism, feminism, gender and sexuality. She received her M.F.A. in Motion Picture ProductIon from the University of Miami after making her award-winning debut as a Writer/Director with her first short film AURORA. AURORA has screened at various venues around the world from Paramount Studios to Istanbul. She has directIng various music videos, web series and award-winning short films since, including a short with the University of Miami and the Stephen King FoundatIon. 

Kristina Adelmeyer - AD & Producer

Kristina Adelmeyer is a writer-director-producer.  Her credits include the live sketch show Top Story Weekly at the iO West theatre in Hollywood and the all-female video sketch show Trouble.  She loves chocolate and being a lady boss. If Cathy had worked for her, it would have been more happy wine moments and less of all that acking! 

Kate Huffman - Actress playing Charlene / Writer

Kate Huffman is an actor (Fresh Off the Boat, Castle) and writer whose most recent work is her award-winning, internationally-toured solo show I'm Too Fat For this Show. Her work has earned her an Encore Producers' Award, an LA Weekly Theatre Award, a Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle nomination, a Soaring Solo nomination, and Playhouse West Film Festival Award.

WRITING STAFF:

Kristin Clifford

Kristin Clifford is a writer and comedian in LA by way of Chicago. She has studied and performed at iO Chicago, Second City Chicago, and lots of other important places. She quit stand-up while at the top of her game for the deeper, more existential struggle of writing. And because open mics suck. Find her on Twitter at @kristincliff. 

 

Eve Esquire

Eve Esquire is not a lawyer but is a writer, a nationally ranked Poppy Princess, and a rejected audition on American Idol. She grew up in rural Idaho and came to Los Angeles to attend the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. Currently, she hosts a live streaming talk show using dolls called "8 Inches High."

 

Greg Goodness

Greg Goodness is a writer and performer whose sketches have been featured on Buzzfeed, Funny or Die, and Cheezburger. When he’s not at The Pack Theater, he hosts TV breakdowns on Maria Menounos’ AfterBuzz TV Network.  Geek and Sundry's GAME ENGINE has been kind enough to let him rant about video games as contributing writer. He believes that only cool people read the last sentences in bio blurbs.

 

Lira Kellerman

Lira Kellerman is an actress, author, storyteller, fire dancer, and screenwriter who can't seem to stop writing graphic sex scenes. She proudly impresses people with the fact that in a city of 4 million people, she ranked 11th at the inaugural Los Angeles Pun Off Competition, but always sheepishly admits there were only twelve competitors. 

 

Jackie Penn

Jackie Decembly-Penn is a writer focused on telling stories with more female protagonists. When she isn't writing she competes as an amateur pole athlete in Pole Dance Competitions.

 

Keith Saltojanes

Keith Saltojanes is a comedy writer currently creating pieces for National Lampoon's Final Edition Podcast. He holds the Guinness World Record for Longest Continuous Improv Show at 150 Hours (yes, that’s 7 straight days) and has taught workshops on creativity for executives at Netflix, Walt Disney, and overseas in Japan, China, Thailand, the UK, and France through the improv school he founded, Improv-LA.  Keith also really likes sushi, but his newly-acquired personal trainer says to stop eating it so much (he also realizes this was just the most LA sentence ever).

 

***************************************************************************************

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

We need $3,500 to complete editing.  Editor fees ranges are $30 an hour.  With an estimate of 8-10 -12 hours to edit each episode and there being a total of 11 episodes, the total we estimate comes to roughly $3,500

For every $300 - $360 we raise we will be able to edit one episode!!

What You Get:

Perks to get you excited and involved!

$5  Thank you!  A thank you shout out on social media!

$15 Make over!  We'll make you into a cartoon and post on social media!

$25 Dear Cathy. Personalized advice from Cathy. Just submit your question!  It's like Anne Landers but Cathy is responding. (Alternatively Dear Cathy's Mom is available if you prefer.). Will post and tag you on social media unless a hard copy is requested. 

$50 Cathy ACK! A personalized iPhone video from Cathy!! Posted on social media with you tagged. Have a question for Cathy? Want to watch her eat cake? Do you have any questions at all for Cathy? Just ask!  Your wish is her command! (within reason)

$100 Chocolate Chocolate Chocolate Ack!  An assortment of Lindor Truffles and Ghirardelli Chocolate Squares, serves 8 normal humans or one Cathy. (Include an extra $7 if shipping is required. Will be shipped in October when it's not 100 degrees out in LA)

Other Ways You Can Help

Subscribe to our Channel and watch season one on YouTube!

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help!

Spread the word!  Post on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Reddit, and anywhere else your heart desires! Use #cathyirl  and tag us Twitter: @sassers_  | Facebook: When Susan Calls | Instagram: Ackoholics

Favorite us! Click favorite on our Indie Gogo page!

Press! Put us in touch with any bloggers, sponsors, organizations or people who might be interested in helping promote this project!

Send chocolate!
story_txt: WHAT is this? Cathy in Real Life Season 2 is a live-action comedy web series parody of the classic Cathy cartoon strip.  The original comic strip featured a working single woman struggling with the "four basic guilt groups" of life—food, love, family, and work. According to Wikipedia, "Cathy's characteristics and issues made fun and fed into negative stereotypes about women. "Season 1 accumulated over 10,000 views on YouTube and was an official selection of several prestigious film festivals including Dances With Films, CineFest, IFS, and LA Comedy Fest.       WHAT is the plot?After 34 years in the Sunday Funnies, Cathy was canceled! Ack! Now that she's updated her image she's ready to take on the world of on-screen acting! She's hired a documentary crew to follow her around and film her journey trying to crACK Hollywood. Why? Well, it worked for Lisa Kudrow on the Comeback! We'll follow Cathy with guest star roles on parodies of your favorite TV shows, from the BACKhelor to BlACK  Mirror. It's going to be ACKciting!WHY is this important?Are you tired of media that makes you feel bad about yourself? I can't read a magazine or watch a movie without  feeling ugly. If you're like me, you want entertainment that leaves you feeling better about yourself.  This is why we need Cathy! In comparison, she will make anyone feel better about themselves.Also, there is an unfair representation of women in the Entertainment Industry.  The number of women working in film remains low, and the only solution  is to keep creating content by women and starring women.  The more people see women protagonists, the more they can re-train themselves to relate to women. This series is important because it creates roles for women. The cast is almost all female.  Also, this series explores the changing definition of feminism and the different opinions as to what should and shouldn't be considered funny and does it in a very fun, non-threatening manner. WHAT WE NEED!We finished shooting but need funds for editing and festival fees! For every $300 we raise we can edit 1 episode. We have 10 episodes to edit. So we need to at least raise an additional $3,000WHO are we?Susan Sassi - Creator/Producer/Cathy IRLSusan Sassi has been independently writing and producing for close to 8 years. Her musical, Victorian Courting and Zombies, ran at the 2014 Hollywood Fringe Festival where it enjoyed a sold-out run and was given a shout out on NPR and Lemon Lounge.  Some of her previous projects includes Cathy IRL Season One, Private Midnight, Lost Love Scenes, and Previous Tenants. Her projects were an official selection of Dances with Films, CineFest, IFS, LA Comedy Fest, Big Apple Film Fest, New Film Makers, andTwin Rivers Film Festival, where it won Fifth Place. Sara Werner - DirectorSara is an award-winning director whose work contains positive ulterior motives of helping others, with a strong focus on activism, feminism, gender and sexuality. She received her M.F.A. in Motion Picture ProductIon from the University of Miami after making her award-winning debut as a Writer/Director with her first short film AURORA. AURORA has screened at various venues around the world from Paramount Studios to Istanbul. She has directIng various music videos, web series and award-winning short films since, including a short with the University of Miami and the Stephen King FoundatIon. Kristina Adelmeyer - AD & ProducerKristina Adelmeyer is a writer-director-producer.  Her credits include the live sketch show Top Story Weekly at the iO West theatre in Hollywood and the all-female video sketch show Trouble.  She loves chocolate and being a lady boss. If Cathy had worked for her, it would have been more happy wine moments and less of all that acking! Kate Huffman - Actress playing Charlene / WriterKate Huffman is an actor (Fresh Off the Boat, Castle) and writer whose most recent work is her award-winning, internationally-toured solo show I'm Too Fat For this Show. Her work has earned her an Encore Producers' Award, an LA Weekly Theatre Award, a Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle nomination, a Soaring Solo nomination, and Playhouse West Film Festival Award.WRITING STAFF:Kristin CliffordKristin Clifford is a writer and comedian in LA by way of Chicago. She has studied and performed at iO Chicago, Second City Chicago, and lots of other important places. She quit stand-up while at the top of her game for the deeper, more existential struggle of writing. And because open mics suck. Find her on Twitter at @kristincliff.  Eve EsquireEve Esquire is not a lawyer but is a writer, a nationally ranked Poppy Princess, and a rejected audition on American Idol. She grew up in rural Idaho and came to Los Angeles to attend the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. Currently, she hosts a live streaming talk show using dolls called "8 Inches High." Greg GoodnessGreg Goodness is a writer and performer whose sketches have been featured on Buzzfeed, Funny or Die, and Cheezburger. story:
KING OF THE FLOOR is taking the book of challenges to Brisbane Australia. Australian Tricking Gathering (ATG) is the longest Australian running gathering. We will have the some of the world's best tricker present. Tricking is the most visually striking body movement art form.  We hope to create a show that is dynamic, realistic and true to the tricking community.

BAY AREA HUSTLE TEAM is a collective of passionate, likeminded artists who wish to use our various skillsets to promote our sport of tricking. We aim to produce the highest quality tricking content possible while maintaining the integrity and underground feel of the sport we love. We aspire to do this by combining our shared knowledge of tricking with our various other talents such as: graphic and clothing design, photography and videography, and music production to run our King of the Floor event and create an online content hub for trickers to enjoy and participate in contests for BAHT prizes.

KEENAN CARR - 


ISIAH FLORES - I'm a professional freelance Cinematographer, Steadicam Op, and Producer working out of the Silicon Valley in the Bay Area CA. As a young child, I discovered my father's 35mm still camera and Hi video camera in the early 90's. Inspired by action films, I started learning martial arts at age 7. At age 12 I created the world's first martial arts tricking team "Loopkicks" in 1999. Since then the sport has evolved into a worldwide community. As an 18 year old, I moved to SF to study at the Academy of Art University from 2004-2009 with a BFA in cinematography in the school of Motion Pictures and Television. Since then I have created award winning projects showcased in film festivals, national and international advertisements and branded content, documentaries, tv series, tv pilots, and feature films.

MARQUES MALLARE - I'm a freelance Producer, Director, Stunt Coordinator working out of Los Angeles. In 1995, my parents enrolled me in the Ernie Reyes' West Coast World Martial Arts Association where I trained, competed locally/nationally, taught, and met my group of friends that later became Team Loopkicks in 1999. I graduated from San Jose State University in 2013 with a B.S. in Advertising and a minor in Marketing. Since then, I have produced, directed, and performed stunts for short and feature films, TV series, music videos, and branded content.

FILM CREW - Each member of our crew has honed their skills as Camera Operators, Directors, Assistant Directors, Producers, and Editors working on a professional level. We have shoot for Vice, HBO, Forbes, Intel, Facebook, Samsung, HP, Converse, Diplo, Dillion Francis, E-40, North Face, Reebok, Foot Action, and many more.

Keenan Carr - Host, Producer, Director, Editor
Nelson Zuniga - Co-Host, Assistant Editor , Music Producer
Isiah Flores - Producer, Director, Camera, Editor , Music Producer
Marques Mallare - Producer, 1st AD, Camera
Deangelo Harding - Camera, Assistant Editor Jack Vu - Camera, Editor 
Mike Maguire - Camera, Music Producer
Andy Ngo - Camera, Photos, Assistant Editor 
Isne Bobo Nuyent - Camera, Editor 

King of the Floor is a true passion project. Watching the phenomenon of tricking grow into an international sport has been unreal. Our main goal is to create a game show platform that showcases the new art of tricking. For this season, we want to get personal with each team captain and their teams. We found that each tricker has an amazing story, this is something brand new, never done before.

Creating KOTF has been an incredible learning experience. Being a grassroots project, we have honed the format and feel of the piece. We have a solid plan of action. Your contribution will aid in creating the world's first tricking tv show!
 

What We Need & What You Get

We will deliver 5 episodes! Each profiling the Team Captains, and their teams. The Best of the Challenges, Best Fails, and the craziest tricks!

WE NEED FUNDING FOR
CREW
CREW TRANSPORTATION (FLIGHTS)
CREW AIRBNB / Interview Set
TEAM VANS, FOOD, GAS, EXPENDABLES
PRODUCTION INSURANCE
PRODUCTION- CAMERA, LENSES, LIGHTING, AUDIO RENTAL
MEDIA STORAGE
POST PRODUCTION
MOTION GRAPHICS
MUSIC, POST SOUND

PERKS!!!
EXCLUSIVE KOTF Shirts and Hoodies (Hot new designs and throwbacks)
KOTF x ATG Music Soundtrack (Music by all Tricker Music Producers)
BTS (We'll be capturing Behind the Scenes to bring you along for the good, bad and ugly)
PRE SCREEN (watch the series before anyone else)
BECOME AN ONLINE JUDGE (We'll send you the Nominations, your opinion counts!)

In the event of not reaching our goal- We will scale down the crew, loose the vans, and go with a barebones version of the series. We have mapped out the show to create the highest quality content, employing trickers and creating a genuine tricking show.

story:
In Garden District, you'll meet the voluptuous family members in all their beauty, piety, and defiance and watch them strategize over their inheritance. Learn how wills in the Big Easy can be changed on a dime.

A dark sway rains over the monied rich in this New Orleans world of Garden District. Each family member pursues a calling in real estate or art that has morphed into an obsession. The quest propels each to confront evil, out with the estate, or die in the process.

Garden District exposes rich, bizarre Southern characters caught in a dangerous pursuit that causes them to act in strange, eccentric and transformed ways to get money and sex.

In Garden District, you'll meet the New Orleans top drawer, in all their defiant and jaded sensuality. The people the great Louisiana hotels were built for, the lobbies showcasing the Mississippi River, the silver service steaming with jasmine tea, the harpist strumming the Clair de Lune. Peer behind the lace curtains into their hurtful world of betrayal and defiance.

In Garden District, you'll meet the New Orleans top drawer, in all their defiant and jaded sensuality. The people the great Louisiana hotels were built for, the lobbies showcasing the Mississippi River, the silver service steaming with jasmine tea, the harpist strumming the Clair de Lune. Peer behind the lace curtains into their hurtful world of betrayal and defiance.

story:
The Idea

Each episode of the series will center on one of the following characters:

Kyle: A centaur with the top half of a human and bottom half of a human (the horse is a recessive gene), struggling with imposter syndrome amongst the other mythics. 

Roger:  A wizard trying to find a community. 

X: A body-jumping spirit trying to find a sense of identity. 

Brad: A buff fairy dealing with with anxiety around his physical appearance. 

and Kate: A vampire struggling to overcome addiction. 

As they tell their story to the group, get advice, and go back out into the world. While the meetings will be a framing device, the majority of each episode will be spent with the characters as they navigate their problems. 

Each episode will adopt a style consistent with the themes of the episode, including noir, romance, and comedy. Overall stylistic influences include the implementation of mythical metaphors for human problems as seen in Buffy the Vampire Slayer, as well as the naturalistic, character driven sensibilities of indie film and TV. 

Who We Are

Max Rosenblum (writer/co-director) has written/directed/produced over a dozen short films since freshman year of highschool - many of which have been selected for the All American Highschool Film Festival and won Scholastic Art and Writing awards. He's currently a freshman at NYU Tisch, majoring in dramatic writing. 

Cameron Paradiso (co-director)  Has written/directed/produced a number of shorts since his freshman year of highschool.  He worked as the head of his school's school broadcast show. Worked for companies like Colgate, Amazon, Volkswagen, and Chicken Soup for the Soul on promotional material. Currently a Freshman at Tisch, Majoring in Film and Televison Production.

Sebastian Zufelt (producer) is a filmmaker from Seattle, Washington. After attending his high school’s digital filmmaking academy, he is now a student at NYU Film School (Class of 2024.) He has written/directed/produced films which have screened at film festivals across the country.

The rest of the cast and crew are composed entirely of students at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts for film, drama, or dramatic writing. 

Where the Money's Going

We are working hard to make this project as cheaply as possible, whether that means cobbling together production gear from our personal collections, asking actors to provide costumes, or begging friends and local organizations for shooting locations.

That being said, film production is always expensive. Costs will include :

  • Transportation and food 
  • Hair and makeup
  • Costuming
  • Gear rentals
  • Location rentals

Any amount you could give would go a long way towards making making this idea a reality. 

Risks & Challenges

We are starting production on this project in the midst of the pandemic, complying with the DGA guidelines for on-set COVID safety.  Additionally, we've written our scripts to be easily filmed while complying with restrictions. While the pandemic poses some significant challenges, we are confident in our ability to complete the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Nothing beats word of mouth when it comes to crowdfunding, so help spread the word - tell friends and family, share us on social media. 

Follow us on Instagram @mythicsanonymous to follow our progress. And if you or someone you know has an apartment we can shoot in, let us know at mythicsanonymous@gmail.com.

story:
Introduction

Hi! We are Amanda Friedman and Kelsey Sullivan, creator and producer, respectively, of Character House.

Character House is an adult animation episodic series about two childhood best friends, Daniel and Vika, who are now grown up, who, after a machine malfunction, move into a house with their created childhood Characters who have come to life. However, they are not what they dreamed as children and, because of the malfunction, the Characters have been corrupted by the adult world. These Characters include, but are not limited too, a lazy alcoholic dog/chameleon hybrid, an attention-seeking doll with a love for violence and sexual deviance, and a block-art dinosaur who shoots fire out of its block boob. With the assistance from a bizarre and stubborn billionaire, who hopes to profit off the Characters, they all work together to create an attraction called “The Character House." And so, Vika and Daniel must learn to live among their creations and discover why nostalgia is best saved for the past.

This concept first came to me (Amanda) after revisiting some of my own childhood drawings. Seeing them, I felt nostalgic, but I also found it strange how weird/inappropriate/depressing the drawings were to me now.  This gave me the idea to develop a show that pokes fun at nostalgia and highlights how things from our childhood change when they are viewed through the lens of an adult.

After developing a pilot in the summer of 2020, we are now looking to create a 5 minute proof of concept that is representative of the show. But to do that we need to gather the resources necessary to present this concept in a way it deserves to be shown. So now, we are looking to YOU to help us make this a reality. 

What We Need

We are planning to have three campaigns over the course of this production: pre production, production itself, and post production.

This campaign is strictly for the preproduction process. This includes hiring a character designer, set designer, storyboard artist, and editor. We are looking to raise $600 to pay our preproduction team for their hard work.

The Impact

Your contribution will help make this proof of concept a reality. This money will set the stage for us to share this idea with the world, first with the proof of concept, and later on (hopefully) a full pilot. 

Risks & Challenges

Because this is an ongoing campaign, your funds may be used at some point in one way or another towards the project. 

We already have our pre production team assembled and committed. Now it's about funding this first step. 

What's nice about animation is that it can be done remotely, and therefore we will not be restricted or shut down due to COVID-19. 

However, we aim to be transparent, so if any problems arise in the future, we will keep you updated.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, not everyone will be able to contribute. And that's okay! So here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, family, and other artists
  • Follow us on Instagram @characterhouseshow

Thank you for reading and we hope you support Character House :)
story_txt:
Introduction
Hi! We are Amanda Friedman and Kelsey Sullivan, creator and producer, respectively, of Character House.
Character House is an adult animation episodic series about two childhood best friends, Daniel and Vika, who are now grown up, who, after a machine malfunction, move into a house with their created childhood Characters who have come to life. However, they are not what they dreamed as children and, because of the malfunction, the Characters have been corrupted by the adult world. These Characters include, but are not limited too, a lazy alcoholic dog/chameleon hybrid, an attention-seeking doll with a love for violence and sexual deviance, and a block-art dinosaur who shoots fire out of its block boob. With the assistance from a bizarre and stubborn billionaire, who hopes to profit off the Characters, they all work together to create an attraction called “The Character House." And so, Vika and Daniel must learn to live among their creations and discover why nostalgia is best saved for the past.
This concept first came to me (Amanda) after revisiting some of my own childhood drawings. Seeing them, I felt nostalgic, but I also found it strange how weird/inappropriate/depressing the drawings were to me now.  This gave me the idea to develop a show that pokes fun at nostalgia and highlights how things from our childhood change when they are viewed through the lens of an adult.
After developing a pilot in the summer of 2020, we are now looking to create a 5 minute proof of concept that is representative of the show. But to do that we need to gather the resources necessary to present this concept in a way it deserves to be shown. So now, we are looking to YOU to help us make this a reality. 

What We Need
We are planning to have three campaigns over the course of this production: pre production, production itself, and post production.
This campaign is strictly for the preproduction process. This includes hiring a character designer, set designer, storyboard artist, and editor. We are looking to raise $600 to pay our preproduction team for their hard work.

The Impact
Your contribution will help make this proof of concept a reality. This money will set the stage for us to share this idea with the world, first with the proof of concept, and later on (hopefully) a full pilot. 

Risks & Challenges
Because this is an ongoing campaign, your funds may be used at some point in one way or another towards the project. 
We already have our pre production team assembled and committed. Now it's about funding this first step. 
What's nice about animation is that it can be done remotely, and therefore we will not be restricted or shut down due to COVID-19. 
However, we aim to be transparent, so if any problems arise in the future, we will keep you updated.

Other Ways You Can Help
We get it, not everyone will be able to contribute. And that's okay! So here are some other ways you can help:

Share this campaign with your friends, family, and other artists
Follow us on Instagram @characterhouseshow

Thank you for reading and we hope you support Character House :)

story:
The Sinza Project

Thank you, Friends, for landing on our page. Without the encouragement and support from many of you over the years, we would not be where we are today.

We are the Sinza Team: a team of young entrepreneurs, animators, nutritionists, and public health professionals, working hard to empower the vision of a healthy and knowledgeable community.

“Prevention is better than treatment.” If this statement holds true, then the biggest challenge concerning health today is an information gap. Uganda has an abundance of local nutritious foods. Yet families still suffer from poor feeding and malnutrition, infectious diseases, and a general lack of fitness.

Over the past 4 years, we have worked hard to produce a nutrition education video to show in communities & schools around Kampala, Uganda. The showings have developed into Sinza Clubs where school-age students and groups in underprivileged communities are receiving ongoing practical training by nutrition students from university programs in Kampala.

We tell stories through animation for community health education in Uganda.

Through animation, the videos we produce offer a visual context for health education that dive deeper into why healthy behavioral choices are vital. Through stories, educational information is presented in a relevant, cultural context that engages the community's attention. Our characters mirror the lives of their audiences to model behavior around situations with which they can identify.

Here, Jajja (Grandma) is teaching Sinza how to catch flying ants which are an important source of protein and are a low-cost food source in the Ugandan diet. - A shot from our next video which is still in slow production.

Why Did We Choose To Start With Nutrition Education?

Nutrition status in Uganda

Malnutrition is associated with 47%of child deaths in Uganda and almost quarter of all maternal deaths. The consequences of malnutrition, such as impaired mental development, affect school performance and reduce Uganda’s ability to educate the next generation, contributing to low school completion rates.

The causes of malnutrition in Uganda are manifold: Repeated infections (including acute respiratory infections, diarrhea, and malaria) and suboptimal breastfeeding and Infant and Young Child Feeding practices that result in inadequate dietary intake are immediate causes of malnutrition.  The underlying causes of malnutrition include lack of safe water, poor hygiene and sanitation; food insecurity; high fertility; gender inequality; and poverty. Malnutrition in Uganda is a complex problem that persists due to multiple causes rooted in various sectors. This therefore, in addition to nutrition specific interventions, multi-sectoral nutrition-sensitive interventions are also essential to reduce and eradicate malnutrition in Uganda.

Reference 

Reducing malnutrition inUganda: Estimates to support Nutrition Advocacy Uganda profiles 2013 

Nutrition Advocacy and communication strategy for the Uganda Nutrition Action Plan 2015-2019

The Cost

We want to raise $100,000 so that we can produce an entire 12-episode series on nutrition topics in 5 different languages to serve communities all over East Africa. The money will cover our animation team to produce the 12 videos, our administrative team in Uganda, Indiegogo platform costs, and gifts for our donors .

Current Costs of Production

22,000,000 UGX per episode

x

12 episodes

=  264,000,0000 UGX

($71,350.00)

($9,000) Indiegogo Fee (9%)

($10,000) Thank you gifts + shipping (Estimating $10-$20 per backer)

(~$10,000) Hiring 2 managers for Sinza clubs & administration for one year

= Approximately $100,000 (costs are estimated according to number of backers predicted)

What exactly is all that production money for?

Employment:

  • 1 director
  • 1 project manager
  • 5 animators
  • 1 technical director
  • 10 voice actors (5 languages + 2 characters per episode minimum)
  • 2 artists (concept & composting)
  • Dietitians- professional consultants

> 20 personnel per episode (2 months production time)

Approximately, 40 employees hired full-time consistently over a one-year period.

Where you come in:

We are asking 5 different communities to sacrifice to make this important work happen:

  1. $30- Support Sinza
  2. $50- I care about kids & families
  3. $100- Registered Dietitians & Health Professionals
  4. $1,000- Families traveling to Africa
  5. $2,000- Service/Mission trip Groups

As a token of our appreciation for your generous donation, we will be sourcing small gifts such as chocolate, coffee beans, soaps, and greetings cards made in Uganda by our friends at Moonbean Chocolate and BaMatooke Made, organizations who are also working to make a positive impact.

Our dreams are big and we hope to meet our goal so we can produce the entire first series. If we fall short of our goal, the money raised will still be used towards the production of as many videos as we are able to make.

More About Us

The Sinza Project is a social enterprise. We aim to impact preventative healthcare transformation in underserved populations by capturing health education into simple, interactive, visual formats that can be easily understood by the common or uneducated individual. 

In Uganda, there is a lack of access to information and educational resources. We have created a fictional, animated, Ugandan girl-child named Sinza who teaches her community how to maintain a better quality of life. All of our education materials center around the Sinza character.

Talented, young Ugandan animators and character artists gather together to produce the story and visual content that are the Sinza videos. Scripts are written by university student groups brought together from departments specializing in health related research. Together, they create culturally relevant stories that are interwoven with educational information for preventative healthy behavior. Throughout the process, faculty and community health professionals are involved in reviewing the content to insure that our curriculum is meeting professional standards. Voice actors bring the characters to life for the animation videos.

Our videos become available to the community in a variety of languages for personal purchase, for use in outreach programs, school curriculum, or for tv licensing, making Sinza videos accessible to as many people as possible.

 

Education

The Sinza Project produces educational animation videos to address the major health and social concerns facing families in East Africa today. The animation video series will provide communities with relevant and easy to understand health education. We hope to accomplish this by providing each video in as many languages as possible so that communities can learn in their most familiar language.

Sinza will educate the community from principles of reasoned action, effective behavior modeling, and self-efficacy with the intention of influencing common attitudes already established regarding health concerns, preventative care actions, and resources.

We will measure the success of this goal by how many organizations are using the Sinza videos as their tool for education and by monitoring behavioral change within a community group through regular assessments.

Innovation

The Sinza Project will create opportunities for university students to engage with their community by contributing up-to-date research on preventative health behavior.

Primary schools and secondary schools can engage in serving their communities as well by designing unique projects that promote healthy living in their communities based on what they are learning from the Sinza videos.

Local Resources

The Sinza Project promotes healthy living based on locally available resources. It addresses the question of how a community can maintain a healthy quality of life based on materials that are locally available, indigenous, and/or easily accessible.

Economic Sustainability

In order to create a more sustainable solution for existing community needs, The Sinza Project is structured as a business model. The health education tools produced are marketed for sale to generate income that supports continued administration and production costs of the company. Employees are recruited from the Ugandan national community.

Animation videos are created by Ugandan illustrators and animators, collaborating together specifically for The Sinza Project.

The Sinza Clubs employ Ugandan students and consulting health professionals to conduct outreaches for health education through schools and community organizations.

Generosity

The Sinza Project utilizes collective action from the local level to effect change. Members of the local community are encouraged to contribute by taking active responsibility for their community’s growth.

At the start of our company, all participants have served on a voluntary basis. Initial start up costs have been generated by crowd-funding from members of the Ugandan community.

Community Reinvestment: As The Sinza Project generates income above supporting continued administrative and production costs, all profit is reinvested into community outreach programs promoting and empowering community well-being.

Our Audience

Families from different social groups, economic levels, and tribes in East Africa will benefit as we expand the variety of materials and languages offered. For now, we are focusing on nutrition topics which are vital for Uganda. 

The project will benefit the Ugandan economy as we collaborate with local businesses for the whole production process.

 

 

In everything, there are challenges and risks. We take challenges and failures as opportunities for innovation. Our team has been dedicated on a voluntary basis for 4 years- we have faced political turmoil in the country, economic instability, fluctuating team members, and a staggering lack of resources. These challenges have only helped to shape our characters and our content, and define the dedication of our team. As an example, our animation team has developed a mixed media 2D/3D concept specifically to lower costs because we realized we couldn't meet the cost of producing a completely 3D set.

 

If you cannot contribute, we understand. We know it doesn't mean you don't love us. Please share our page with your friends and family. Share it on social media. If you know groups or organizations that may be interested, we are happy to connect. 

 

Thank you, Friends. We are truly grateful. xxx

story:
About the Show

Our story takes place in Hathaway, Rhode Island, where William Williams, a beloved Hathaway University employee and paranormal investigator, has been mysteriously murdered. Freshman Jordan Greene has lived in Hathaway her entire life and grew up with Williams as her mentor. She vanishes in the wake of his disappearance, leading her friends Casey, Paige, and Kyle to fear the worst. As Jordan's friends search for her, decoding messages left by Williams' ghost along the way, they uncover a larger conspiracy that holds the truth about Jordan's disappearance. 

The show will consist of six 15-minute episodes and deal with themes of grief, friendship, and community. The Legend of South Hill will premiere on Ithaca College Television and ictv.org this December. 

About the Producers

Jennifer Walsh is a senior Television-Radio major and Theatre minor at Ithaca College, and executive producer of The Legend of South Hill. A winner of the 2017 New York Women in Communications Scholarship and the Rod Serling Scholarship for Outstanding Creative Scriptwriting Ability, Walsh is currently interning with the Emmy-nominated StarTalk Podcast Network. Her previous roles on Ithaca College Television include associate producer of The PAs and staff writer on After Hours and The Week That Was. A dedicated producer and media scholar, Walsh has worked previously with the Tribeca Film Institute, presented academic work at national conferences, and appeared on Today and in The New York Post. She loves waffles.

Hannah Paquette is a junior Television-Radio major and Theatre minor at Ithaca College, and writer, director, and executive producer of The Legend of South Hill. She is the artistic director of IC Second Stage, the college's newest theatre organization, and has directed stage productions of Heathers the Musical and Little Murders. Paquette has held numerous positions at American Repertory Theatre in Cambridge, MA, most recently serving as an Education and Community Outreach Fellow. She traveled to Ireland this summer to produce videos and assist in event production for the Galway International Arts Festival. A versatile media artist, Paquette served as artistic consultant to Ithaca College's Macabre Theatre Ensemble and has worked on Ithaca College Television as assistant producer of After Hours, assistant director of Handle with Care, and in on-camera roles for Power Down, The Soapiest, and The 607. She has received the Flora Brown Award and has too many Dunkin' Donuts rewards points.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to feed our cast and crew, buy props, costumes, and makeup, and to cover the costs of miscellaneous production expenses like batteries and gaffer's tape. College students eat a lot, which is why food is our biggest expense. Since we're a supernatural drama, a lot of our other expenses involve practical effects, props and set pieces, and costumes – things that help us tell you a more engaging story. The rest of our budget is dedicated to covering any equipment costs that may arise.  Every dollar you donate helps our crew work harder and our show look better. 

To thank you for donating to our project, we've put together some spook-tacular perks for every donation level, including exclusive digital content, posters and T-shirts, props, and the chance to be on the show! We're so grateful for your support and can't wait to share this show with you.

The Impact

By supporting this project, you're helping a team of young filmmakers create something truly special. Ithaca College Television is the oldest college television station in the nation, yet supernatural shows are few and far between in the network's history. As the genre experiences a resurgence thanks to show like Stranger Things and Twin Peaks, we're providing talented students with the opportunity to push creative boundaries. Your donation will have a tangible impact on the quality of our show, and allow us to focus on making the best possible end product for viewers like you. 

Risks & Challenges

Making a television show isn't easy, but we're working hard to mitigate the risks associated with this project. Here are some of our biggest challenges:

  • Weather – If you've ever visited Ithaca, you'll know the weather can be finnicky. While we intend to shoot several scenes outdoors, we also have backup indoor locations that make sense for the story we're telling.
  • Effects – We intend to use practical special effects to visualize the ghost in the show. The use of these effects will be carefully rehearsed, minimizing costs and logistical issues.
  • Scheduling – College students are busy, but we intend to follow our well-planned production schedule to produce our show on time and on budget. We believe communication and trust are essential to the success of any team, and will continue to communicate clearly with all members of our cast and crew about any issues that may arise during the course of production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, your support would still mean the world to us. Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and follow our social media pages for updates on production and our premiere this winter!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LegendofSouthHill/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/LegendofSHill

story:
Sucker has a trio of horror enthusiasts who are working to make their vision come alive! 

Here's some more info on our Executive Producers:

Daniella Baltazar, Technical EP

Daniella is a filmmaker from Houston, Texas. In college, she is a member of the Honors Program, SGA, and Delta Kappa Alpha. In the past year, she received an EVVY for “The Haunted Hour,” a supernatural podcast, and received an EVVY nomination for “Emerson’s Finest.” Daniella’s passion and excitement for “Sucker” comes from a deep love for all things supernatural and creepy. She’s excited to co-produce this with Brett and Sharon, whose passion and excitement rivals her own.

Brett Boon, Director/Logistics EP

Brett is a creator from New Jersey, who produces, directs and markets film and television. He received praise for his short film “Prom?”, which was recently featured on the “Love, Simon” DVD release. His last project “Drag Mother” was nominated for "Outstanding Advertisement" and won for “Outstanding Intermediate Film" at the 38th Annual EVVY Awards. Through his work, Brett strives to create media that dares to challenge and inspire others to see a more inclusive future. He hopes to bring this element to the horror genre.

Sharon Zhitnik, Writer/Creative EP

Sharon is a Russian-Jewish screenwriter who is eager to co-produce her first show. She recently just got back from the Screenwriters Program in Greece, where she finished writing her first feature, a zombie comedy. From an early age, she has always enjoyed watching supernatural films and is extremely excited to have the ability to create her own. When writing for “Sucker”, she kept in mind the importance of representation in media and hopes that anything she works on can bring about a positive message.

Keep up with us on our Facebook page!

 

Locations: Sucker uses a large number of locations throughout the city of Boston. We need permits and to pay location fees for spaces that will make our show feel as authentic as possible. The central location of the show, Dusk Nightclub, is something that we want to film at a local Boston nightclub during the day. We also plan on being economic and using spaces on campus to transform into certain locations as well.

Special Effects/Visual Effects: We are so excited to be hiring a team of SFX makeup artists who will help us with the practical effects that our show has. Sucker needs to have fangs, blood, and wounds, which will be done through the talent of our makeup team. We really need tons of gallons of blood (fake blood) and with your donation (money, not blood), we can get to our desired amount! We also plan on hiring a team of VFX artists who will help us animate the social media elements to be seen onscreen.

We will need tons of fake blood!

Transportation: For off-campus locations, our crew needs to be able to get there with our equipment safely. When we are not transporting via the T, we want to be able to pay for the Ubers that will help us move from location to location. 

Distribution: While developing Sucker, we took a deep dive into horror-centric film festivals and curated a list that we believe would be the best for our show. Film festival submission fees can be free for students at times, but can also go up to the $100 range, depending on the specific festival. By creating this show, we are expanding our portfolios for future employers and audiences and by having a sound distribution budget, we are able to expand our visibility.  

 

Though we know this show is going to be chaotically fun and wild, we do not want to leave out the more serious elements that at also at the core of our horror comedy.

Sucker focuses on Becca, a bisexual vampire who has been around for a century and ends up in a relationship with nightclub waitress, Portia. The serious part of this relationship is that we do not want these characters to only be defined by their sexuality. We want Sucker to be unapologetically queer. The horror genre is a territory that we think LGBTQ+ representation could use some improvement in. More often than not, queer characters are put to the sidelines or only characterized by their queerness. The Becca/Portia storyline brings positive representation front and center.

With Sucker, we are telling a femme fatale story in the #MeToo era. We want Becca's character to transcend sexist stereotypes of this archetype character by using her power to take down oppressive forces and creep behavior that plague many women today in the digital dating scene.

 

We are creating something that requires a lot of locations and special effects work, so being fully funded provides us with enhancing the level of production we can provide. Sucker also mostly takes place at night, so we want to ensure we are filming in safe locations with supervision when needed.

Our campaign is at a fixed goal, which means if we do not raise our goal, we do not receive any funding. We want to be able to use this campaign to secure the locations/effects we need, as well as connect with our supporters with exclusive Sucker perks. 

 

If you can't donate, a share of this page is just as impactful! Spreading the word on social media, or even just telling your family and friends about Sucker raises awareness of our project and all we offer. Help bring our series to life!

Thank you so much, 

Sucker EPs

Our Facebook.

Our Instagram.

story:
Writer/Producer Hillary Esquina was inspired after going to ClexaCon in 2017, and hearing Emily Andras (showrunner for Wynonna Earp and Lost Girl)’s call for action, to focus more on writing and telling LGBTQ stories. A few months later, tellofilms posted about their Pitch to Production contest, which specifically supports upcoming filmmakers and writers who want to make content for the lesbian community. Hillary entered the contest with an idea she had written down on the plane ride home from ClexaCon and it won! Christin Baker, CEO of tellofilms, mentored and worked with Hillary, and at ClexaCon 2018 Passage had a staged reading with actresses. Now we are ready to start production to bring you this fantasy genre series with a lesbian lead who is a mom and a veteran, a unique love story, and some surprising twists.

 

Shannan Leigh Reeve

Shannan is an actress, director, and editor living in Los Angeles. She started off in live-action stunt shows like Batman Forever at Six Flags, and Waterworld at Universal Studios Japan. After moving from NYC to Los Angeles, she has worked in various capacities, including appearing in tellofilms original web series I HATE TOMMY FINCH, COWGIRL UP, and Hardly Working Entertainment’s digital series ENTANGLED WITH YOU. She also appears in the award-winning feature film, PENUMBRA, available on Amazon Video.

Nicole Pacent

Nicole Pacent is an actress, producer, Youtube & Podcast host, and activist living in Los Angeles. She is best known for ANYONE BUT ME, JEN FOSTER:SHE, and tellofilm's I HATE TOMMY FINCH. She currently co-hosts a podcast called "Coming Out with Lauren & Nicole", and recently did a play called BEST FRIEND  at Hollywood Fringe.  

Kitty Swink

Kitty is an actress and producer living in Los Angeles. She is best known for roles on STAR TREK: DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5, SOUTH OF NOWHERE, and THE FOSTERS. She was recently in the award-winning feature film PENUMBRA and is a producer on tello film's RILEY PARRA. In addition to film and television, she has performed in theaters across the country and is currently Co-Artistic Director of Antaeus Theatre Company.

Ian Ampoyo

Ian Ampoyo is an actor and voice actor living in the Washington D.C. area. His film credits include shorts such as BURNT TOAST, DISREGARDED, SAD, and MITTENS. He has done voice-over work for Porter Cables, the University of Maryland Terrapin Football team, and ABC/Disney. 

 

Writer/Creator/Producer: Hillary Esquina

Hillary is an award-winning storyteller, but first time series writer and producer. She started off in post-production and content creation, then made the transition to content marketing and strategy. After being inspired to create more content for her community, she started writing again in hope to bring more strong and complex LGBTQ stories to screens.

Director/Executive Producer: Christin Baker

Christin is an award-winning director and Emmy nominated producer.  She co-founded tellofilms out of passion to provide modern and relevant lesbian-focused stories for the under-served lesbian community. With 15 amazing and original tello-produced projects under her belt, including RILEY PARRA and MAYBELLE, and just as many in various levels of pre and post-production, Christin is determined to provide the lesbian community with the quality entertainment that they deserve and the stories that they crave. 

Director of Photography: Jaclyn Chessen

Jaclyn Chessen is a filmmaker, artist, and owner of To-Enfro Productions based out of the Los Angeles area. Originally from the Bay Area where she got her first taste of indie filmmaking, her work in the industry spans over 15 years, from her beginnings in publicity for Miramax to years of making indie magic. She is currently shooting a series POV: IN THE SHADOWS and just finished as Director of Photography for the short film DIAL M FOR MORON and the series INDIGNATION. 

 

We understand that not everyone can contribute, or if you have already and want to do more,  there are other ways you can help!

  • Follow us on Twitter, and invite your friends to follow, like tweets, and share them! 
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Share this campaign, using the buttons on the top right, on your social media accounts. 
  • Email this campaign to people you think may want to know more, may be interested in the project, or may be able to donate.

Social media amplification is a huge help and so is talking about the project with those in your life! Every little bit helps, no matter a donation or a tweet. Help us get the word out about Passage!

story:
Short Summary

  • Currently I am a college senior at the New York Film Academy. Over the past year I have written and created the world for this pilot episode. This will be my thesis for my BFA degree, but I aim to continue making the series once I have graduated college in September. 
  • This pilot is important because it touches on many themes such as gender, religion and science. 
  • The campaign will give me the money to pay the crew and cast along with other costs such as food, transportation, costume and props. The money will help me from all production to post production aspects. 

Why Now?

    The technology for engineering a child is in the near future. Within the next 100 years scientists will be able to engineer/modify children to help with long term hereditary diseases. However, if you can change one aspect of a child's DNA you have the ability to change anything. The science behind this started to come up socially in 2015. 

    The technology to create the perfect child will only be available to people who can pay a minimum of 50,000 dollars. This could be a future where the rich have perfect children, and the poor can only have natural born. This is an interesting topic to me because of how controversial this is. On one hand people want to explore the possibility of engineering a child while on the other it could be interfering with Gods plan.

The World 

    The world is separated between the elite community and the poor. Elites have an unlimited food supply, access to amazing technology, while the poor work hard jobs and starve. You can only have an elite child if you have enough money to engineer them. However, it is next to impossible for families in the poor communities to save enough money to have their children engineered.  

    All children in this world will go to school with each other until 6th grade which is when they have to take an end of year test. If you pass you can continue on to the next grade and live within the society, but if you don't you are forced out. Because of the intellectual advantage engineered children have, by the time the kids reach High School most of the natural born children  are weeded out, except the occasional prodigy. This world will explore what it means to be a teenager growing up in a dystopian society.

What We Need

$1,200: Cast & Crew Expenses - We need to make our budget so we are able to pay our hard working cast and crew. This will also include the price of equipment.

$500: Location - We are shooting in a very nice house and need the money to rent the location for the day. 

$150: Permits & Truck Rental- In order to make this pilot a success we need to have the proper money to get a truck and film permit. In order to load the equipment to and from the location we will need to get a U Haul, the budget will help secure this rental.

$75: Set Design & Costume - We need to have four different costumes for the actors in the shoot. The characters in this pilot are wealthy and we will need the money to help that image come onto screen. 

$75: Food & Beverage - We are getting lunch for all of our cast and crew which can add up. This money will go towards providing lunch and dinner for everyone on set. 

Perks

  • Facebook Shout Out
  • Blooper Footage 
  • Downloadable link of poster
  • Engraved cutting board 
  • Writing Consultation
  • Day pass at Korean Spa 
  • Day on set with cast & crew
  • Walk on pass for the premier at Warner Brothers Studios! 

Our Team

  • We have a talented group of crew members including, Director of Photography Rafael Rivera whose film The Red Oak has won over 10 awards and director Jocelyn Contreras; who is an inaugural member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts' coveted Gold Program.

Other Ways You Can Help!

I understand if you aren't able to donate.  First of all I want to say thank you for looking at my campaign and I hope that you will watch the pilot when it comes out!

  • If you feel inspired please share our campaign. Not only is that a great way to get other potential donors, but it helps to spread the word in order to create an audience. 
  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share our campaign via social media. 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge we face is getting the money we need to make this project. It is an ambitious pilot that will create a new world that people haven't seen yet. In order to do that we will need extensive costume and location design to help set this world in the future compared to looking modern. 

  • Because of the passion I have put into creating this project and the talented crew who have been hired, I know we can make this pilot a success. As every crew member comes on board they add their own creative spark which helps to make this project unique and exciting for an audience.

This pilot is important because it touches on many themes such as gender, religion and science. 
The campaign will give me the money to pay the crew and cast along with other costs such as food, transportation, costume and props. The money will help me from all production to post production aspects.

Because of the intellectual advantage engineered children have, by the time the kids reach High School most of the natural born children  are weeded out, except the occasional prodigy. This world will explore what it means to be a teenager growing up in a dystopian society.

Our Team
We have a talented group of crew members including, Director of Photography Rafael Rivera whose film The Red Oak has won over 10 awards and director Jocelyn Contreras; who is an inaugural member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts' coveted Gold Program.

I understand if you aren't able to donate.  First of all I want to say thank you for looking at my campaign and I hope that you will watch the pilot when it comes out!

If you feel inspired please share our campaign. Not only is that a great way to get other potential donors, but it helps to spread the word in order to create an audience. 
Indiegogo makes it easy to share our campaign via social media. 

Risks & Challenges
The challenge we face is getting the money we need to make this project. It is an ambitious pilot that will create a new world that people haven't seen yet. In order to do that we will need extensive costume and location design to help set this world in the future compared to looking modern. 
Because of the passion I have put into creating this project and the talented crew who have been hired, I know we can make this pilot a success. As every crew member comes on board they add their own creative spark which helps to make this project unique and exciting for an audience.

story:
WHAT IS FML ABOUT?

Fuck my life; both ways!

"F.M.L." ("F**k My Life"), is an inclusive comedy that centers around five millennial friends of color who are currently navigating through the bullshit called life as they try to find themselves, their identity, actual money in their bank account, their purpose and make sure to drink a lot and get laid along the way. 

An aspiring erotica writer, a lover of sex/sex store employee, an indie filmmaker turned porn director, an actor/model turned aspiring porn star, and an entrepreneur of sex make up the group of friends. Plus there are so many other characters they meet along the way. 

WHAT DO WE NEED?

A drink and some moneyyyy! 

But seriously, we have already successfully shot the Pilot episode of this first Season which will debut in our exclusive screening in two weeks but we need help funding the rest of the season. We believe that great content + inclusion matters so we are very eager to get this project funded so that we can continue shooting the Season.  We are fortunate to already have  30% of the Season funded thus far but we clearly need your help to make sure the quality of this project comes out to be the best!

We plan on using the money for the following:

  • Cast & Crew Stipends 
  • Locations
  • Insurance
  • Catering 
  • Props ( oh you know we're going to need these. Ha!)

THAT'S COOL, BUT WHO ARE YOU?

CAST BIOS:

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please make some noise about our campaign. Any like, tweet or follow goes a long way. 

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
