story:
The Zombroz European Tour!

We've been doing Zombroz for several years and want to take this podcast to the next level. The world of COD Zombies is based on some amazing places and we want to hit the road and bring those places to you. We want to make videos together inside the Hohenwerfen Castle where Der Eisendrache is set, record a video-podcast in front of the real life Fly Trap, visit Heligoland and see how it compares to its video game counterpart and much more.

Bringing the Zombies Storyline to life...

We will be going on a tour of Europe and visiting several famous locations from Zombies such as:

  • Paris Catacombs and Eiffel Tower (the original and lost Moon Concept)
  • Bar-le-Duc/Verdun (Origins)
  • Hohenwerfen Castle (Der Eisendrache)
  • Project Riese and The Fly Trap (Der Riese)
  • Wittenau Sanatorium (Verruckt)
  • Fernsehturm/Berlin Wall (Kino Der Toten)
  • Berlin (The Shadowed Throne)
  • Heligoland (The Darkest Shore)

Along the way we would be filming vlogs, scripted videos, and of course recording podcast. All while telling you about the real life places and real life history that went on to inspire the Zombies Storyline we love. We will bring the world of Call of Duty Zombies to life like never before and see how famous maps like Der Eisendrache and Verruckt compare to their real life counter-parts.

Making this happen!

Between flights, hotels, rental cars, gas, equipment, train tickets, food and various other expenses, this tour series will be very expensive to produce. We will be personally funding most of this trip, however any donations to the trip would be much appreciate and would go a long way in helping us make this series even better. This is not a vacation for us. We will be driving from location to location filming videos and recording podcast for you! With your help though, we can make this 10 times better.

What content can you expect?

This series will be filmed in June of 2018. Most videos and podcast will be released in July of 2018. Special episodes of Zombroz will be recorded on each stop of the trip in which we share our experience from that location, compare it to its in-game version and (as always) talk zombies. John plans to remake his 'The Real Life' series and film episodes in each location. He will also be filming various vlogs and fun videos along the way. Reed will also be filming videos while on tour from various locations we visit. Depending on internet access we may even do live shows while on tour.
story_txt:
The Zombroz European Tour!
We've been doing Zombroz for several years and want to take this podcast to the next level. The world of COD Zombies is based on some amazing places and we want to hit the road and bring those places to you. We want to make videos together inside the Hohenwerfen Castle where Der Eisendrache is set, record a video-podcast in front of the real life Fly Trap, visit Heligoland and see how it compares to its video game counterpart and much more.

Bringing the Zombies Storyline to life...
We will be going on a tour of Europe and visiting several famous locations from Zombies such as:

Paris Catacombs and Eiffel Tower (the original and lost Moon Concept)
Bar-le-Duc/Verdun (Origins)
Hohenwerfen Castle (Der Eisendrache)
Project Riese and The Fly Trap (Der Riese)
Wittenau Sanatorium (Verruckt)
Fernsehturm/Berlin Wall (Kino Der Toten)
Berlin (The Shadowed Throne)
Heligoland (The Darkest Shore)

Along the way we would be filming vlogs, scripted videos, and of course recording podcast. All while telling you about the real life places and real life history that went on to inspire the Zombies Storyline we love. story:
Each 10-20 minute episode of “In the Cut” is centered around creating one or more recipes related to a theme, such as finding free food in the city and what to do when your oven goes BOOM! The show will feature quirky guests that represent the youthful and lively elements of city life, such as unconventional neighbors, DJs, musicians, dancers, poets, beatboxers, circus performers, graffiti artists, chefs, etc. The project will motivate the community to see cooking as a creative art form as well as a platform for a well-rounded lifestyle; based on a no waste philosophy. The task of cooking can seem like a daunting chore at times, so people gravitate to fast and convenient options that may not be healthy. “In the Cut” will present and explain fundamental cooking techniques in a light-hearted and accessible way that removes some of the fear and apprehension around cooking.

 

The “magic of television” effect will be used often in the show, for the magic of cooking is so very real. With every leavened bread loaf, with every bite of a delicious savoury pot roast, in the eyes of the flame of every flambéed lavender creme brûlée, comes the awakening of something profound within, a deeply majestic and pleasurable feeling. Something fantastical and indescribable is my definition of cooking magic. “In the Cut” will bring that feeling into your home.

 

Behind the Scenes: 

My real name is Ariel and I am an artist, filmmaker, entertainer, and chef. I have put more than 2 years into this project and now it’s production time. I have filmed and edited the first episode and I need to film 5 full episodes & 2 mini episodes to complete the series. The show will be shot in 5 months time, beginning when the fundraising campaign has ended in 2 months. I will release full episodes starting in June 2018, every 2 weeks for a span of 3 months. In order to begin production, I need the funds to hire a videographer, sound engineer, actors, and purchase editing software. I have created this page to sell “In the Cut” merchandise(hats, stickers, shirts, aprons, and “no waste” recipes) and with the money I make I can fund my show! If the merchandise doesn’t call to but you still want to support the show, you can donate any amount by clicking on the "Back It" button on the top right of the page, or tell some friends and spread the word! Scroll down to see pics of the merchandise available.

Stay sharp!

Mic drop.

 

Swag Pics:

story:
Hi! My name is Jodi Lynn Thomas. I have been working extensively as an actor for over ten years. This is my first ever written, directed, produced, and acting project that I have already been working on for over a year. I took it to heart that eventually I would need to create my own content, and this project is very dear to me and who I am. It is my goal to create something that is dark, funny, but also relatable.

 

  • I budgeted about $5,000-$6,000 for this project. This would go towards insurance, catering, wardrobe, post-production, equipment rentals, festival submissions, and traveling to and from New Mexico. Feel free to ask me more in detail. I would love to be as transparent about finances as possible.
  • For anyone who contributes- I would love to have you a part of the journey no matter how large or small the donation is. Anywhere from a shout out on social media, credits on IMDb, and/or the film, and of course VIP treatment for anyone who makes a large donation that includes being a part of any private or public screenings etc.
  • There are always risks and challenges, but if you know me and my work- then you know that no matter what happens I will get this done.
  • If you don't have any money to share- I get that! Just please consider helping in another way. Even just sharing the link would be helpful.

story:
My Story: 

Hey, HA! fans! I'm Jeffrey Carr the creator, writer, director, and artist for The Supernatural Angel-Man. Over ten years ago, I conquered a long battle with depression. I knew that I wanted to help those who may be going through something similar.

That's when I decided to create an entertainment company called, Heroic Art Studios LLC. Our goal is to not only be entertaining, but  also inspire and motivate others to find their purpose and go after their dreams, despite any obstacles that may come their way.

Over ten years later, I am now happily married to my wife, Amber Carr and depression-free! Together we are working hard to bring this vision to life. 

 

The Supernatural Angel-Man: 

Imagine living in a world where everyone has supernatural abilities, only they don’t realize it. The very existence of mankind is threatened by unspeakable and unimaginable evil. The only way to stop it is by helping others get in touch with their powers so you can all work together to protect your world from the relentless evil determined to destroy it.

The Supernatural Angel-Man is Heroic Art Studios first original animated miniseries for ages 12 and up. The mini-series will introduce a band of exciting, powerful heroes and ruthless villains! It’s about a man born with the extraordinary ability to communicate with angels through his actions out of faith, but just like us in life, sometimes we can have great talents but still don't understand our purpose. Join Angel-Man on his larger than life quest to find his purpose and helps others find their purpose along the way. And hey, if you don't know it already, you just might find your purpose along the way too! With this series, it’s my goal to not only entertain, but to also encourage my audience to approach life boldly; without fear.

What We Need:

I have completed the script for the pilot and have done some animation tests, but it takes a lot of man power to complete a 15-20 minute episode. In order to successfully complete the pilot, here's what we need:

My main goal is to raise $50,000. This will allow me to purchase new equipment, software, hire a small team of at least 8 people, and complete the pilot within one year.

Minor Goal: Raise $25,000: New equipment, new software, maintain office space, sizzle reel/animated short

Stretch Goals:

  1. $70,000: Hire a bigger team (10-12 people) and complete the pilot episode within 6 months.
  2. $100,000: There’s already a Supernatural Angel-Man comic series in the works! This will help complete the first book and produce physical copies.
  3. $250,000: There are 12 to 13 episodes we want to make. With this amount, we can complete at least 6 of those episodes.
  4. $500,000: It would be remarkable to reach this goal! This would allow us to complete the mini- series and have the potential of becoming a regular animated series.
  5. $1,000,000: This is our final stretch goal. First off, wow! Meeting this goal would be a dream come true. This would allow us to finish all episodes and sell them as physical copies including bonus features.

Even if we don’t reach our entire goal, every dollar goes toward the completion of the pilot or sizzle reel/animated short. No penny will be wasted!

Rewards:

As of right now, we don't have rewards for your giving but here's what you are guaranteed if you give:

  • The first episode will be free. Once the pilot is finished, it will be uploaded for free! Yup. That's right, for free! I want everyone to see what you all helped produce.
  • H.I.A. (Heroic Inside Access) One of the things I wish I could say is that I've done this 1,000 times and after we receive our funding, everything will go perfectly and it's is going to be awesome! But the truth is... We have never done this before. Which can be scary if you let it, but we are rather excited because it's going to be a great adventure along the way to meeting our goals and we want you to be a part of it! So we want to provide our backers with inside access on our progress.  We will be uploading videos, live updates, and send out a monthly digital newsletter.   

 

Risks/Challenges

For those of you who have been following my company for the past few years, you’ll know that this is my third campaign. I know that it may seem crazy to even try again, but I have more confidence in the success of this one than in my last two. Despite the lack of success with my last two campaigns, I have been consistently making a lot of progress. I have been working hard to bring this whole universe to life and I know that I can turn a lot more heads than before!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • ​Shirts

​

​If you like the artwork, you can buy your very own Heroic Art  t-shirt! They’re available to purchase through the website. Every amount that’s earned through the t-shirt sales will be put towards the pilot episode. Here's a direct link: page=1https://teespring.com/stores/thehastore?page=1

 

  • Share

Hey, I understand. You may want to give, but you just can’t. Trust me, I get it. Even if you can’t give financially, you can still help in a huge way by sharing this campaign with friends, family, coworkers, etc. At the top right of this campaign, there are links that you can use to help spread the word!

  • Thank you

I have taken such a big risk and poured so much of my life into this company and project. I will not stop until I reach success and even then I won't stop because there's always new heights to reach. I just hope that you can find it in your heart to take the risk with me help me see this through. So ​thank you in advance for all of your support and your help to help us...

story:
My name is Raven Smith, a 2020 graduate from Montclair State University with a BFA in Acting and minor in Communications. While acting is an absolute passion of mine, so is writing. Like all students, my last semester of school was interrupted by the pandemic and everything changed overnight. I struggled to find inspiration for myself in quarantine... like everyone, I wanted to be anywhere else. Still, I tried to find the humor in our situation, and the thought led to me writing a script about two roommates feeling stuck in their tiny apartment... in a big neighborhood... in a huge city. Sean and Liam's (and their neighbors' and friends') story is one most young adults can relate to - the moment you wake up and realize it's time to start making a name for yourself, even though you have no idea what you're doing. I want to bring the world the comedic relief we all need, as well as a story by a Black female writer with the help of my POC, LGBT+, and female classmates. With your help, I can make that dream a reality.  

In order to produce this webseries pilot, we'll need around $750. This money will allow us to: adhere to the current safety protocols regarding productions during COVID-19 (reimbursing our small cast and crew for testing, obtaining masks, hand sanitizer, wipes, disinfectant spray, and any extra items needed), pay our production team, rent out our set, and cover transportation costs. We plan on having the finished pilot ready for viewing this summer - anyone who contributes anything will be invited to a screening. The pilot will then be submitted to several webseries / pilot festivals in the latter half of next year. 

Times are difficult for everyone right now, which is why we've looked at the most cost efficient ways to create this project and reach our goals. From looking within our own circle for a location to doubling up on specific set duties, we want to be able to produce a quality pilot for an audience while still doing our best to keep each other safe. If our goal isn't met, we will use the money we've received and make the best out of our situation.

Of course, not everyone can contribute, and that is more than okay! Just being interested in my webseries is a gift to me. If "The Neighborhood" sounds like an intriguing sitcom to you, you can help us reach our goal by sharing the campaign page and spreading the word on social media! Thanks for reading this far and I hope to tell you some great news soon!

story:
Short Summary

A little information about this project:

The Powderpuff Gays is a short animated web series with a twist on a classic.

This project will give a look at what it would be like to have three gay leading characters in a animated series.

Any donation is greatly appreciated and will help in making this dream a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down:

We need $10,000 to make this happen! Animation is a very time consuming and tedious process, but very rewarding. Funding is going towards the animator, writers, voice actors, guest stars, sound mixer, composer, recording space, and food for our talented cast and crew.

Our FABULOUS perks range from a personalized Facebook shoutout to being a character in The Powderpuff Gays. Check them out to the right!

The Impact

The world needs more diversity:

Giving adorable animated character the chance to poke fun, but also talk about serious topics amongst the LGBTQ community is a great platform.

This series will give a voice to the voiceless. It will shed a light on a community that has a lot to offer as well as a lot to laugh about,  and we hope you're able to contribute.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate:

No worries! Even a share on your social media accounts would be super and greatly appreciated.

Share, share, share!

Thank you so much and stay fabulous! 

XOXO,

The Powderpuff Gays

story:
OUR STORY

 

This is a story of how losing your children drives people to make a choice that
effects more people than they realize. When two families witness the horrific deaths of their children, they would do anything to get them back. This opens pandora’s box. When given the choice, they jump at getting them back, as any parent would, but the consequences
are not what was expected.

Margaret Murphy is the Writer/Director of The Choice series. She has been acting for 30 years and has studied under names such as Lynn Fleming, Sharon Acher, and Bill Howie. She is also equally passionate about writing and has spent the last 10 years writing The Choice with the help and support of her writing coach Peter DeAnello.

"This story came from a dream my sister had about twenty years ago. My first thought was ‘This is a movie that needs to be written.' I, however, was not a writer at that time. I fell in love with writing years later, with the guidance of Peter DeAnello, in 2006 and always had my sister's dream in the back of my head. This story started out as a short, quickly turning into a full-length feature film. As I worked on it, Peter suggested that it should become a pilot for a mini-series. At first, I thought he was crazy, but as usual, he was correct. I finished the pilot in 2015, with a few rewrites since, but was ready to sell it. Yes, it took ten years to get there. Leah Maxell read it and immediately knew we needed to make it here. The cast grew quickly as well as the crew. This is such a unique story and can be entertaining for all ages. I’m incredibly excited about the future of this show."

-Margaret Murphy

Leah Maxwell is producing The Choice. She and Margret met in an acting class and immediately gravitated to one another. When she read the pilot for this miniseries she jumped at the chance to bring it to life.

 

OUR GOAL

Our goal of $5,000 will allow us to film a teaser. When you are trying to get your play produced, you have a table read. If you are trying to get your pilot produced you film a teaser. Most of the cast and crew are donating their time to make this happen because they believe so passionately in this project. Therefore, the funds we raise will go towards gear, travel expenses, locations, special effects as well as crafty for the cast and crew. We just need your help to rent a really cool camera.

 

OUR IMPACT

We are residents of Florida and we love it here. However, over the recent years the filming in Florida has slowed tremendously. We want to change that. We are aware that change won't happen over-night, but by showcasing the talent we have here, we hope to make strides in that direction.

"My goal is to make the entire series in Tampa as there are so many talented artists here."

-Leah Maxwell

 

OUR SOCIAL PRESENCE

While raising funds is our primary goal, getting the word out is as equally important. Telling people about the campaign can go a long away. Find us on Instagram @thechoice_series and give us a follow or share one of posts on Facebook. Get the word out about this amazing project!
story_txt:
OUR STORY
 
This is a story of how losing your children drives people to make a choice thateffects more people than they realize. When two families witness the horrific deaths of their children, they would do anything to get them back. This opens pandora’s box. When given the choice, they jump at getting them back, as any parent would, but the consequencesare not what was expected.
Margaret Murphy is the Writer/Director of The Choice series. She has been acting for 30 years and has studied under names such as Lynn Fleming, Sharon Acher, and Bill Howie. She is also equally passionate about writing and has spent the last 10 years writing The Choice with the help and support of her writing coach Peter DeAnello.
"This story came from a dream my sister had about twenty years ago. My first thought was ‘This is a movie that needs to be written.' I, however, was not a writer at that time. I fell in love with writing years later, with the guidance of Peter DeAnello, in 2006 and always had my sister's dream in the back of my head. This story started out as a short, quickly turning into a full-length feature film. As I worked on it, Peter suggested that it should become a pilot for a mini-series. At first, I thought he was crazy, but as usual, he was correct. I finished the pilot in 2015, with a few rewrites since, but was ready to sell it. Yes, it took ten years to get there. Leah Maxell read it and immediately knew we needed to make it here. The cast grew quickly as well as the crew. This is such a unique story and can be entertaining for all ages. I’m incredibly excited about the future of this show."
-Margaret Murphy
Leah Maxwell is producing The Choice. She and Margret met in an acting class and immediately gravitated to one another. When she read the pilot for this miniseries she jumped at the chance to bring it to life.

 
OUR GOAL
Our goal of $5,000 will allow us to film a teaser. When you are trying to get your play produced, you have a table read. If you are trying to get your pilot produced you film a teaser. Most of the cast and crew are donating their time to make this happen because they believe so passionately in this project. Therefore, the funds we raise will go towards gear, travel expenses, locations, special effects as well as crafty for the cast and crew. We just need your help to rent a really cool camera.

 
OUR IMPACT
We are residents of Florida and we love it here. However, over the recent years the filming in Florida has slowed tremendously. We want to change that. We are aware that change won't happen over-night, but by showcasing the talent we have here, we hope to make strides in that direction.
"My goal is to make the entire series in Tampa as there are so many talented artists here."
-Leah Maxwell

 
OUR SOCIAL PRESENCE
While raising funds is our primary goal, getting the word out is as equally important. Telling people about the campaign can go a long away. Find us on Instagram @thechoice_series and give us a follow or share one of posts on Facebook. Get the word out about this amazing project!

story:
Here at 8 Till Late Productions, we are comprised of a group of young and diverse student filmmakers who want to produce content that empower those whose narratives aren't commonly told within mainstream media. We aim to be culturally relevant and socially aware to our ever-changing world and media landscape. The story of Molly In Pieces hits close to home with the members of our team for this reason! 

Molly In Pieces would be 8 Till Late's first major production. It is a mini web-series that would span 5 short episodes in length. The story is a coming of age dramedy that follows our lead character Molly, a Black-biracial teen who hits her "quarter life crisis" and is forced to define her sense of self through her two imagined personas, who each represent both sides of her racial identity (named "Me" and "Myself"). 

Our story takes place in Toronto, Canada and touches on the bigger question: When growing up in a country that prides itself on being a "mosaic," at what point do your roots get lost in the bigger picture? Molly navigates what it feels like being a foreigner within her own culture on top of the
added pressure of becoming an adult. 

FUN FACT: Our story is inspired by writer and creator, Desiree Green, a 3rd+ generation Guyanese-Canadian who grew up in a predominantly Canadian home. We are excited to announce that she herself will be playing the lead character Molly! We look forward to seeing her take on the role and really connect with the deeper parts of the story that she has conceptualized. 

Desiree Green: Writer and Co-Director

Desiree Green is a writer and director whose passions include story design, creating visual
languages and working with actors. As a director, she has worked on short films throughout school, a short documentary on Ryerson's Sustainability and a couple promotional videos for Lucid Dream, an art collective. As a writer, Desiree has written several specs ranging from animation to comedy to drama and has also written a short dramatic thriller. 

Sadia Fazelyar: Co-Director

Sadia Fazelyar is a director with a love and passion for visual storytelling. She is particularly
interested in working on projects to explore social issues and youth mental health.
Sadia has directed several other projects during her time in RTA, including a
documentary on abortion rights in Canada and a children's TV show. Molly in Pieces is a
project Sadia is thrilled to be working on and is grateful for the opportunity to apply her
lived experiences of growing up in a bi-racial home.

George Boutaev: Director of Photography

With an eye for visual storytelling, George is motivated to demonstrate and grow his knowledge of the production process by taking on the role of Director of Photography. He is excited to capture the authentic perspectives found in Molly in Pieces by creating candid compositions within the frame of the camera.

Carson Martone: Art Director

Carson Martone has a passion for digital visual arts, ranging from digital and film photography and videography, to video editing and graphic design. She is excited to use Molly in Pieces as an opportunity to branch into new territory by exploring the art of set and prop design and costuming. Growing up with bi-racial parents and a Caribbean background, Carson was
immediately excited to begin working on Molly in Pieces, not only to share her own experiences but also use it as an opportunity to learn about others' experiences with race and identity. 

Emily Shulman: Co-Producer

Emily is a dedicated RTA student with a passion for media storytelling. She knows her way around
a budget and is excited to put her organizational skills to use as a producer for Molly In Pieces. In
her spare time, Emily can be found watching Disney movies and perfecting her baking.

Julian Leone: Co-Producer

Julian Leone is a media student who is ready to create great content. With a background in video and sound producing, Julian is a multi-faceted producer who has an eye for everything new and fresh. He can be found tearing through his never ending list of movies on Netflix.

Keemya Parsa: Marketing Lead and Story Editor

Keemya Parsa loves to use her talents of photography, videography and visual editing as a way to effectively bring unique stories to life. She is excited to work in marketing for Molly In Pieces, by using her talents of visual storytelling for effective branding and social outreach. With a platform that already stands for marginalized voices and social issues, Keemya is excited for the Molly In Pieces journey. 

Victoria McGowan: Technical Lead

Victoria McGowan is a passionate storyteller and content creator. She has worked on
many productions in different capacities both within RTA and outside. Recently she worked as
Associate Producer on Wasted Lies, a visual album by the artist Lukas Clay. She is excited
to utilize and expand her technical skills as Technical Director for Molly in Pieces. 

As student filmmakers and content creators, the funds we receive from IndieGogo would support us in ways we couldn't imagine doing on our own! On top of helping us fulfill our production goals from a financial perspective, your donation also supports a movement towards the creation of media that exemplifies what it means to be living within a diverse era of individuals and being able to provide stories for those who don't usually see themselves or their experiences represented on screen. The 8 Till Late journey is just beginning and we would love for you to hop on board, by supporting an upcoming production company! 

Our goal for this project would be $6000; we'd like to breakdown where this money will be going to exactly with you:

Equipment rentals: this includes everything from our camera, to our lenses, to our lighting and sound equipment.

Locations: this includes securing our filming locations as well as funding for art direction (which includes props, set dressing and wardrobe).

Unit Expenses: includes craft/food services during on-set shooting times, and overall transportation costs for our cast and crew members.

Insurance: includes location based insurance as well as equipment rental insurance.

Publicity: includes costs for our paid promotional outreach (online, social media) and other distribution/festival costs once we reach our post-production period!

We hope that with your help we can reach our goal! 

Despite working through the COVID-19 pandemic, our team plans to produce our content to the best of its abilities all while following COVID-19 protocols and regulations. This includes adequate PPE/sanitization, social distancing while on set, limited crew and cast on set and regular safety check-ins. We take the health of our cast and crew members very seriously during these times, and we are lucky to have a team that pays close attention to one another. It has been a stressful part of our journey nonetheless, but we know that the show must go on! Regardless of the situation, or the compromises we have had to make along the way, we will be delivering a killer final product!

Thank you for checking out our IndieGogo page! 

Share our IndieGogo page with anyone in your circle! We'd love to spread the word as much as possible, and connect with more people who may resonate with our vision. We are also continuously looking for potential sponsors, and would love to partner with any businesses who may be interested in funding for us in some way (shoot us an email at 8tilllateproductions@gmail.com if interested). 

Lastly, be sure to follow us on our main social media page @mollyinpieces for any future updates and behind the scenes content!

story:
ECLIPSE is a dark sci-fi actual play (improvised table-top rpg gaming) utilizing the Mothership RPG system! We launched Season 1 this past October over on Twitch and YouTube, and were beyond excited by the responses and all those who followed the crew of the Destiny's adventures! Now it's time to look towards bringing about a Season 2 in January 2021!!!

Our team is comprised of entertainment professionals Josephine McAdam, Miguel Coronado III, Jasmine Bhullar, Alexander Ward, Brian Soria, and Patrick Neese. We wanted to focus on bringing high quality production value to an actual play within the confines of the quarantine settings we all currently find ourselves in. Sci-fi is close to all of our hearts, and was a perfect fit for a setting that could utilize webcams in an immersive manner. Along with a critical eye for production design in overlay and UI graphics, we also stepped up the game with professional sound design and scoring by StarGrave. Music helps elevate so much of one's watching experience, we are committed and believe it is an important part of creating an escape for our audiences.

 

Risks & Challenges

If we aren't able to raise the outlined amount above, we will have to revisit whether it is in our abilities to bring a *full* Season 2 of ECLIPSE! We hope to get rewards out before the end of February 2021 - but have given this timeframe in case winter holidays cause shipping or production delays!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially - we understand, we'd also greatly appreciate your getting the word out and sharing ECLIPSE with others!

story:
The Cat’s Out Of The Bag

Howdy! I’m Liz. Most would describe me as a Flannel-clad, pumpkin spice latte-sipping, basic bitch who loves cats and westerns as much as she loves her spin instructor. And they’re right! It has always been my dream to tell a story about two of my favorite things – cats and the Wild West. I was inspired to tell this story, when I met a young cat by the name of Susie.

Susie came to a close friend of mine from the Big Apple. Growing up on the streets of NYC, turned Susie into a survivor. She was strong, independent, and an all-around bad bitch. When she came into our lives, she had an infection in her eye that was getting increasingly worse, so eventually the vet had to remove it. And that’s when she became One Eyed Suze – the Fluffiest Gunslinger in the West. 

In this moment, I knew I had to tell her story. So, I chose to write and produce the pilot episode of the One Eyed Suze mini-series to complete my MFA at Loyola Marymount University. A contribution from you, would mean the world to both me and Susie.

What We Need & What You Get

We are now just weeks away from the premiere of the long awaited One Eyed Suze pilot, but we still need backgrounds, props, character assets and much more. With your $2000 donation, I hope to bring the project to the next level. We have very talented artists and animators that have brought to life incredible background imagery, smooth animation, and top-notch character design. Animation is a slow process, and we still have much left to do, but I am confident with your donation One Eyed Suze will be the Western you’ve always dreamed of. You’ll ask yourself, did Sergio Leone make this? But, we cannot reach our destination without your help.

Check out our perk packages to be a part of this masterpiece of modern cinema!

Risks & Challenges

Since I am but a mere writer with no artistic talent whatsoever, I have come across endless challenges in producing an animated short, but with the help of my amazing team, we have overcome these odds and produced a compelling story that all can relate to.  

Meet The Team

Jason Merrin – Animator, Consultant, Emotional Support Animal

Richard Cielesz – Director, Character Designer, Father of the Year

Liz Stickley – Writer, Producer, Beer Enthusiast 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, please share the campaign with your friends! It’s a story we all want to see brought to life.

story:
Just who am I, anyway?

I'm glad I asked. I'm Ray Richmond, a longtime entertainment journalist and student of the political scene. I've written four books, including a 1997 NY Times bestselling compendium about "The Simpsons" entitled "The Simpsons: A Complete Guide to Our Favorite Family." My other books include "This is Jeopardy: Celebrating America’s Favorite Quiz Show" (2004), "TV Moms: An Illustrated Guide" (2000) and "My Greatest Day in Show Business" (1999). I also wrote the play TRANSITION that imagined the November 10, 2016 conversation in the Oval Office of the White House between President Obama and President-elect Trump some 36 hours after the election.

I have also worked as a television critic, columnist and reporter for a number of publications including The Hollywood Reporter, Daily Variety, the Los Angeles Daily News and The Orange County Register. My qualifications for writing THE OBAMA MONOLOGUES are, quite simply, my status as a political animal and a student of Obama culture.

Why have I decided to write these monologues?

So many reasons. But the primary motivating factor is the fact we have seen so little of Barack Obama as Citizen Obama during the year since he was forced to leave office due to the election of a man desperately unqualified to lead the country. We can count on the fingers of one hand (at most two hands) the number of times the former President has ventured outside his Twitter feed to lend the country a much-needed shot of reassurance that it's all going to be OK.

Since Obama himself seemed disinclined to make regular appearances for whatever reason - likely the tradition of former Presidents making themselves scarce - I felt the need to fill this glaring vacuum in the hope it would restore a measure of inspiration and tranquility during such a bleak and hopeless moment.

What do I hope to accomplish with THE OBAMA MONOLOGUES?

My goal is to entertain, mostly, while at the same time giving people a dozen ways to feel inspired (at the very least). I felt driven to produce these shorts (which average 2-3 minutes apiece) due to the transcendent talents of Joshua Wolf Coleman and his uncanny ability to emulate the vibe, appearance and vocal cadence of Obama.

Should these monologues prove popular, the longterm hope is to extend out the concept to perhaps a full-length, one-man or two-man play featuring Josh in a role he clearly was born to play.

Why should you back my project?

Because we're creating something both enduring and endearing - a living series of mini-documents that speak to the outrageous times in which we exist. The monologues run the gamut from timely to timeless, comedic to poignant, gracious to outrageous. And while I won't personally be making a cent off of these - not even for my time - I feel compelled to pay my two colleagues for their personal time, effort and expense.

What will you get as a perk for contributing?

Everyone who contributes at least $10 will receive a shiny new President Trump University Ballpoint Pen!

Thanks for giving!

Anything you can.

story:
Madison and Taylor Long have basically no other meaning in their lives beside this show. That’s just a joke, but in a way, their whole lives have lead to this point. From a young age they fried their eyeballs out from repeatedly watching TV, movies and engrossing pop culture, pretending to be Dorothy in Wizard of Oz and fighting over who gets to be the prettier fish in their Fantasia re-enactment taking place in their living room.

Huge comedic and whimsical influences from their childhood include Jim Carrey, Harry Potter, every single Disney movie you can think of, and pre-CGI classics like Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

In terms of some modern references for the show – think worlds where any goes like the Community paintball episode, the wild antics in the beloved Broad City, or spontaneous musical number in 500 Days of Summer.

 

MEET THE CAST AND CREW

Birdie + Bee is a way to showcase everyone on the team’s talents, connecting emerging and established actors, artists, and filmmakers in Vancouver, BC.

MADISON LONG

WRITER, PRODUCER, PLAYING: BIRDIE

Madison studies acting full time at Capilano University. Story telling is her game and she can’t wait to bring the script to life with her sister and trusted team. 4 out of 5 critiques say her acting is pretty good, and the 5th critique is her mom, so you can see why she is such a tortured artist trying to prove herself. Madison frequents in comedic writing, watching all movies, and trying to achieve an Instagram aesthetic she will never attain. She plays a heavy hand in the overall look and feel of the show, as symmetry and colour coordination is the only eye candy she needs. She is a published writer and has worked on multiple independent film and stage projects in Vancouver, BC.

TAYLOR LONG

WRITER, PRODUCER, PLAYING: BEE

Taylor Long should have be born a mermaid as she has the hair and singing voice for it, but her parents had legs, not fins. She is incredibly grateful for the opportunity to create with her sister, who formally terrorized her as a child. She studies acting and being a person at Langara’s Studio 58. Taylor soars at incorporating magical elements into Birdie + Bee, and is never shy of zany ideas or on the spot brilliance. She truly believes this is something people are going to want to watch, because she is the most positive thinker out there. Taylor has acted in local shorts and will be gracing the stage this upcoming fall.

NATHAN MAYES

PRODUCER

When Nathan isn’t busy being a diligent producer, he spends his time reading comic books. And when he’s not reading comic books, he’s watching movies with characters based off comic books. And when he’s not doing that, he’s listening to podcasts, about comic books. In all seriousness, comic books. Nathan is true born Vancouver boy, he studies acting full time at Capilano University, and is excited to help bring Birdie and Bee’s adventures to the screen.

IOAN SEBASTIAN TIRLUI

PLAYING: JOSH MAX

Born and raised in Calgary, Alberta, he made the move to Vancouver to attend the Vancouver Film School as an Actor. Having graduated in 2015, he has since worked on several projects both industry and independent; his latest release being the Nickelodeon movie: Legends of the Hidden Temple.

ANDREW LYNCH

PLAYING: MILKBOY

Andrew is an actor, comedian, and producer of the live show and podcast Geeks versus Nerds. He is a regular performer in the burlesque community performing with Geekenders for several years. He holds a BFA in acting from The University of British Columbia.

BRAEDEN SAUCY

PLAYING: EVIL WITCH

Braeden is a Capilano University acting student hailing from Ladner B.C. When he’s not acting you will find him writing lists of all sorts, including his favourite movies, books he needs to read but never will, and what types of lists he should write next. Future credits include several oscar-worthy but totally robbed films that should have garnered a nomination, but just sadly didn’t cater to the old-white-male academy demographic. At least he hopes.

DAVID HUDGINS

PLAYING: MR. CASELLI

David Hudgins is a founder of the internationally acclaimed Electric Company Theatre in Vancouver. Through over two decades with this innovative company he has won numerous Jessie Awards. David received his BA Honours in English Literature at McGill University and a PDP Diploma in Education from Simon Fraser University. He now teaches acting at Studio 58 and has directed nine shows there, including two Ovation-Award winning productions: Guys & Dolls (2007) and Spring Awakening (2012). The homegrown musical The Park (2010) which he directed and helped to dramaturge, garnered it five nominations. David tries to find time to write, too. His 5-year orchestral/ physical-theatre hybrid experiment odyssey called Flee, with composer Peggy Lee, found its legs at the Fox Cabaret with Electric Company and Studio 58 in 2016

We are honoured to have these talented actors portray ongoing characters of Birdie + Bee!

 

WHAT IS THE SHOW REALLY ABOUT?

Our goal is a feel good show that makes you laugh and think, with pleasing visuals, giving the over the look of the show a story book feeling, as Birdie and Bee live in a pseudo fairy-tale land. Like Alice falling down the rabbit hole, Birdie + Bee lends itself to endless possibilities. They are two women in their twenties trying to make rent and figure out life, but also an Evil Witch regularly tries to capture them, 90% of the guys in town are lumberjacks, and woodland creatures help start the day.

At is core, Birdie + Bee is about discovering your place in the world today. Facing the highs and lows, being able to laugh at yourself and using humour to make the best of the situations. In regards to character: Bee is trying to understand the world, Birdie is making the most of the world, Milkboy is unhappy with the state of the world, and Josh Max is trying to save the world. In the end, all four characters come together to find what they are truly capable of.

The pilot episode mixes whimsical and memorable childhood nostalgia with snappy modern comedic dialogue. The show takes the everyday and makes it absurd, and is never afraid to be honest. Highlighting each characters flaws, Birdie and Bee compliment and clash which real life sister-creators Madison and Taylor know all about, as they can truly communicate, with only a look.

The heart of the story is extremely important. Even if we had the budget for all the fancy tricks in the world, we want a story that an audience will care about, after all the laughs are said and done. Yes, it is a comedy, but it is a show about life being real and punching you in the face with feelings. It is about two women’s unspoken codependency, accepting said flaws, and getting what you as an individual want out of life.

 

 

WHAT A BUNCH OF CHARACTERS

Learn more about the types of characters you’ll get to see in Birdie + Bee!

BIRDIE – Birdie seeks perfection but is far from. She is charismatic, vain, and indulges everything 2017 has to offer including social media, diet trends, and craft beer. She gets what she wants and doesn’t care about guys or relationships, enjoying life without worrying about other’s opinions. Aside from her pointed sarcasm and attitude, people still flock to Birdie as she has some sort of power over them. Under the surface, she is extremely self-conscious. This comes out in her hard exterior, never letting anyone but Bee come too close to her.

BEE – Sweet and hardworking Bee replaces swear words with fruit puns. She happily buzzes from task to task, but isn’t satisfied with where she’s at in life. She craves security and daydreams about the perfect prince charming and family to come home to. She has a hard time accepting 2017 for what it is and dreams of a simpler time. Bee judges herself a lot and is always second guessing, putting others before herself. She really is the best friend you could ask for, but has to learn what is truly so special about herself. Vices include binge eating, falling in love at first site, and impulse buying.

JOSH MAX – Hollybloom’s prized superhero in his off duty downtime, out of the spandex suit. Although we don’t see him fight crime, fly, or save dangling girls from burning buildings, we will see him stoically order pizza with friends, pay bills, and stare out his window at the towering skyline. Keeping the town safe majorly cuts into his social and love life, as he balances protecting his true identity from local villains and more importantly: Birdie.

MILKBOY – Milkboy’s effortlessly cool 50’s greaser style and speech drives Bee to drop things at the mere sight of him when he delivers milk to her work. He is loyal, old fashioned, passionate, and birds seem to appear every time he is near. There is something special and complex bubbling under the surface for Milkboy. Catch him at the local soda shop enjoying a chocolate malt or racing for pinks in Bumper Bender Valley.   

EVIL WITCH – The master of all that is wrong in the word. Wicked, grim, and easily irritated. He rules over the desolate town of Weirdsville. Cursed with extreme jealousy, Evil Witch does everything he can to stop millennials from enjoying their youth. Whether it’s poisoning the old watering hole, raising housing market prices, or stealing your hair elastics, Evil Witch will give you depression one way or another. He constantly uses his ancient witchy magic to disguise himself as various youthful personas to get the unnecessary revenge he lives for.

MR. CASELLI – A kind Italian man who isn't afraid to whack you with a wooden spoon if you disappoint him. Owner of Caselli's Deli and Florals, Mr. Caselli is Bee's boss who wants the best for her, without being afraid to tell it like it is. In a perfect world, everyone would work as hard he does. He'll never quite understand "kids today.”

 

WHERE THE FUNDING WILL GO

As mentioned in the video, we need the money to pay for crucial elements we find integral to the project. This includes:

LOCATION – It is hard to recreate a deli, flower shop, and brunch bar in your basement suite, and we need to drive far to get the secluded meadow shot!

EQUIPMENT RENTALS – We need something better than our iPhones! We are not the Duplass Brothers, yet. This includes a camera, lighting, and sound equipment.  

SET DESIGN – This show is based around colour, texture, and quirky set pieces. We will be scourging through second-hand stores and our grandma’s garage, but need the show BURSTING with interesting things to look at (since the two lead actresses are not). 

PROPS – Along with the set, this show is PACKED with props. Bee’s cactus purse, Birdie’s Know-It-All books, and a hefty amount of potted plants.

COSTUME – Every character (except the naked Lumberjack) needs to be fully clothed!

CRAFT SERVICE – We do not want any hangry people on set, and when working for free, having a full stomach becomes very important. 

EQUIPMENT - 23%, LOCATION - 20%, SET DESIGN, COSTUME, PROPS - 29%, CRAFT, SERVICE - 8%, PERKS - 16%, TRAVEL - 4%

For a more detailed breakdown of the budget, email us at birdieandbeetv@gmail.com!

Be sure to check out the cool perks you can get from donating! Get em’ while they’re hot!

 

CHALLENGES WE FACE

We need to create the beautiful and whimsical world of the show with a limited budget and time constraint. Birdie + Bee will be shot over four full time days, completing every scene within the allotted hours. Anyone who has tried to produce a show in Vancouver knows it’s a challenge itself in between making a living in the city, as no one on the team is getting paid – it’s our passion project! And a full time job itself. Each person on the team is committed to getting the project done, and is graciously volunteering their time.

On top of this, we are a DIY sort of team, and many props and set pieces will be made ourselves such as Evil Witch’s sparkling apples, signs that are flown in, the cactus dollhouse, and many more.

It has been months of prep in order to film!

Creating this show feels similar to creating a fringe style show in a black box theater. We need to make the world believable for an audience with whatever resources we can, capturing the magic on film with elements you would see on stage. Whether its props flying in on strings, an extremely fast costume change, or text messages written out on signs instead of being edited in post, we are thinking outside the conventions of what we normally see on film. This means longer takes with actors working harder to get choreographed one shots done. For example, instead of shooting a traditional montage with cuts, the actors will go through the motions of a first date to a divorce in one take.  Blending elements from both film and stage performance will add more quirk and magic, making memorable scenes.

We are going for long takes, symmetrical frames, flat and warm lighting, and have been describing the style as a "messy Wes Anderson." With as much colour coordination as we can get.

What’s positive about the obstacles we face is that they have pushed us to think outside the box in terms of using makeshift effects in place of special effects. This lead us to a show unique to the writers and production team when looking at style. Birdie + Bee subverts expectations, has a strong voice and self-aware social commentary.

We want to put the extra bit of money and work into the pilot to gain traction in order to make the next 5 episodes, which are just as fun and crazy as the first. We want the pilot to capture how we picture the show being done, so whoever jumps on board in the future gets a clear picture, along with hoping to get a fan base going who DEMANDS to see Birdie + Bee progress.

 

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME

The world of Birdie + Bee is vast, and developed from small sketches Madison and Taylor found funny to loveable, in depth characters with goose bump causing reveals throughout the first season, with enough material to write a second. We are confident our team can pull this show off, and any amount of financial security helps.

We don’t want to give away everything, but here’s some exciting things that will happen during the rest of the season: Birdie gets insta-famous due to of her larger than life eyebrows. Bee has secret a relative return from her past that she deathly afraid of. There will be a completely musical episode, and the finale episode will end with an explosive battle, changing each character’s lives.

Again, an endless thank you for showing interest in our campaign. We never thought we would be able to pull off something like this, and it is really a dream come true.

And if you’re not able to donate – no worries! We understand. But if you have taken a liking and would like to see the project get made, share the campaign and give us a like on Facebook at:

www.facebook.com/birdieandbeetv

 

We truly appreciate every bit of support,

Madison and Taylor Long, and the rest of the Birdie + Bee Team

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jayce Baron Sadler and I am the Writer and Creator of Literally Annoyed. With my personal journey figuring out what being black & gay meant while having to fight through society and social stigmas, I realized how disconnected we are as a community. Graduating in the midst of the recession, I still found my passion to pursue entertainment and tell these stories I didn't see in media. Although the concepts diversity & inclusion are beginning to be addressed more, there is still a never-ending amount of representation that needs to be on our televisions. Creating starts with us!

The good news is, we already did the bulk of the work! We shot the pilot and are currently in post-production to refine editing, sound, and picture to package to sell. We still have to pay our actors, crew, and several elements that go into making a quality product.

The truth is, it's not 100% guarantee the pilot will be sold to a major network. But we as a team have come together to make something magical (I literally cried when we finished LOL). The five 13-hour days were gruesome, but we made it! Now, it's time to wrap this bad boy up! 

Please share on your social media and with anyone you think would be interested in helping an amazing project. 

Thank you so much!

Jayce & The "Literally Annoyed" Family

story:
I'm Michele Kaye and the co-creator of "Here's Ginger!", an indie women-led web series that takes on sexism, ageism, and corruption in show business and the corporate world. We need to raise $22,000 to cover the costs of filming and post-production. Read on to learn more about the project and be sure to check out our great perks, from stylish bracelets to the handmade necklace that Ginger wears throughout the series.

Here's Ginger!

"Here's Ginger!" is a web series starring Chantelle Wilson as Ginger Jones, a former kids' show star who can no longer bear show business. In a moment of misguided inspiration, Ginger turns to the corporate world for a fresh start. Much of the story is based on Chantelle's life as a former kids' show star herself.

The show is a darkly funny take on how women like Ginger are left to navigate patriarchal systems of power.

On corporate hell & sex-crazed cougars

When Ginger takes her office job, it's as if she has stepped through a portal into hell. It's a surreal environment, and Ginger soon discovers that the ageist misogyny she wanted to escape is just as rampant in the corporate world. Eventually, Ginger uncovers the ugly truth about her company's newest Corporate Social Responsibility initiative, and she has to make a choice.

One of our main goals is to create representation for actors and characters in ways that upend  media tropes. Too many shows reduce middle-aged women to either depressed cat ladies or sex-crazed cougars. Ginger, her friend Summer, and Ginger's mom all break this mold -- they are all weird, independent, and real in their own right.

Who we are

Executive producer: Laura Tremblay 

Director of photography: Patrick Hodgson

Co-creator, writer, and director: Michele Kaye 

Co-creator and star: Chantelle Wilson

Casting is ongoing, but here are some of our key cast members: Ron Jack Foley, Sheena Turcotte, Patricia McPherson, Mike Donis, Laura Tremblay, Zelia Tremblay-Nielsen, Peggy Calvert

What we need & what you get

We are aiming to raise $22,000 to cover the cost of filming and post-production for the first season of "Here's Ginger!" We did one day of filming in October 2017, and will do the remaining three days in February 2018. 

We're excited to offer a great set of perks, many of which would make for great holiday presents! Pick up jewelry both from Chantelle (she also happens to be a successful independent jewelry maker) and our partner Silver Moon, a fantastic family-run store in Maryland. If jewelry isn't your thing, there's plenty else to choose from.

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry! Help us get the word out through social media and by telling your family and friends about the series. Everything helps! 

Thank you for helping us bring this series to life.
story_txt: I'm Michele Kaye and the co-creator of "Here's Ginger!", an indie women-led web series that takes on sexism, ageism, and corruption in show business and the corporate world. We need to raise $22,000 to cover the costs of filming and post-production. Read on to learn more about the project and be sure to check out our great perks, from stylish bracelets to the handmade necklace that Ginger wears throughout the series.Here's Ginger!"Here's Ginger!" is a web series starring Chantelle Wilson as Ginger Jones, a former kids' show star who can no longer bear show business. In a moment of misguided inspiration, Ginger turns to the corporate world for a fresh start. Much of the story is based on Chantelle's life as a former kids' show star herself.The show is a darkly funny take on how women like Ginger are left to navigate patriarchal systems of power.On corporate hell & sex-crazed cougarsWhen Ginger takes her office job, it's as if she has stepped through a portal into hell. It's a surreal environment, and Ginger soon discovers that the ageist misogyny she wanted to escape is just as rampant in the corporate world. Eventually, Ginger uncovers the ugly truth about her company's newest Corporate Social Responsibility initiative, and she has to make a choice.One of our main goals is to create representation for actors and characters in ways that upend  media tropes. Too many shows reduce middle-aged women to either depressed cat ladies or sex-crazed cougars. Ginger, her friend Summer, and Ginger's mom all break this mold -- they are all weird, independent, and real in their own right.Who we areExecutive producer: Laura Tremblay Director of photography: Patrick HodgsonCo-creator, writer, and director: Michele Kaye Co-creator and star: Chantelle WilsonCasting is ongoing, but here are some of our key cast members: Ron Jack Foley, Sheena Turcotte, Patricia McPherson, Mike Donis, Laura Tremblay, Zelia Tremblay-Nielsen, Peggy CalvertWhat we need & what you getWe are aiming to raise $22,000 to cover the cost of filming and post-production for the first season of "Here's Ginger!" We did one day of filming in October 2017, and will do the remaining three days in February 2018. We're excited to offer a great set of perks, many of which would make for great holiday presents! Pick up jewelry both from Chantelle (she also happens to be a successful independent jewelry maker) and our partner Silver Moon, a fantastic family-run store in Maryland. If jewelry isn't your thing, there's plenty else to choose from.If you can't contribute financially, don't worry! Help us get the word out through social media and by telling your family and friends about the series. Everything helps! Thank you for helping us bring this series to life.

story:
Who am I?

  • My name is Andrew Gamba, in school, I studied to become a recording engineer but my real passion is gaming, TV, creating content, and building a community for like minded people to come and watch us be passionate about your geek culture!
  • I have worked as an engineer on a few video games, web series , and a pilot for Red Bull so I have some entertainment background and wish to branch out and create more.

What I want to do

  • ​I want to make high quietly content that mixes gaming, nerd culture, and booze while building an amazing community around it!
  • I am in the Dallas/ Fort Worth area and working with local great companies like Freaks & Geeks (https://www.facebook.com/FreaksAndGeeksllc/) *Check them out and tell them that Gamba said hi!

What We Need & What You Get!

  • I would like to get $3,000 this would cover two Canon Rebel t6 cameras, tripods, SD cards, lenses, soft box lights, and professional editing software.
  • This would allow us to make much nicer looking videos.
  • We will also have fun stretch goals for you for each of the milestones we hit such as...
    • $2500- We will raffle off a custom painted computer case by BebopMods!
    • $1000- Me and my crew will eat the cereal from the 1992 Batman movie live 
    • $500-Time lapse video BebopMods on how to paint your own case (THIS SHOULD BE CHANGED)
    • $250-We will host a 24 hour stream where you guys can chat & play with the Boozy Nerds :)

Why you should help!

  • Not only are we going to bring great content, we are also going to build a great community that works with local business and fosters a fun and supporting group for all of us amazing nerds!
  • Also this is something that is going to happen hopefully with the support of you, but if not, I will make sure it does. I think this is going to be a great network of shows and people and cannot wait to see where it goes!

Other Ways You Can Help (and Please do!)

  • So even if you cannot help fund us, it goes a long way to follow us and share us!
    • Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/BoozyNerds/) 
    • Twitch (https://www.twitch.tv/theboozynerds)
    • Youtube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd8vZmpo3gt0lD...)
    • Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/boozynerds/)
  • Thank you guys for reading this far and helping support us! I cannot wait to air our shows!

story:
Update:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DjrgWy3thlw

 

What is C&Rsenal?

For most of you viewing this campaign, you already know who we are and what we do.  But just in case you've wandered in fresh: C&Rsenal is a small organization centered on historical firearms.  Our flag project is Primer, which is winding it's way through the small arms of World War I in a series of long format video documentaries and demonstrations.

We dig deep into the research and present the clearest picture possible with the help of live fire, period images and videos, and animations to show the operation of these machines.  It's a laborious and expensive process and so we consume a healthy monthly budget. 

Most of our funding has come from Patreon donations, but twice a year we try to produce some merchandise for our viewers to actually own a piece of the work we've been doing, and provide a boost to our special projects budget.

Why does C&Rsenal need this money?

Right now our generous patrons have kicked in plenty, so why do we need a cash grab mid year?  Well we get into a rhythm with our funding and naturally, to make the best show, we tend to spend it to the penny on improvements or acquiring more research material, manufacturing obsolete cartridges, paying shipping and insurance on loaners, and local travel.

But for our overall mission of including as many of these guns on video as possible and ALL of the weapons of the war in our final book project, we'll need to make a number of trips.  These range from hitting major museum collections for photos to visiting machine gun collectors in their own states (dang federal laws) for filming.  Additionally, developing 1,000 rounds of an antique and long unused cartridge is pretty dang expensive.  

So when you buy your shirt you'll be contributing to our endeavor to be the first to bundle every single firearm of the war into one major virtual collection.

 

 

OK, but what do I get?

You get a shirt.  Pay money, get shirt.  I hope that much is clear!

The $20 price tag reflects a bulk order, so we will start production AFTER the 30 day campaign.  We can't spend money we don't have folks and they won't give it to us until the very end.  From there we order the necessary cotton shirts and begin the quality screen printing and shipments.

 

 

What about this color, that size, ladies shirts?

Since this is a bulk order we need at least 25 of each color and size combo to even make an order, let alone take advantage of the cost savings we'd need to make the price work. To simplify, each shirt is offered in one color, as featured in the photos.  Ladies and XXL shirts are priced differently from the source and we doubt we'll meet demands regardless.  It's a bit much to factor into our projections, but we can start working on them once a more permanent shop is established after this campaign.
