story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Do you remember the movie Wayne’s World?  In it, the main characters Wayne and Garth started a music television show out of their basement.  It aired on their local community access television station.  Eventually it grew in popularity and went national.

Well – That’s how my show got its start. I originally had the idea after I lost my job as director of the woodworking program at a major craft school.  I thought I’d film myself working, with the hopes that someone like yourself would see it and commission me to build them some furniture.

Well – five years later and I still haven’t received a commission.  But like Wayne and Garth, my show has grown.  It now airs regularly on more than 580 cable access channels across the states, and has created a wonderful community consisting of woodworkers, musicians and artists.  In fact - some of the musicians who have been featured on the show have donated their music and have sent me CD's to offer contributers, in order to keep this community going.

I to have the opportunity to go national.  PBS stations across the nation have given me the opportunity to air my show.  A show like mine is expensive to produce.  So far, it’s been a labor of love.  No income comes out of the show.  I cover the downloading costs so access stations can download the show.  The show has been offered a time slot on many PBS stations nationally.  PBS does not pay to have the show air on their station.  They give you the platform to reach a larger audience.  For the past three years my show has aired regionally on Rhode Island PBS. 

To move forward, keep the show in production, and bring it to a national PBS level, I need to hire a crew and cover production costs. Such as closed captioning, packaging, etc:

That’s where you come in.  Please help me keep my show in production. To bring it to a national PBS audience, and to keep the wonderful community it has created alive.  So far, I’ve hired an audio engineer and a technical coordinator. 

I would also like to create a website as a learning resource.  Where this community can exchange and share ideas.

Your commitment will not go unnoticed.  Please look at this page? And see the fantastic gifts I’ve created for your generosity.

A big named car company’s commercial names several famous and successful companies that started in a garage, wisely concluding, “You never know what kind of greatness can come out of an American garage.”

Please help spread the word.  I understand if you can't make a financial contribution.  At the end of the week, after paying our bills, our household doesn't have much left.  Asking for help is very awkward.  You can help by telling others.  Please link this campaign to your facebook, youtube, instagram and any other accounts you might have.  Tell your friends and family.  Lets keep this amazing, creative community going.

I hope to see you back here.  In the Garage

Thank you very much

Regards

Steve

story:
I have watched numerous kids shows with kids and it dawned on me that they did not have any vested interest in the characters - because the episodes are “freestanding” and do not add up to an overall arc. 

I realized there needed to be a tween show involving characters in a ongoing storyline, just like adult-oriented programs do. The show would still have the silliness and goofy antics of middle schoolers, but would also give a humanistic and human quality to the characters and story.  Enter ARTHUR FUTURO.

 

Meet the Team Behind ARTHUR FUTURO 

Series Showrunner/Executive Producer

David W. Schoner, Jr.

David Schoner is currently the Associate Director for the New Jersey Motion Picture and Television Commission. He has produced two award-winning independent films (A Dangerous Place and Murder Reincarnated) distributed by outlets such as Screen Media, Netflix, Blockbuster and York Entertainment. He also has set up feature film screenplay proposals that have been recognized by organizations such as the Producers Guild of America, Independent Feature Project (IFP) and the Panasonic Digital Filmmakers Award. In his spare time, David serves on the Board of Directors of the Garden State Film Festival, Women in Media-Newark Film Festival, Westfield International Film Festival Monmouth International Film Festival and is a member of the Cedar Grove Board of Education. He engages in fundraising and is involved in various educational and child-related charitable endeavors.

 

 

Writer

Ryan D. Moore

Ryan D. Moore is a comedy writer based out of New Jersey. He writes for the sketch comedy group American Breakfast and co-wrote their web series GOD WORKS FROM HOME. He also co-wrote the award-winning short film GRAFTERS which was screened at the Cannes short film corner. The film also won Best Short at the Orlando Film Festival and Best Short Lead Actor and Best Director at the Atlantic City Downbeach Festival. Ryan recently won Best Short Script for LIVING WITH POSEIDON at the Big MINI Media Festival for the project. He is currently getting his masters in creative writing with a concentration in screenwriting and is working on various projects.

 

 

Director

Joseph Morabito, Jr.

Joseph Morabito was born, raised, and still resides in New Jersey. He has created content for companies such as; World Wrestling Entertainment, ESPN, NBC/Universal, and Disney. Joe’s credits include director, producer, editor and writer. His freelance credits include; “Part of Our World” (docu-short, 2013), “Birthday Boy” (short, 2014), “That’ll Be The Day” (bio-short, 2015), and “Gumshoe” (short, 2015). Joe received a Bachelor of Science degree in Film & Television from Full Sail University in Winter Park, Florida.

 

Casting Director

Ed Bergtold

Ed Bergtold hails from Hackensack, NJ and is a graduate of Monmouth University with a degree in TV/Film and Radio Production. He has been a working professional in the Film & TV industry since 2004. Ed started out as an intern at MTV where he worked in the casting department for MTV’s Summer Share in Seaside Heights. A few years later Ed decided to train as an actor under the tutelage of John M. Eyd of “The Actor’s Trainer Institute” in Red Bank, NJ and later with Actor/Writer/Filmmaker Chazz Palminteri. Ed is well versed in Stella Adler’s Approach to Stanislavski, Lee Strausberg’s Method and The Meisner Technique.

Some of Ed’s highlights were principal work in Oliver Stone’s “Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps”, Gela Babulani’s “13” (opposite Sam Riley and Emanuelle Chriqui) and as the role of Anthony Allen Shore in Investigation Discovery’s “Evil Lives Here.”

Ed’s work in indie film is well known, respected and has screened in dozens of film festivals. High lights include: The award winning films such as “When the Night Falls” (which was his directorial debut), “Abandoned in the Dark” (Starring horror icon Kane Hodder), “A Dangerous Place” (starring Kristen Dalton), “Behind the Mirror”.

His upcoming projects include “Do Something, Jake” (shot on location in England), “The Burning Bride” (Starring Chuck Montgomery) and “Extra Innings” (starring Geraldine Singer).

Ed has an eye for talent and vast knowledge of the craft. He is a great coach in the casting studio and he wants to see every actor succeed and give the best performance possible!

 

 

Editor

Karl Erikson

Karl Erikson is an award winning filmmaker from right here in New Jersey. He is also the lead editor and production manager for Stonehouse media in Lambertville, NJ. Currently he is in pre-production for his first feature length film, a buddy crime comedy, Disarray Days. It is important to note that Karl loves picnics.

 

 

Production Designer

Burak Aydogan

From building a set to resemble an alternate world of the year 2000 that takes place in the 80s, to designing a haunted party house in March for Halloween in the early 90s, then building a small-scale neighborhood with a functioning Ferris wheel, Burak Aydogan has always been dedicated to go all in for a project. With a garage full of every tool known to man, and an imagination that has no limit, he will craft things that are very unique to the eye and have functionality!  

 

 

Wardrobe Designer

Brynne Nicole

Aka "B" is a freelance stylist, fashion consultant, and blogger. Her love for the fashion industry has been a constant throughout her life and continued to grow during her teenage years, while taking classes in Sewing/Fashion Merchandising and modeling for Wilhelmina Philadelphia. Given the opportunity to work behind the scenes with designers, photographers, and meeting icons such as Betsy Johnson only made it flourish more. B enjoys every opportunity to create with others and has since started to self-promote and collaborate with models and photographers from the NYC/NJ area. Her most recent stylist work includes shoots with model Louisa Warwick, TV Personalities Raquel "Rocky" Santiago (Bad Girls Club) and Maya Sieber (Ice Road Truckers), actress Amanda Iannuzzi, and American Idol contestant Jax. On the side she maintains a blog (Whiskeyinabcup.com) and also styles/runs a social media account for a local NJ consignment shop, Woodstock Vibes

 

 

Set Photographer

Teresa Psykaty

Over 30 years of collective artistic experience, diversity and talent.   

Her love for photography began at the age of 12.  Influenced and inspired by the photography greats Ansel Adams and Cartier Bresson’s approach , she began a life long love affair of capturing candid and dramatic moments.    

Her work has been published nationally and internationally.  Gourmet, OK! , Celebrity Page, RadarOnline, Huffington Post, Bella NY and Bella LA as well as serving Neiman Marcus, MvVO Art, Accessible Art Fair, various New York Fashion Week designers, Jose Eber Salon, Tumblr, Stoli Vodka and other respected companies as “house photographer”. Her photograph are regularly featured on major television network shows as well as other respected media outlets.   

Because of her extensive art background, Teresa sees things from an artistic perspective which sets her apart from other photographers. Her passion is evident from the moment she enters a room. Her reputation, integrity, talent and consistency make her one of NYC’s most sought after photographers.

 

 

Graphic Designer

Deanna Palma

Deanna is an artist and graphic designer with a passion for all things fiction, fantasy, anime and sci-fi. By day she is a Marketing Manger/Graphic Designer at a leading distributor of amusement equipment. By night (in her free time), Deanna takes every opportunity to be creative. Whether it's drawing, painting,  designing, or crafting she is always working on an artistic project. She has worked on a number of projects for the Great Mustachio including the Cedar Grove Waves Memorial Installation
story_txt: I have watched numerous kids shows with kids and it dawned on me that they did not have any vested interest in the characters - because the episodes are “freestanding” and do not add up to an overall arc. I realized there needed to be a tween show involving characters in a ongoing storyline, just like adult-oriented programs do. The show would still have the silliness and goofy antics of middle schoolers, but would also give a humanistic and human quality to the characters and story.  Enter ARTHUR FUTURO. Meet the Team Behind ARTHUR FUTURO Series Showrunner/Executive ProducerDavid W. Schoner, Jr.David Schoner is currently the Associate Director for the New Jersey Motion Picture and Television Commission. He has produced two award-winning independent films (A Dangerous Place and Murder Reincarnated) distributed by outlets such as Screen Media, Netflix, Blockbuster and York Entertainment. He also has set up feature film screenplay proposals that have been recognized by organizations such as the Producers Guild of America, Independent Feature Project (IFP) and the Panasonic Digital Filmmakers Award. In his spare time, David serves on the Board of Directors of the Garden State Film Festival, Women in Media-Newark Film Festival, Westfield International Film Festival Monmouth International Film Festival and is a member of the Cedar Grove Board of Education. He engages in fundraising and is involved in various educational and child-related charitable endeavors.  WriterRyan D. MooreRyan D. Moore is a comedy writer based out of New Jersey. He writes for the sketch comedy group American Breakfast and co-wrote their web series GOD WORKS FROM HOME. He also co-wrote the award-winning short film GRAFTERS which was screened at the Cannes short film corner. The film also won Best Short at the Orlando Film Festival and Best Short Lead Actor and Best Director at the Atlantic City Downbeach Festival. Ryan recently won Best Short Script for LIVING WITH POSEIDON at the Big MINI Media Festival for the project. He is currently getting his masters in creative writing with a concentration in screenwriting and is working on various projects.  DirectorJoseph Morabito, Jr.Joseph Morabito was born, raised, and still resides in New Jersey. He has created content for companies such as; World Wrestling Entertainment, ESPN, NBC/Universal, and Disney. Joe’s credits include director, producer, editor and writer. His freelance credits include; “Part of Our World” (docu-short, 2013), “Birthday Boy” (short, 2014), “That’ll Be The Day” (bio-short, 2015), and “Gumshoe” (short, 2015). Joe received a Bachelor of Science degree in Film & Television from Full Sail University in Winter Park, Florida. Casting DirectorEd BergtoldEd Bergtold hails from Hackensack, NJ and is a graduate of Monmouth University with a degree in TV/Film and Radio Production. He has been a working professional in the Film & TV industry since 2004. Ed started out as an intern at MTV where he worked in the casting department for MTV’s Summer Share in Seaside Heights. A few years later Ed decided to train as an actor under the tutelage of John M. Eyd of “The Actor’s Trainer Institute” in Red Bank, NJ and later with Actor/Writer/Filmmaker Chazz Palminteri. Ed is well versed in Stella Adler’s Approach to Stanislavski, Lee Strausberg’s Method and The Meisner Technique.Some of Ed’s highlights were principal work in Oliver Stone’s “Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps”, Gela Babulani’s “13” (opposite Sam Riley and Emanuelle Chriqui) and as the role of Anthony Allen Shore in Investigation Discovery’s “Evil Lives Here.”Ed’s work in indie film is well known, respected and has screened in dozens of film festivals. High lights include: The award winning films such as “When the Night Falls” (which was his directorial debut), “Abandoned in the Dark” (Starring horror icon Kane Hodder), “A Dangerous Place” (starring Kristen Dalton), “Behind the Mirror”.His upcoming projects include “Do Something, Jake” (shot on location in England), “The Burning Bride” (Starring Chuck Montgomery) and “Extra Innings” (starring Geraldine Singer).Ed has an eye for talent and vast knowledge of the craft. He is a great coach in the casting studio and he wants to see every actor succeed and give the best performance possible!  EditorKarl EriksonKarl Erikson is an award winning filmmaker from right here in New Jersey. He is also the lead editor and production manager for Stonehouse media in Lambertville, NJ. Currently he is in pre-production for his first feature length film, a buddy crime comedy, Disarray Days. It is important to note that Karl loves picnics.  Production DesignerBurak AydoganFrom building a set to resemble an alternate world of the year 2000 that takes place in the 80s, to designing a haunted party house in March for Halloween in the early 90s, then building a small-scale neighborhood with a functioning Ferris wheel, Burak Aydogan has always been dedicated to go all in for a project. With a garage full of every tool known to man, and an imagination that has no limit, he will craft things that are very unique to the eye and have functionality!    Wardrobe DesignerBrynne NicoleAka "B" is a freelance stylist, fashion consultant, and blogger. Her love for the fashion industry has been a constant throughout her life and continued to grow during her teenage years, while taking classes in Sewing/Fashion Merchandising and modeling for Wilhelmina Philadelphia. Given the opportunity to work behind the scenes with designers, photographers, and meeting icons such as Betsy Johnson only made it flourish more. B enjoys every opportunity to create with others and has since started to self-promote and collaborate with models and photographers from the NYC/NJ area. Her most recent stylist work includes shoots with model Louisa Warwick, TV Personalities Raquel "Rocky" Santiago (Bad Girls Club) and Maya Sieber (Ice Road Truckers), actress Amanda Iannuzzi, and American Idol contestant Jax. On the side she maintains a blog (Whiskeyinabcup.com) and also styles/runs a social media account for a local NJ consignment shop, Woodstock Vibes  Set PhotographerTeresa PsykatyOver 30 years of collective artistic experience, diversity and talent.   Her love for photography began at the age of 12.  Influenced and inspired by the photography greats Ansel Adams and Cartier Bresson’s approach , she began a life long love affair of capturing candid and dramatic moments.    Her work has been published nationally and internationally.  Gourmet, OK! , Celebrity Page, RadarOnline, Huffington Post, Bella NY and Bella LA as well as serving Neiman Marcus, MvVO Art, Accessible Art Fair, various New York Fashion Week designers, Jose Eber Salon, Tumblr, Stoli Vodka and other respected companies as “house photographer”. Her photograph are regularly featured on major television network shows as well as other respected media outlets.   Because of her extensive art background, Teresa sees things from an artistic perspective which sets her apart from other photographers. Her passion is evident from the moment she enters a room. Her reputation, integrity, talent and consistency make her one of NYC’s most sought after photographers.  Graphic DesignerDeanna PalmaDeanna is an artist and graphic designer with a passion for all things fiction, fantasy, anime and sci-fi. By day she is a Marketing Manger/Graphic Designer at a leading distributor of amusement equipment. By night (in her free time), Deanna takes every opportunity to be creative. Whether it's drawing, painting,  designing, or crafting she is always working on an artistic project. She has worked on a number of projects for the Great Mustachio including the Cedar Grove Waves Memorial Installation

story:
The Mels is a TV series in development, debut from Writer/Producer/Director Kharmony Fortune starring DèLon Shaw (Netflix, Family Reunion), Keturah Gregg (HBO, Insecure) and Anisa Washington (Recording Artist).

Produced by Unlimited Possibilities Studios- Hollywood, CA.

The half hour dramedy follows the self-discovery journeys of Melanie, Melody and Melissa, three brown skinned girls with completely different upbringings who form a bond on the first day of high school.

If you would like to see more of the show, please support our indiegogo campaign and donate toward the completion of this amazing series, representing GIRLS EVERYWHERE!

 

Follow us @TheMels.TV

www.TheMels.TV

story:
Short Summary

In mainstream media, the black experience is primarily shown from an African-American perspective. As someone who has constantly had my blackness questioned due to my nationality, I've experienced first hand one of many consequences of monolithic black representation. Instead of trying to fit into ideas of what we think blackness is, I'm using this series to highlight the countless things it can be.
 

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing to this campaign, you'll help me achieve my long term goal of taking this series to as many countries as possible.

  • I raised a decent amount in the first campaign, and created this one after multiple requests!
  • The amount listed will allow me to pay for flights, housing, day to day expenses (meals, public transportation) and a local crew to film the videos.
  • The perks are as unique as the subjects we've interviewed. You can get anything from a photoshoot, to a wellness session!
     

The Impact

Black Beyond America is my oppourtunity to document the countless nuances that make up the black experience world wide. I want to also use this series as a chance to hire more black internationals in the film industry. Moving forward, it's important for me to have a crew that reflects those seen in front of the camera. 

While we've successfully made a few videos in California, it's time to start our international journey, which is where you come in! The series can only go so far if we don't visit the countries in question - whether it's sharing stories with those back in the UK, digging into the black experience in Russia, or visiting islands in the Caribbean, we need your help.
 

Why I'm Doing This

Being black in The Ivory Coast is not the same as being black in Australia or Colombia. One of the beautiful things about us as a race is that culturally we're everywhere. Each video will hone in on our similarities, while celebrating our differences.

When it comes to the diaspora, I've become fascinated with the unknown. Even in present day, countries such as Mexico only acknowledged their black population on the National Census in 2015. In a world where nations consider their most beautiful to be those with the closest proximity to whiteness, I always wonder: who else is getting overlooked? The more I research, the more I discover the presence of black populations that (more often than not) been around for centuries (e.g. India's black population that settled in the country 400 years ago). 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

No donation is too big or small. Any amount you can give will go towards food, travel, housing and paying the crew that'll make this happen. Even if you can't donate, here are some other way to help out:

  • Share on social media.
  • Share the project in online groups or forums to spread the word.

In the long run, I aim to break the misconception that a black person's culture measures their worth in society. I aspire to have the series be part of a larger archive that is constantly being updated with new content, new experiences and new perspectives.

story:
⚡️What is a Bowlt?

The Bowlts are the 5 members of the Lightning Bowlts bowling team - the very heartbeat(s) of our show: an optimistic, sensitive ex-bowling champ named Wesley Grimshaw, his Tik Tok boy roommate named Corey Chen, a pretentious auteur student director named Jasyn Wiggins, her straight-shooting BFF/cinematographer named Val Valencia, and a Revolutionary War reenactor named Libby Jensen. As brand new college freshmen, the Bowlts experience a newfound sense of freedom and responsibility in this season, and learn a lot about how to wield it.

⚡️Can I become a Bowlt?

YES! The best way is by supporting us here on IndieGoGo! We the Bowlts are a team of underdogs, so we're shooting this project on a shoestring budget and are only asking for what we absolutely need. Here are those EXACT needs, so you know where your money is going:

We know this may seem like a lot, but we promise to make it worth your while! We have so many bowling-themed perks that we are SO JEALOUS that you get to keep! And we're not just talking about your run-of-the-mill digital access BTS codes and movie posters, oh no! Many of our perks are handcrafted keepsakes made by our crew that you can display on your mantle and admire with fond remembrance of the young artists whose dream you have helped achieve.

⚡️Why should I become a Bowlt?

By joining the Bowlts team, you're adding to the burgeoning pool of diverse female voices in comedy! We're also pioneering something new. Our team is made up of many current students and alumni at Biola University, where a project of this type and scale has never been achieved. We feel uniquely qualified thanks to YEARS of planning, research, story refinement, and practical filmmaking experience amongst our crew.

But other than that, we really just think it'll be a lot of fun! We've spent 4 years condensing a seasons' worth of jokes, character development, and plot into five 10-minute episodes, and we couldn't love them more. We hope you'll feel the same way! 

⚡️How else can I help?

We get it - many of our friends are in or fresh out of college and don't have a big chunk of change to give. That's okay! You can still join our team by following, liking, and sharing our Instagram page, @bowlts, and sharing our IndieGoGo campaign on any social platform using their share tools!

Now, without any further ado,

It's tiiiiiiime to STRIKE!

story:
Short Summary

Demetrius Smith is a truck driver, author, producer and screenwriter with a flair for drama and dialogue. After a few years of driving while developing a story (web series), he completed his first dramatic script. Completely self-funded and with money earned from driving, MaCaleb Enterprise LLc was established. The first production is titled "Scandal at Riverside High." With the help of a  talented cast and crew, the goal is to turn these and other scripts into full-featured independent films/webisodes. The audience will simply be blown away by the wonderful story that this group of brilliant up-and-coming actors, directors and producers could bring to life on a meager budget. Their tireless efforts helped to lay the foundation for this epic suspense drama, which tells the sinister plot of a guidance counselor and just how far she is willing to go to gain control of a troubled inner-city high school. With donor support, the production of the entire first season can begin. Funds donated will be used to complete the project.  The funds will be allocated for paying principal cast members, supporting cast and crew, locations, equipment, travel, lodging/accommodations, catering, insurance, and miscellaneous expenses. If the financial goals aren't reached, MaCaleb Enterprise will forge on and utilize proceeds to continue producing community project ventures such as the promotional video shot for O.D. Wyatt High school in Fort Worth Tx. ( https://youtu.be/Sncdybs3EF4 ). It cost $5000 to produce the thirty-five-minute preview. It took over three full days of shooting.  After ten days of shooting and a budget of 15 thousand dollars, we can complete the entire first season.  As a show of appreciation for your donation, you can enjoy the thirty-minute short preview. Understandably, everyone can't contribute financially.  For those who can't donate, please help get the word out about this and future project by using Indiegogo share tools. Thanks in advance for your support.

story:
Short Summary

We're so glad you found us! Mel Owens and Kate Villa are two comedy writers who are filming some of the writing that they've been working on. Kate and Mel are both Upright Citizen's Brigade-trained, and Kate has worked in the digital department of UCB comedy, and on shows such as The President Show (comedy central), The Break With Michelle Wolf (netflix), and on MTV pilots. Mel is a producer whose work has been featured on ABC, MTV, Buzzfeed, Glamour, Cosmopolitan and various other outlets. 

We're funding most of this out of pocket - but this is just a bump to make sure that those working as directors, DPs, editors, and art directors on our sketches and shorts are paid. 

  • We've created a team of mostly women+ in leadership roles and want them to be proud of the sketch they're putting their time into by paying them for their time and expertise and making sure the production value stays as high as possible.
  • In creating these sketches, we're giving women+ a way to showcase themselves. These videos can then be used as proof of work we're all proud of when someone looking to hire one of these people asks, "Can you show me what you've been up to?" 

Work Begets Work. 

We want our team to continue to grow professionally and the money we put into them now is an investment in young artists being able to continue to develop their craft. 

What We Need

Let's break it down:

  • We are asking for $2000 (and if more is raised it will go towards our next round of sketches, which are already written), which will help to pay our directors, editors, DPs, sound recordist, Art Directors and any PAs/Gaffers we hire. It will also help to supplement our art budget for 3 sketches.
  • This money will also go towards renting a light kit, hard drives, and craft services for our performers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate monetarily, share this with your friends or with facebook groups you think might be excited about women in comedy. WE LOVE YOU FOR DOING ANY OF THIS!

story:
WELCOME BACK!

A humble start - where passion and imagination exploded with an overwhelming desire to tell a unique female-centered spy thriller featuring a forty-something badass battling bad memory loss while being chased by bad people and her badass past. Collecting clues from an unscrupulous dangerous boss. All to find her missing sister ... with a sexy-compelling twist. Phew! We pulled it off!

YOU made it happen. Yes, ya' did! Big Time!  And we couldn't be more GRATEFUL!

NOW, THE PEPPER PROJECT is back in ACTION with our next chapter, PEPPER: RICOCHET

PEPPER PATH

Following our premiere in New York City, The Pepper Project Pilot earned nearly thirty Awards and Nominations in International Festivals and Competitions from 2015-2018.  From Vancouver to Seoul, D.C. to Rio, Miami to Bilbao. Ranked the number-one U.S. digital series in the 2017 Web Series World Cup with a worldwide audience reach and global fan-base across five continents, we couldn't be more proud and encouraged. Why? Because we have a wide fan base and an unstoppable fiery-passion to create, to tell more of Pepper's story, to continue the journey of a strong yet vulnerable woman on the brink of unraveling, facing unique circumstances and challenges that are universally-familiar. Themes of regret and redemption, loss, loyalty, loneliness, and risk vs. reward are explored as we journey through the gritty, dark shadows of the dangerous past which haunts Pepper's soul and drives her mission to find Mercy.

 

We've also heard an enthusiastic love for more Pepper & Company:

"Where's the next chapter? What happens to Pepper and her team? We want more!"

YES! Thank You! We are READY and DYING to give it to you!

PEPPER FORWARD

Until very recently, while it is fact women comprise more than half the world's population, our stories have remained in the background of popular culture, often under-told and considered irrelevant. But the tide is changing, and, with the Pilot, The Pepper Project sought to help lead the charge! Pepper: Ricochet aims similarly. Female-filmmakers now occupy a stunning proportion, producing outstanding indie-content. As a series, The Pepper Project furthers female-centric narratives in an underrepresented age group as well, serving as a heads-up to industry executives that stories about powerful mature women on the edge and messy verge of imperfection are important, essential and gaining ground with an enthusiastic following.

INDUSTRY SPECS

The world of digital series story-telling and streaming has literally EXPLODED in the past five years, and, fortunately, with our success, we're ideally-poised to continue to ride this crazy-wonderful wave of OTT enthusiasm. If you subscribe to Netflix, HBO, Amazon, or Hulu, AMC, Showtime and SeekaTV, you know these platforms are hungry and looking for more ORIGINAL content. We've had the meetings! We're on the HOT RADAR of several platforms that have expressed interest in Pepper's story. We need more content for distribution, to pitch, to remain cutting-edge and current in an extremely competitive market. We've tons of energy to continue this exciting and promising-process and need your support to move forward. We are ready to RICOCHET!

THE MONEY $$$

The PEPPER RICOCHET chapter, approximately 15 minutes in length, films in two separate locations. One shoot is scheduled this summer at a beautiful outdoor lake-house which perfectly suits the scene to introduce Pepper's Godfather, Bald Sam. In the second phase, set to shoot this fall, we return to Pepper dangerously trapped in the stairwell.

Estimated production cost is $18K, We're seeking sponsorship for post production and marketing through brand placement and partial-matching contributions as well.

Your donation completely supports production costs for our next chapter, including:

Insurance, Locations, Permits. Transportation, Crew and Cast Salaries, Props, Food, Rentals, Hair & Makeup, Wardrobe, and, very important for this phase, Marketing.

WRAPPING UP ~ DONATE!

We're so excited for this next phase in THE PEPPER PROJECT'S development, and we can only do it with your support. So, please check out the exciting donation levels and perks on this page and contribute what you can - there are levels for all to become involved!

From a VIP LINK to see the Pilot (free for previous donors) to signed commemorative festival postcards and beautiful bottles of wine, to a Pepper Ricochet Signature Cocktail sponsored by Owl's Tail Cocktail Parlor and a Special Donor Dinner hosted by Chef Tom Valenti at Oxbow Tavern in New York City, we have many fun ways to involve you in the The Pepper Project's RICOCHET journey.

In addition, please forward the link to this fundraising page to everyone you know so they can become involved as well. You never know who wants to be a Producer! Thank you in advance for your generous support in advancing Pepper's story. A story that is universally-relatable, moving, engaging and holds promise for the future of female-leading stories and representation of women in the entertainment industry.

We are so grateful ~

Caris Vujcec, Creator, Executive Producer, Director

The Pepper Project, Pepper: Ricochet

PEPPER TEAM

The Pepper: Ricochet Team consists of a wonderful mix of returning creative, talented and generous-spirited industry pros, who together created the Pilot and are thrilled to return to RICOCHET!  We are blessed.

We are proud, once again, to have opportunities for our versatile team to be creative in all elements of this production - from the production staff to cast to styling and design. In what is often known to be a male-dominated industry, as with the pilot, we again strive for a healthy and eclectic balance. Everyone's ideas count. I love collaborating, it's how I most enjoy the creative process. That's an important part of THE PEPPER PROJECT PILOT and, again, with RICOCHET.

James Parson, Director of Photography (The Pepper Project Pilot Indie-Fest Award Winner, Best Cinematographer; Three-time Best Cinematography Nominee- Austin Web Fest, Minnesota Web Fest, New Jersey Web Fest); DP Credits: Sole Proprietor, Cut to Black, Prayer to a Vengeful God.

Josh Friedman, Producer.  Associate Producer/UPM, The Pepper Project Pilot.  As a Producer, Josh's recent credits include Warning Shot and Shadow Girl and, he was First A.D. for Premature, which premiered at Sundance.

 

Lenore Pemberton, Wardrobe Design: The Pepper Project Pilot Accolade Global Winner, Best Costume Design.

Matt Matossian, 2nd AC, Production Gear Supervisor. DP credits include: Story Half Told, a documentary series and Back to Brooklyn for the OWN Network with Iyanla Vanzant.

Jessica Green, DIT & Ricochet Editor. A multi-hypenate actor-director-editor; co-creator and co-lead of the award-winning series, Scratch This.

   

MaryLynn Suchan, Production Manager: MaryLynn is an LA-based Producer. Recently, she was the Production Coordinator on Heirlooms, an indie feature with Lynda Carter and Luke Wilson.

Mathia Vargas, Production Coordinator: Actor and budding producer, Mathia's recently co-produced the indie-comedy-pilot, The Small. As an actor, she can be seen in the 2019 Spirit Award winning film En El Septimo Dia, now streaming on HBO.

Rose Meade Hart, Entertainment Counsel

Jacquie Vujcec, Graphic Design

Mary S. Vujcec, Campaign Consultant

Pitch Trailer Cast: Rob Breckenridge, Kate Levy, Sid Williams, Scott Janes, Caris Vujcec

Thank you to Pepper: Ricochet Pitch Video Editors: Andrew Cohen & Jessica Green

Special Thanks to Steve Harper & Pilar Alessandro for their wisdom and support of The Pepper Project on this amazing journey!
story_txt:
WELCOME BACK! 

A humble start - where passion and imagination exploded with an overwhelming desire to tell a unique female-centered spy thriller featuring a forty-something badass battling bad memory loss while being chased by bad people and her badass past. Collecting clues from an unscrupulous dangerous boss. All to find her missing sister ... with a sexy-compelling twist. Phew! We pulled it off!
YOU made it happen. Yes, ya' did! Big Time!  And we couldn't be more GRATEFUL!
NOW, THE PEPPER PROJECT is back in ACTION with our next chapter, PEPPER: RICOCHET
PEPPER PATH
Following our premiere in New York City, The Pepper Project Pilot earned nearly thirty Awards and Nominations in International Festivals and Competitions from 2015-2018.  From Vancouver to Seoul, D.C. to Rio, Miami to Bilbao. Ranked the number-one U.S. digital series in the 2017 Web Series World Cup with a worldwide audience reach and global fan-base across five continents, we couldn't be more proud and encouraged. Why? Because we have a wide fan base and an unstoppable fiery-passion to create, to tell more of Pepper's story, to continue the journey of a strong yet vulnerable woman on the brink of unraveling, facing unique circumstances and challenges that are universally-familiar. Themes of regret and redemption, loss, loyalty, loneliness, and risk vs. reward are explored as we journey through the gritty, dark shadows of the dangerous past which haunts Pepper's soul and drives her mission to find Mercy.



 


We've also heard an enthusiastic love for more Pepper & Company:
"Where's the next chapter? What happens to Pepper and her team? We want more!"
YES! Thank You! We are READY and DYING to give it to you!
PEPPER FORWARD
Until very recently, while it is fact women comprise more than half the world's population, our stories have remained in the background of popular culture, often under-told and considered irrelevant. But the tide is changing, and, with the Pilot, The Pepper Project sought to help lead the charge! Pepper: Ricochet aims similarly. Female-filmmakers now occupy a stunning proportion, producing outstanding indie-content. As a series, The Pepper Project furthers female-centric narratives in an underrepresented age group as well, serving as a heads-up to industry executives that stories about powerful mature women on the edge and messy verge of imperfection are important, essential and gaining ground with an enthusiastic following.
INDUSTRY SPECS
The world of digital series story-telling and streaming has literally EXPLODED in the past five years, and, fortunately, with our success, we're ideally-poised to continue to ride this crazy-wonderful wave of OTT enthusiasm. If you subscribe to Netflix, HBO, Amazon, or Hulu, AMC, Showtime and SeekaTV, you know these platforms are hungry and looking for more ORIGINAL content. We've had the meetings! We're on the HOT RADAR of several platforms that have expressed interest in Pepper's story. We need more content for distribution, to pitch, to remain cutting-edge and current in an extremely competitive market. We've tons of energy to continue this exciting and promising-process and need your support to move forward. We are ready to RICOCHET!

THE MONEY $$$
The PEPPER RICOCHET chapter, approximately 15 minutes in length, films in two separate locations. One shoot is scheduled this summer at a beautiful outdoor lake-house which perfectly suits the scene to introduce Pepper's Godfather, Bald Sam. In the second phase, set to shoot this fall, we return to Pepper dangerously trapped in the stairwell.
Estimated production cost is $18K, We're seeking sponsorship for post production and marketing through brand placement and partial-matching contributions as well.
Your donation completely supports production costs for our next chapter, including:
Insurance, Locations, Permits. Transportation, Crew and Cast Salaries, Props, Food, Rentals, Hair & Makeup, Wardrobe, and, very important for this phase, Marketing.

WRAPPING UP ~ DONATE!
We're so excited for this next phase in THE PEPPER PROJECT'S development, and we can only do it with your support. So, please check out the exciting donation levels and perks on this page and contribute what you can - there are levels for all to become involved!
From a VIP LINK to see the Pilot (free for previous donors) to signed commemorative festival postcards and beautiful bottles of wine, to a Pepper Ricochet Signature Cocktail sponsored by Owl's Tail Cocktail Parlor and a Special Donor Dinner hosted by Chef Tom Valenti at Oxbow Tavern in New York City, we have many fun ways to involve you in the The Pepper Project's RICOCHET journey.
In addition, please forward the link to this fundraising page to everyone you know so they can become involved as well. You never know who wants to be a Producer! Thank you in advance for your generous support in advancing Pepper's story. A story that is universally-relatable, moving, engaging and holds promise for the future of female-leading stories and representation of women in the entertainment industry.
We are so grateful ~
Caris Vujcec, Creator, Executive Producer, Director

story:
The Wine Disciple

 

Hello, I'm Dan McGarry! My journey into wine began when I moved to Seattle and started working at a restaurant with a Wine Spectator "Grand Award" winning wine program. My curiosity piqued and with encouragement from family, friends, and co-workers, I decided to start my education with the Court of Master Sommeliers. As a result I’ve traveled around the world and close to home to learn as much about wine as possible.  That’s why I've become the Wine Disciple!  

And my name is Jeff Greer, the creator and producer of The Wine Disciple. I have worked for over twenty years in the hospitality industry and continue to be a student of service standards, spirits, beer, and of course wine. I also have started my path with the Court of Master Sommeliers. I am a filmmaker and hold BA in Broadcast Journalism. With this project I hope to marry these two disciplines, and share the knowledge and craftsmanship of winemakers across the region.

Our program will explore the processes and methods winemakers utilize to create great, and sometimes not so great wines. With each vintage, the elements bring various challenges and opportunities. Every bottle uncorked is a reflection of time, vision, and purpose. We will document this process from rootstock to  table. And we will taste and evaluate the finished product, and probably have a little fun at some point along the way.

Our goal is to raise $12,000 to shoot three pilot episodes. They will have a home on Vimeo and YouTube and will be linked to on our website, which will have written reviews and other wine resources. Each episode will encompass a different AVA in the region, hopefully around the harvest time from early September to mid October. To supplement these programs there will be blind tasting contests, wine reviews, and wine tutorials from professionals and teachers from across the industry spectrum.

The success of this campaign will determine the level of coverage we our able to provide. Each episode is budgeted at $4,000 with $3,000 being allotted to pay and feed a cast and crew of four. Another $1,000 will go to incidentals incurred during travel and production. Obviously if we exceed our goal, the level of production value goes up, as does the likelihood of future episodes and the viability of the project going forward.

Yes we want your money. But we also want your enthusiasm and your help. Not interested in wine? Tell a friend who is. Share our link on Facebook. Any and all resources are welcome and greatly appreciated. Check out our perks, and look out for tasting events and wine pairings you can be a part of in the future.

This is a labor of love, and something we want to share with the world. Please help us make it a reality.

Thanks,

Jeff and Dan

story:
Mann Overboard is about Doug Mann…

…who’s sweet deal of a life falls apart at the seams. He goes from being a guy who has it all in an upper east side apartment to living on a 2nd hand boat pumping his own poop, docked in a Bronx Marina surrounded by an eccentric band of real boat people.

 

We’ve assembled an amazing creative team:  

Director: British born, Sam Cadman His many prestigious honors and awards, include both Silver and Bronze Lions at the Cannes International Festival of Creativity.

Creator-Producer: Jordan Jacobson is an Addy and DMA award-winning creative director and screenwriter. He has written and produced over 30 broadcast commercials.   

Creator-Producer: Neal Lerner is an screenwriter and actor with a recurring role on Amazon’s Red Oaks, and has appeared in over 60 TV shows and films. He graduated Yale School of Drama. 

Executive Producer: Adam Philipson is CEO and President of Count Basie Center for the Arts and one of the Associate Producers of Alanis Morriset's Broadway bound, Jagged Little Pill.

Our wonderful producers, Besties Make Movies

Producers: Besties Make Movies: Stacey Maltin and Marzy Hart are independent content creators for film & television.  Their work has screened at Dances With Films, NewFest, OutFest, Twister Alley, Sene Film Festival, Soho International Film Festival, New York Television Festival, ITVfest and Cinequest Film Festival. 

Art Director+Scenic Designer: Katherine Citti is a set designer and art director based in Brooklyn, NY. She has worked on film and television projects including “The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel” (Amazon), “Bull” (CBS), “White Snake” (LucasFilm), and “The Only Living Boy in New York” (Amazon/Big Indie).

What is a 'teaser' for TV show? 

Mann Overboard is a proof of concept. It's basically a short version of our half hour TV pilot.  By coming on board, you'll be investing in a blistering authentic and truly funny TV show!

Your contributions will help fund production costs, which will include: 

  • Location fees
  • Insurance
  • Casting Director
  • Actors and crew
  • Food, aka: craft services
  • Post production and so much more! 

What's In It for You?

Great question! You get to be on the 'ground floor' of creating an innovative TV show where the people and places are diverse and unique in ways not often seen in a comedy TV series. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can contribute whatever amount you're comfortable with and also...

  • Share this Indiegogo link with all of your family and friends... and on social media - Facebook, Instagram and Twitter

The Liveaboards!

story:
Let's Make Golf Cool, Together!

Golf is awesome. Like, really awesome. You know that. We know that. Now the rest of the world needs to see that. Our simple mission to grow the game of golf by entertaining & delighting golfers & non-golfers alike. 

Like it or not, golf is often seen as stuffy and boring and something "your father played" - we want to change that misconception. 

There are many great golf shows out there, but most focus on the technical aspects of the game. We are focusing on what's fun about golf - the connection, the camaraderie and the adventure! 

.......Oh and did we mention the food and craft cocktails?

Our show will appeal to millennials, non golfers and even show why your next golf trip can be a family adventure!

Subscribe to the show at LetsPlayThru.com

 

Why Us?


We have unique access

Our show host, Gabriel Aluisy, is an international educator and good will ambassador for the game of golf and private clubs. He frequently travels the world visiting and working with the most sought after golf properties. 

Here are a few of his accomplishments: 

  • Host of Private Club Radio - a podcast on private club management that has reached 60,000+ unique listeners worldwide 
  • Author of 3 books on Golf and Private Club Marketing 
  • Keynote speaker to golf and club industry in the Americas, Europe and Asia
  • Founder of The Private Club Agency - helping clubs around the world market their membership 

 

We have a crew of award-winning filmmakers and story-tellers

Together, our crew has: 

  • 9  Communicator Awards
  • 3 Gold Telly Awards
  • International film and television credits on major networks like Discovery, Fox & PBS

 

We're Golfers & Foodies!

We love golfing and we love tasting the most extraordinary foods available. We have an unmatched passion for both!

 

What's In It For You?

  1. You're helping to grow the game - we're going to put millions of eyeballs on the game of golf. You can be instrumental in helping us spread the message. 
  2. Awesome gifts - by joining our launch team we've got some pretty sweet shirts, hats and balls for you to show off on your next round. 
  3. Grand Prize - you have the chance to join us on our next golf travel adventure! Each sponsorship level gives you an entry or multiple entries into our drawing to Play Thru with us on a future episode.

story:
THE WHAT

“Ensemble” is a fast-paced, character-driven, half-hour, student television comedy mini-series that highlights the complexity and hilarity of college conservatory theatre.

From full-on take-downs for the lead role in a musical, to the pressure cookers of working together to make a 24-hour play festival happen, this show explores the nuance and gut-busting irony of the shows within a show - all set to original CLASSIC ROCK music.

Faster-paced and less self-deprecating than Glee, and less cheesy and more self-aware than High School Musical. Think mockumentary-style confessionals with college students, and a stage not big enough for all of them.

 

THE WHY

“Ensemble” was created by USC Comedy Television Writers, a student organization dedicated to creating a half-hour comedy writers room environment and producing student-made television work. The team comes from various schools within USC: the School of Cinematic Arts, the School of Dramatic Arts, and the Thornton School of Music.

With Ensemble, the team hopes to create meaningful, collaborative, comedy-driven content and further the creative education received at USC, past the walls of a classroom. We are devoted to writing characters of diversity–from various racial, ethnic, religious, and sexual backgrounds–and sharing our love for the visual and performing arts. “Ensemble” is a love letter to the theatre community, and we hope to bring the heart, humor, and inclusiveness of this community to a television audience.

 

THE HOW

We are shooting our pilot this April. To cover our production costs for industry-standard cameras, lighting, and sound equipment, and to support our incredibly dedicated and hardworking cast and crew, we need your help!

Everything we receive on this page will go towards building the world of "Ensemble"! We plan to release the pilot in May 2017. With any extra funds, we will be able to begin pre-production for the rest of Season 1, shooting this fall.

Thank you so much for helping "Ensemble" be the best show it can be!

 

THE WHO

Our main cast includes current students from USC’s School of Dramatic Arts. 

And here are some of the people working behind-the-scenes to bring this project to life:

 

Mary Bronaugh (Executive Producer/Showrunner) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who loves to write and direct for student television and theatre, perform improvisational comedy, write poetry, and romanticize men she doesn't even know (which is to say, perform improvisational comedy and write poetry). She has served as Stage Manager and Assistant Director for Brand New Theatre, a student organization that promotes and produces student-written work, and is currently the USC School of Cinematic Arts Undergraduate Student Council Writing for Screen and Television Representative, so, the USCSCAUSCWSTR. She is the head staff writer and Co-Executive Producer of Puns for Ensemble, and her favorite parts of her job include being creatively smacked down by Carl Albert in the writers' room, responding by threatening to fire him, and cowering in fear and dismay as all of the other writers then threaten to overthrow "this autocracy!".

 

Leila Hoffpauir (Co-Executive Producer) was born in Huntsville, AL but tells people she is from New Orleans because it sounds cooler. When she is not attempting to become a semi-successful actor or working on Ensemble, she is also a senior producer on Trojan Vision's comedy show The Breakdown. She is also technically a member of Undergraduate Student Government but quit going to meetings months ago. Her hobbies include trying on clothes and throwing them in a pile on the floor and then washing them all even though it costs more money than if she'd just separate the clothes and only wash the dirty ones, and running (i.e. away from her problems). She is also an award-winning New Orleans actress and can do a crazy good Long Island accent.

 

Lexie Chu (Lead Series Producer) lives and breathes film and theatre, citing all pre-2000’s Disney musical soundtracks as her life source. Other than aspiring to bridge the gap between theatre and film through producing, she adores voice directing, world-building in film/TV through production design, and spending her free time watching more animated children's programming than she’d like to admit. She also runs a noodle review/enthusiast blog even though her parents have encouraged her to pursue healthier activities, like doing yoga to make herself taller. Lexie currently studies Film & Television Production with a minor in Theatre at USC’s Schools of Cinematic and Dramatic Arts.

 

Carl Albert (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) got his start with the highest form of writing – fanfiction – and soon enough found himself excited by the prospect of filmmaking when he discovered the Oscar-nominated psychological thriller-drama, Marvel’s The Avengers. He seeks only to affect his audience with his work in a passionately emotional, and possibly even lover-like way, such as by making them throw up or pee their pants laughing. In his free time, Carl enjoys a good book, long walks on the beach at sunset, and hearing the cries of his fallen enemies. He is most influenced by the reincarnation of William Shakespeare, or, as his legion of fans known him, Mr. Worldwide aka Pitbull aka Armando-freaking-Perez, and his now iconic quote, ‘Big News, Pitbull, Tom Cruise, Mumbai.’"

 

Natalie Cohn-Aronoff (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) hails from Princeton, New Jersey, and has considerable experience with theatre, prose, and self-deprecating humor - which somehow landed her in film school. She is currently in the USC Writing for Screen and Television program, where she seeks to complicate the stories we tell with diverse characters whose lives are underrepresented on screen, relentless feminist critique, and an acerbic wit. Natalie can usually be found method acting extroversion, watching hockey, or weeping over Les Misérables. Though she is Israeli and American by citizenship, she’s a Canadian at heart. She hopes one day to be the first screenwriter-attorney-senator.

 

Becca Mann (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) is a Writing for Screen and Television major at USC. Never happy with the way books or TV series ended, Becca decided she wanted to be the one controlling the story, igniting a passion for writing. In addition, Becca is a member of the USA Swimming National Team and loves chocolate, traveling, pretending she can sing, and the ocean. She also published a novel two years ago called The Stolen Dragon of Quanx, which was a finalist in the 2015 IAN Book of the Year Awards.

 

Chasey Ridgley (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) grew up in Omaha, Nebraska and became enamoured with television at an early age, deciding to become a screenwriter. She is currently earning her Bachelor's of Fine Arts at University of Southern California in Writing for Screen and Television. She enjoys long hikes, writing, and dogs.

 

Kennedy Reed (Production Designer/Casting Director/Associate Producer) is in USC's Television and Film Production program. She also enjoys acting, singing, songwriting, watching TV/movies, and making videos for her YouTube channel.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand not everyone can donate, but there are many ways you can help support the show:

  • Tell others about Ensemble!
  • If you’re as excited as us to make this show, please like, share, and spread our Indiegogo campaign and our Facebook Page! Find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/ensembleminiseries/.

 

Every bit counts, and we will keep you updated with behind-the-scenes news every step of the way! Thank you ALL again for your support!
story_txt:
THE WHAT“Ensemble” is a fast-paced, character-driven, half-hour, student television comedy mini-series that highlights the complexity and hilarity of college conservatory theatre.From full-on take-downs for the lead role in a musical, to the pressure cookers of working together to make a 24-hour play festival happen, this show explores the nuance and gut-busting irony of the shows within a show - all set to original CLASSIC ROCK music.Faster-paced and less self-deprecating than Glee, and less cheesy and more self-aware than High School Musical. Think mockumentary-style confessionals with college students, and a stage not big enough for all of them. THE WHY“Ensemble” was created by USC Comedy Television Writers, a student organization dedicated to creating a half-hour comedy writers room environment and producing student-made television work. The team comes from various schools within USC: the School of Cinematic Arts, the School of Dramatic Arts, and the Thornton School of Music.With Ensemble, the team hopes to create meaningful, collaborative, comedy-driven content and further the creative education received at USC, past the walls of a classroom. We are devoted to writing characters of diversity–from various racial, ethnic, religious, and sexual backgrounds–and sharing our love for the visual and performing arts. “Ensemble” is a love letter to the theatre community, and we hope to bring the heart, humor, and inclusiveness of this community to a television audience. THE HOWWe are shooting our pilot this April. To cover our production costs for industry-standard cameras, lighting, and sound equipment, and to support our incredibly dedicated and hardworking cast and crew, we need your help!Everything we receive on this page will go towards building the world of "Ensemble"! We plan to release the pilot in May 2017. With any extra funds, we will be able to begin pre-production for the rest of Season 1, shooting this fall.Thank you so much for helping "Ensemble" be the best show it can be! THE WHOOur main cast includes current students from USC’s School of Dramatic Arts. And here are some of the people working behind-the-scenes to bring this project to life: Mary Bronaugh (Executive Producer/Showrunner) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who loves to write and direct for student television and theatre, perform improvisational comedy, write poetry, and romanticize men she doesn't even know (which is to say, perform improvisational comedy and write poetry). She has served as Stage Manager and Assistant Director for Brand New Theatre, a student organization that promotes and produces student-written work, and is currently the USC School of Cinematic Arts Undergraduate Student Council Writing for Screen and Television Representative, so, the USCSCAUSCWSTR. She is the head staff writer and Co-Executive Producer of Puns for Ensemble, and her favorite parts of her job include being creatively smacked down by Carl Albert in the writers' room, responding by threatening to fire him, and cowering in fear and dismay as all of the other writers then threaten to overthrow "this autocracy!". Leila Hoffpauir (Co-Executive Producer) was born in Huntsville, AL but tells people she is from New Orleans because it sounds cooler. When she is not attempting to become a semi-successful actor or working on Ensemble, she is also a senior producer on Trojan Vision's comedy show The Breakdown. She is also technically a member of Undergraduate Student Government but quit going to meetings months ago. Her hobbies include trying on clothes and throwing them in a pile on the floor and then washing them all even though it costs more money than if she'd just separate the clothes and only wash the dirty ones, and running (i.e. away from her problems). She is also an award-winning New Orleans actress and can do a crazy good Long Island accent. Lexie Chu (Lead Series Producer) lives and breathes film and theatre, citing all pre-2000’s Disney musical soundtracks as her life source. Other than aspiring to bridge the gap between theatre and film through producing, she adores voice directing, world-building in film/TV through production design, and spending her free time watching more animated children's programming than she’d like to admit. She also runs a noodle review/enthusiast blog even though her parents have encouraged her to pursue healthier activities, like doing yoga to make herself taller. Lexie currently studies Film & Television Production with a minor in Theatre at USC’s Schools of Cinematic and Dramatic Arts. Carl Albert (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) got his start with the highest form of writing – fanfiction – and soon enough found himself excited by the prospect of filmmaking when he discovered the Oscar-nominated psychological thriller-drama, Marvel’s The Avengers. He seeks only to affect his audience with his work in a passionately emotional, and possibly even lover-like way, such as by making them throw up or pee their pants laughing. In his free time, Carl enjoys a good book, long walks on the beach at sunset, and hearing the cries of his fallen enemies. He is most influenced by the reincarnation of William Shakespeare, or, as his legion of fans known him, Mr. Worldwide aka Pitbull aka Armando-freaking-Perez, and his now iconic quote, ‘Big News, Pitbull, Tom Cruise, Mumbai.’" Natalie Cohn-Aronoff (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) hails from Princeton, New Jersey, and has considerable experience with theatre, prose, and self-deprecating humor - which somehow landed her in film school. She is currently in the USC Writing for Screen and Television program, where she seeks to complicate the stories we tell with diverse characters whose lives are underrepresented on screen, relentless feminist critique, and an acerbic wit. Natalie can usually be found method acting extroversion, watching hockey, or weeping over Les Misérables. Though she is Israeli and American by citizenship, she’s a Canadian at heart. She hopes one day to be the first screenwriter-attorney-senator. Becca Mann (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) is a Writing for Screen and Television major at USC. Never happy with the way books or TV series ended, Becca decided she wanted to be the one controlling the story, igniting a passion for writing. In addition, Becca is a member of the USA Swimming National Team and loves chocolate, traveling, pretending she can sing, and the ocean. She also published a novel two years ago called The Stolen Dragon of Quanx, which was a finalist in the 2015 IAN Book of the Year Awards. Chasey Ridgley (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) grew up in Omaha, Nebraska and became enamoured with television at an early age, deciding to become a screenwriter. She is currently earning her Bachelor's of Fine Arts at University of Southern California in Writing for Screen and Television. She enjoys long hikes, writing, and dogs. Kennedy Reed (Production Designer/Casting Director/Associate Producer) is in USC's Television and Film Production program. She also enjoys acting, singing, songwriting, watching TV/movies, and making videos for her YouTube channel. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPWe understand not everyone can donate, but there are many ways you can help support the show:

Tell others about Ensemble!
If you’re as excited as us to make this show, please like, share, and spread our Indiegogo campaign and our Facebook Page! Find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/ensembleminiseries/.
 Every bit counts, and we will keep you updated with behind-the-scenes news every step of the way! Thank you ALL again for your support!

story:
HELP ME!

Hey I'm Randy! I'm a grown up who's never smoked weed before and I've decided it's time! Depending on where you live, marijuana laws vary quite a bit. There is a general trend of decriminalization that eventually can lead to legalization in some form or another. But people are still getting arrested and put in jail for minor marijuana offenses. I want to see what marijuana is all about and finally smoke it for the first time, and I want to do it in the silliest way possible that will also highlight how inconsistent and silly the current state of marijuana legislation really is. 

BUT WHO THE HELL AM I?

Here is a braggy bio that describes me in detail!

"Randy Liedtke is a Los Angeles based Stand Up Comedian, Actor, and Writer. He delivers a silly mix of strangely smart childish jokes and creative unorthodox bits. He makes both the absurd and surreal hilarious and somehow logical. In 2015 his Half Hour special on Comedy Central aired and his debut album on Comedy Central Records "I'm on a Roll" broke into the top ten on iTunes. He has also performed Stand Up on Conan, Late Night with Seth Meyers, Adam Devine's House Party, and Last ComicStanding.  LA Weekly named him one of 10 Comedy Acts to Watch in 2015 and the Village Voice said he's "maddeningly great". He was one of Comedy Central's Comics to Watch in 2013 and was a stand out at the prestigious Just For Laughs Festival in Montreal as part of the New Face showcase in 2014.  You may have seen him on Comedy Central's @midnight, IFC's Maron and Comedy Bang Bang, or heard his voice on Cartoon Network's Adventure Time."

RARE CHANCE!

How often does a 33 year old comedian who's never used marijuana before, decide to do so on camera in a super weird convoluted way in the middle of the dessert? Not very often, and now you get to help make it happen! Please help me, it's an idea I've had for a while now and I really want to be able to share my first experience with as many people as possible. I'm even considering doubling down on first time experiences and getting my first tattoo, a marijuana leaf to commemorate my experience!

WHAT WILL BE MADE?

The final product will be a short form web documentary that is not only funny but creates a conversation. The goal is to have this shot, edited and released for you to watch on April 20th (4/20). Watch me plan the events that will take place. Watch my buy weed for the first time. Watch me prepare for every possible outcome. And watch me smoke for the first time ever. Will I freak out? Will nothing happen? Will I be a stereotypical stoner idiot who laughs at everything? Who knows!?

UNIQUE!

There's lots of information on the internet on how to smoke weed for the first time, and I'm guessing none of them suggest renting a limo, driving to where four different states borders meet, interviewing police officers, and then trying not to accidentally stumble across an imaginary line for fear of going to jail for 6 months. This will be unlike anyone's first experience and unlike anything that's ever been made.

I NEED MONEY TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

I don't want to waste your money, I want to make this frugally, but I also want to do it justice and create something worth while. The more money I receive the better it will be. We want to shoot and finish this project faster than usual so we can release it on 4/20, so please donate and help out ASAP! Most of the money will go to travel expenses. I will need to fly myself, 2 crew members, and a friend who smokes a lot of weed with me to Colorado.  We will need hotel rooms, a rental car, and possibly a limo because that might be the only way to legally smoke weed in the parking lot of the monument. There are going to be lots of different obstacles to over come and being able to spend a few days in Colorado to make sure we have the time to not cut any corners will be very helpful. I need to be able to pay crew members to run camera and sound, and to direct and edit the final product. There is also talk of making a weed drone! I've said too much! Please donate so you can see what happens!

Please donate so you can see what happens!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea Ridgeway. I was born in Phoenix, Arizona and studied Theatre/Drama at Arizona State University. Since I’ve moved to Los Angeles to pursue my acting career I have done fifteen short films, three television pilots, two web-series, one play, and countless comedic sketches featured on my Youtube Channel. I directed my first short film last year at the Collaboration Filmmakers Challenge where I was awarded the “Collaborator Award”. I have studied improvisation at Second City and The Groundlings, along with scene study at Ivana Chubbuck Studios. Feel free to check out my website www.andrearidgeway.com. Over the years I have consistently written myself content from sketches to commercials, a feature, and now this series, my favorite: The Many Addictions of Chloe.

After nearly six years of pursuing my acting career here I have realized that it’s not just acting that is important to me. I live my life by the quote“If your dreams don’t scare you they aren’t big enough”. I have aspirations to do enormous things with my life and very few of them are small. To name a few: Becoming President, building homeless shelters, speaking out on a massive scale about the benefits of living a plant-based life/diet, and more! But I digress. I am telling you this so you know more about who I am deep down. So you know that I really care about other people, animals, and our planet. This campaign is a step in the direction to where I need to go to do bigger, better things for not only my life but other people’s lives as well.

This campaign is to help me raise funds to create a very high quality pilot that is executed extremely well. Top executives at production companies and digital platform companies have said that right now they are looking for content that is WELL EXECUTED, even if it does not have an all-star cast. If the acting, script, editing, direction, and all of the various components are executed well this series CAN GO PLACES. I believe that this series is unique, funny, and can be successful if we can start off with an amazing pilot.

What We Need & What You Get

Your financial assistance will help fund our pilot, including paying half a dozen actors and about twice as many crew. Even a small shoot requires a director, camera operators, lighting and sound technicians, continuity, set decorators, make-up, craft services, transportation, equipment rentals, and insurance. Post production expenses include an editor, soundtrack music, music licensing (a very crucial element to this series), sound mixing, color grading and titles. We’ll be producing under Ultra Low Budget SAG New Media. Our budget may be shoestring, but we do things right.

My cast/crew may need to take time away from their survival job to be on my set so they must be paid; a small but reasonable amount for the work. I will also have professionals on set that do film-making full-time therefore, they cannot say “yes” to my project unless I am paying. This project allows everyone to get one step closer to fulfilling their creative dreams.

Are YOU an artist working in a restaurant or a corporate cubicle? Let us help you get that artistic relief that you’ve been needing when you join us at the $200, $300, or $350 contribution levels. Work on set, be an actor for a day, for $750 you can be an associate producer, and for $1000 you can have lunch with Chloe and many other perks!

Is that a little out of your price range? How about a copy of the series, complete with exclusive special features? A cool t-shirt that proclaims your support? A signed poster? A cute pen? We've got you covered. A contribution at any level will get you a sneak preview of The Many Addictions of Chloe – prior to its release to the public!

Remember, art of all kinds is an important aspect of civilization. The world needs you!

Our plan is in place, scripts are polished, the cast is excited, and so are we. We are good to go and all we need is the rest of the funding.

And if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and sharing on social media. Help us spread the word, and you get that undying gratitude we mentioned.

Any amount helps. Seriously. Anything.

Thank you!

The Impact

This project is immensely important to me. I have developed this series over the last two years and it is finally polished and ready to film. This series came about from my struggle with addiction which inspired me to help others to seek help as well. I have “an addictive personality” but I am lucky enough to be able to manage my life and control these tendencies. Other people whose lives are overtaken with addiction aren’t so lucky. We all know someone who suffers from some form of addiction and most of the time there is very little we can actually do to help them. At the end of every episode there will be a website or phone number to encourage people to seek help for themselves or others.

Although Chloe sometimes becomes addicted to things that are seemingly innocent or harmless, she comes close to destroying her own life in every episode. This series shows the severity of addiction in a way that is easier to bear than the grueling reality of other harsher substances.

I am extremely organized and detail oriented. Last year I ran a very smooth shoot when I directed my first short film. I was efficient with my time and had an extremely talented cast/crew that made everything turn out successful. The shoot for The Many Addictions of Chloe will be ran with very high standards so that we can develop top quality results. In addition to that I have been professionally acting for 14 years so I am very familiar with how to make this a successful production.

Risks & Challenges

I promise to be open and honest to all of the fans and contributors to this project. If I cannot raise the necessary budget to shoot the pilot then the entire project will be delayed until further funding is raised. I know where my strengths and weaknesses lie so I am well equipped to face any obstacles that comes my way. For example, I know I don’t have a celebrity cast but I have an incredibly talented cast/crew, along with a fantastic script that will make this appealing when I try to “shop” this series around. I have a strong network of professional filmmakers that I can tap into for any resource, question, or issue that comes up.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute a donation you can help by offering any resources you have available and/or sharing this to all of your friends/family. There is an Indigogo Share option that allows you to send this campaign out via e-mail, Facebook, or other social media. I would greatly appreciate it if you could please tell people about the campaign to help spread the word and make this campaign a success.

story:
Old campaign link: https://igg.me/at/bulletsofjustice

 

"Bullets Of Justice"

 

   During the Third World War, the American government initiates a secret project code named "Army Bacon" in order to create super soldier by inbreeding human beings with pigs.

   25 years later a breed called "Muzzles" have occupied top of the food chain, eating and farming humans like animals.

   Rob Justice is an ex-bounty hunter working for the last line of human resistance - a group of survivors hiding in a nuclear bunker deep underground. His mission is to find out how muzzles came to power and destroy them.

 

“Bullets of Justice” is a pilot episode of TV series in the genre of black satire, action, horror.  During the filming process we decided to allocate post-production budget into shooting in order to express our ideas the way we wanted to. As most of the scenes require a lot of visual effects, we need your help so we could finish the product and deliver it.

 

              

 

 

It is an independent project created by friends with the idea to finish the pilot episode as an introduction for future series. As an appreciation for your help we've compiled a set of perks which includes masks, props that were used during the shooting and even a role in the next episode. 

We will make sure that the pilot episode of "Bullets Of Justice" will intrigue you in the most interesting ways. 

 

You can always contact us if you have any questions:

timur@turisbekov.com

Perks:

T-Shirt

Silkscreen limited edition poster

 

Danny Trejo Vest

Custom PS4 Stand
