story:
Invest in the Stories You Wish to See

Stories by comedic women. Stories about Mental Health. Spooky Emotional Stories. "I Feel Funny" is a comedy show about EMOTIONS. Through sketch comedy and short vignettes, we bring light-heartedness into the feelings that weigh on us most. Yup, we got 99 problems, but a joke ain't one. Who are WE?

Elsa Bermudez - artist, writer, magical person: @elsabermudez

Caroline Castro - writer, list maker, overall over-thinker with a sweet heart: @thecarolinecastro

Jennifer Epperson - self-proclaimed "down-beat" brainiac, and published writer: @comeonejennfoo

Francis Fuster -writer, props master, parodist: @fusterduster

Guest writer Essence Stuart - producer, writer, star: @1blackstar

Yes. We're all women. From different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, races, persuasions, experiences. We all hurt and we all laugh, and we wrote about it. Together. We made something really fun from our pain and invite you to join our creative venture. Our investors elevate our stories, and we thank you!

 

Change Media with .99 cents

We are writing something we've never seen before. We are funding these new stories. We're inviting investors on the ground-level because we want to connect beyond our network. And even possibly create beyond our net worth. With .99 cents from a larger community, we can do a lot.

We're asking for:

-$5 from 400 people

-OR $1,000 from 2 people

-OR $1 from 2,000 people

These funds will help with basic costs for hiring DPs (directors of photography) and editors. We built this project from the ground up, using our resources, and as we branch out, we want to recruit and reward strong talent. 

DPs alone can cost up $1,500 to film 9 short sketches

Editors range from $500-1000. 

This doesn't include costs for props, costumes, our own time, or paying actors and production assistants (which would be a dream). We are filling the gaps and serving in many of these roles as we produce. We have a team of over 12 people volunteering their time to make this project happen. Because we find the work to be important and valuable. 

Launch With Us, Invest in Our Stories:

And gain rewards!

$1 - a special preview link to our first episode

$2 - we make a social media post with your funny feeling, check out our IG for examples! Do you feel "too much", don't! You're just enough and so is $2+ and a follow!

$5 - get a shout out at our premiere, October 31st

$22 - a VIP ticket to our show, OCTOBER 31st!

$200- have your name snuck into scenes, or in the credits!

$1,000 - receive a producers credit

Posting also helps! Share, re-post, invite people to our show! Help us bring levity and awareness to everyday mental health. 

More to Gain: The NYC Women's Fund

2k helps us hire women and other PoC to film, edit & produce our scripts for submission to the NYC Women's Fund. With a solid application, we are eligible for up to 20k in grant funding. But we're only asking for 2k for our submission.  We are not waiting on grant money to make our show. We've already begun.

We've been meeting and writing sketches since May. We're filming every weekend in September. We edit in October. "I Feel Funny" premieres October 31st at the Magnet Theater in NYC (at 7pm). 

Join us as we create!

story:
Just because our campaign is over doesn't mean you still can't get in on the action! Check out the perks still available to your right and consider making a donation to help keep this webseries going. Production is in full swing on Season One and if you donate then we may just be able to make more than nine episodes! Plus a donation gets you early access to production updates, stills, and more! That's pretty friggin' great. So what are you waiting for?

In the meantime, check out the first episode below!

UPDATE (9/29): It's finally here! Check out the first episode of our series below.


 

"We're Pretty Terrible" is a pretty standard story. Four friends live their lives. It's about something and nothing at all once. And most importantly, it's hilarious. (And that's not just us tooting our own horn. Two out of our four moms told us that. So you know it's true cause our moms said it.)

What started as a one-off sketch making fun of Chase and Alex has become an eight-episode digital series making fun of all of us and our own awful quirks. In a world full of terrible things, we want to be the kind of terrible you can laugh at. So come together and laugh at our expense. We promise we can handle it.

OUR CAST:

We've already produced one of eight episodes and are gearing up to share that during the run of our campaign. However, to make the other seven we need your help. We're not trying to break the bank! We've budgeted all seven remaining episodes of our series to come in at exactly $5,000.  So please take a look at the full breakdown of our campaign listed below and please consider giving something. Even if it's just a little, because a lot of a little definitely starts to add up!

 

  • CREW COSTS - 30% ($1500)
    We have a lot of incredible crew members whose talent isn’t complimentary. So we’d love to be able to pay them what they deserve for the outstanding services they provide. This includes payment to all the wonderful people we have running camera, sound, lighting, and all other aspects of production that allow us to make our vision a reality.

  • PRODUCTION COSTS - 60% ($3000)
    The price of our various production costs is by far our largest expense. The money allotted for production costs will cover camera, lenses, and sound recording equipment. It will cover lights and potential special effects. It will also take care of production design and all the props and items we’ll need to make the location look great. Additionally, this will be used to cover all of our post-production expenses including editing, color correction, score, and final sound edits.

  • CRAFT SERVICES - 10% ($500)
    Over the course of seven episodes we’ll have a lot of mouths to feed and while the four main actors have every intention of going without any food or snacks, we’ll still need to provide for the remaining cast and crew. As a matter of fact, we pay our gaffer exclusively in fruit snacks. Your $5 will provide this otherwise starving gaffer with a full belly for at least two full production days.

 

Just because the campaign is over doesn't mean you still can't grab some awesome perks! Some of our perks for donating are bonkers. We have everything from character posters to "We're Pretty Terrible" coloring books to a photo shoot with Chase. We have early access to episodes and personalized rap songs! And that's just the tip of the iceberg.

Browse through everything to your right and see if any of it strikes your fancy. Also take a look just below this paragraph and see some examples of the great things we have to offer as a token of appreciation for your donation.



Trying to create eight of anything is a risky endeavor. We've seen the showstopper round on The Great British Bake-Off. It's not easy. That being said we recognize that the journey to create this will not be an easy one, but we've assessed many potential risks. Look we know that scheduling, location, and weather issues may arise. 

We met our goal and now we want to churn out eight incredible episodes that you and many others would love. We may hit some bumps along the way, but we believe in complete transparency. If a risk or problem arises, then we are obligated to share that with our donors.

We are committed to keeping full updates on our production calendar available to you. We will share behind-the-scenes shots, sneak peeks of the script, and on-set videos so you can join us through the process of creating every episode. We believe that by keeping constant open lines of communication through the production process changes potential "risks" to "solvable problems."

Core Team (Creators & Actors)

  • CHASE ANDERSON - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7369305
    Co-Director/Co-Producer/Marketing Magnate

  • ALEXANDER BAXTER - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm9098095
    Co-Producer/Emperor of Fun

  • KAYLA GIBSON - http://www.imdb.me/kaylagibson
    Co-Producer/Queen of Organization

  • JONOTHON MITCHELL - http://www.imdb.me/jonothonmitchell
    Creator/Co-Director/Co-Producer/Money Monarch & Social Media Sovereign

Key Crew (Cinetek Productions + Others)

  • ZAKK MARTIN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5902236
    Director of Photography/Cinetek Productions

  • ANTHONY COPPOLA - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm9234245
    1st Assistant Director

  • CAITLYN SILVIUS -http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8518583
    1st Assistant Camera

  • PHIVAN NGUYEN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8372752
    2nd Assistant Camera/Cinetek Productions

  • RYAN MAIRE - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7005040
    Sound Mixer/Cinetek Productions

  • CHAD KIMBREL - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7005039
    Editor/Cinetek Productions

  • JOSH COBURN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6504804
    Gaffer/Cinetek Productions

  • Additional crew announced at a later date.

Share Our Campaign!

We understand that circumstances may prevent you from donating money to our campaign. However, if you're as invested in the idea as we are please take the time to pass our campaign along to your network via a quick Facebook status or maybe wrap it up in 140 characters or less on Twitter. More eyes means more opportunity for us to share this wonderful project and for us that's a big win.

Follow Us On the Web!

  • WE'RE PRETTY TERRIBLE
    Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/prettyterribleseries
    Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/prettyterribleseries

  • PROBLEM ATTIC PRODUCTIONS
    Official Website: http://www.problematticproductions.com
    Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/problematticproductions
    Instagram:  http://www.instagram.com/problematticprod

Thank you so much for your time and consideration!
We look forward to working with you to create something outstanding!

story:
Luna Seven is a Fantasy/Drama set in the year 1945, and follows Elizabeth Miller, a young woman who has offered up her soul in exchange for her brothers life. Elizabeth must journey through the Lunascape; ‘the world of the dead’ and complete a series of trials set by the ancient gods of old. With only 48 hours before her brothers fate is sealed - Time is running out.

 

Why we need your help!

Many people have been effected by the recent pandemic, especially those who work within the creative industry. Due to Covid-19, Production for our new series has been post-poned and large amounts of funding has gone to waste. We are seeking YOUR help, future LUNA SEVEN fans, to gain funding that can go towards locations and traveling expenses. 

We are hoping to raise at $10,000, but of course, any contribution is highly appreciated. 

 

But what do you get?

Well, your generosity will not go unnoticed. ALL contributions come with special perks, dependant on the amount spent. Perks include Exclusive Luna Seven murchandise, signed posters, meet-and-greets and MUCH MORE!

 

I want to help, but I can't afford it!

No stress! We completely understand. Times are difficult. You can help just by sharing this link as well as following us on our official socials!

https://www.instagram.com/lunasevenseries/

https://www.facebook.com/lunasevenfilm/

 

Meet the Team!

 

 

The Lead Crew

DION MARC- Writer & Director

TAYLAH BONS- Producer / 1st Assistant Director 

VICTOR NG- Director of Photography

MIG ARTUGUE- Sound Designer

SHANNON MORRISON- Editor

DAPHNE GOULTER- Key Costume

JOSIE HANUSKA- Key Makeup

CHRISTIAN WATSON- Props Master

 

Stay tuned! And THANK YOU <3

story:
Hello,

My name is Joel McMillan and this is my story.

I grew up in a small town in Wyoming. Overall I had a great childhood. I had a dad who was always into buying and fixing up classics cars. We had Chevelles, Novas, Monte Carlos, Impalas, Obviously mostly a GM family but growing up with my dad, it was only natural that I also grew up a gearhead. I actually had a 1969 Chevelle as my first high school car and not a lot of kids get to say they had a cool car like that as their first car.

 My dad was always willing to teach me and show me anything I wanted to learn and even some things I didn't want to learn but it turned me into the man I am which makes me eternally grateful to him. He was always good at the mechanical end of things, doing work on engines, transmissions, suspensions, etc. and I always thought it would be cool for me to learn the auto body side of things so between the 2 of us, we could pretty much do anything when it came to classic car restorations.

So when I graduated high school, I moved 3 hours away from my hometown to Casper, WY and attended Casper College for 2 years and actually got my degree in collision repair and auto body technology. I worked at a couple different body shops over the course of about 5 years but the money wasn't quite there for me. I was never a stranger to living paycheck to paycheck. So I decided to give my brother a call and he hooked me up with a job in the oilfield. I worked as a wireline hand in the oilfield for about 4 years, and in that time frame, I just put my nose to the ground and worked as hard as I possibly could. I made sure to learn as much as I could while working as hard as I possibly could. After 4 years, I had worked myself up to an engineer/supervisor position and I did that for another 2 years until April 10, 2020.

  

That was the day that 6 years of my hard work and dedication were completely wiped away due to the economical impact of Covid-19. I was furloughed and I was really depressed and stressed out. Losing your job due to circumstances beyond your control is probably one of the hardest things someone can go through. I started working part time between 2 jobs as an excavator and an agricultural laborer. While these jobs helped pay the bills, I felt in my heart that neither one of these jobs were what I wanted to do with my life. Even when I worked in the oilfield, I always knew I was destined to do something great.

While being furloughed, my wife suggested that I begin restoring the Chevelle, my old high school car that I still own to this day. She believed that doing so would help me get my mind off things and put a little pep in my step.

I decided then that not only was I going to restore the Chevelle but I also wanted to document the entire restoration process via YouTube and TikTok. Not knowing what would become of the content, I started filming my first TikTok on September 6th, 2020. It was a quick 60-second video of the beginning stages on the restoration of the Chevelle and I edited and posted the video that very night. When I went to bed, the video had only about 40 views and 1 like. However, I woke up the next morning and the video had over 20,000 likes and had also given me 30,000 new followers! Over the course of the next couple days, the video went viral with over 6 million views, 780,000 likes and had also blessed me with 380,000 followers, all wanting to see me document the restoration of the Chevelle. 

Since then, I have established a YouTube Channel with almost 9,000 subscribers, and with every new video I post, I gain even more follow ship on both platforms.

So I am asking for $20,000 to help me grow the foundation that my viral accounts have established for me. I know that in my heart, becoming a full time content creator on the restoration process of classic vehicles is what I want to do but I can't do that without help. If I can raise $20,000, that will help me not only finish the restoration on my Chevelle, but it will also open the door to me me being able to finally achieve my dream of owning and operating my own classic car restoration shop. If I can get the shop, I can have the necessary workspace needed to not only provide top quality car restorations, but I can also provide top quality content for my followers on all my social media platforms.

So please, if you love satisfying content and/or enjoy watching someone take a junky old car and completely restoring it back to it's former glory, please contribute to my cause. You can also check out my projects on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube!

Thank you, and God bless!

I know that in my heart, becoming a full time content creator on the restoration process of classic vehicles is what I want to do but I can't do that without help. If I can raise $20,000, that will help me not only finish the restoration on my Chevelle, but it will also open the door to me me being able to finally achieve my dream of owning and operating my own classic car restoration shop. If I can get the shop, I can have the necessary workspace needed to not only provide top quality car restorations, but I can also provide top quality content for my followers on all my social media platforms.So please, if you love satisfying content and/or enjoy watching someone take a junky old car and completely restoring it back to it's former glory, please contribute to my cause. You can also check out my projects on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube!Thank you, and God bless!

story:
♚♛♜♝♞♟♚♛♜♝♞♟♚♛♜♝♞

Welcome to our campaign for a brand new TV series being shot in the UK at Royal Holloway, University of London

♚♛♜♝♞♟♚♛♜♝♞♟♚♛♜♝♞

⚧ E N G E N D E R E D: 

/ɪnˈdʒɛndə,ɛnˈdʒɛndə/

cause or give rise to (a feeling, situation, or condition).

"the issue engendered continuing controversy"...

___________________________________

 

⚧GENDER:

/ˈdʒɛndə/

either of the two sexes (male and female), especially when considered with reference to social and cultural differences rather than biological ones. The term is also used more broadly to denote a range of identities that do not correspond to established ideas of male and female.

"a condition that affects people of both genders"...

Engendered is a series written by 3rd year RHUL screenwriters and will be crewed by 3rd year Episodic Narrative Students in the Media Arts department.

___________________________________

The story is about an alternate reality where men and women fight each other on a life-size chessboard to determine power over the world they live in, which will be filmed in and around our very own Hogwarts-like building, Founders...

You can be a part of this unique experience by auditioning for a role in the show, crewing on the project, or just becoming a backer and coming to watch the finished product!

Check out our promo video here:

___________________________________

Check out our brand new Buzzfeed quiz to find out which ENGENDERED character you are!

https://www.buzzfeed.com/sophdobb/which-engende...

___________________________________

Some of our rewards and pre-visuals:

___________________________________

You can own one of the mood ring pins for our £25 reward! (Artwork by Tiegan Carter)

Pre-vis for Queen's Robes (Artwork by Tiegan Carter)

___________________________________

Cinematography Pre-Vis:

___________________________________

 

Our Colour Scheme (By Cinematographer Abi Lum Kin)

Click here for: Engendered Pinterest mood board

 

___________________________________

 

MAKEUP IDEAS: (By Holly Hansen)

___________________________________

What will you be donating for?

Film production:

  • cameras and tripods

  • Sound and lighting equipment

  • Set designs

  • Props and costumes

  • Make-up

  • Booking locations

  • Actors

  • Catering

  • Travel

  • Transport, etc.

In exchange we give you the rewards listed to the right!

 

___________________________________

We cannot do this without YOU! We’re thankful for any amount that you can give. Even a few pounds will go a long way. And if you can’t donate but want to help us, please share this project on your social medias and with your friends and colleagues.

Thank You!

From the Entire ENGENDERED Team:

story:
Short Summary: 

Rachel and Jaz connected in 2013 via a giant Twitter rant about horror films and gay people. They have been besties ever since. Rachel is a big ol' lesbian who has been drinking and acting regularly since the tender age of 21. Jaz started her directing career with a Panasonic Hi-8 camcorder that her moms bought her at a garage sale in the boonies.  With their powers combined, Drink Responsibly was born.

Jaz and Rachel shot the first several episodes on a shoestring budget in the Valley.  Working tirelessly over the past year-and-a-half, they have found their voice.  This show encompasses a world of drunken debauchery and shenanigans through interviews, games and audience interaction. Every episode, host Rachel teaches a celebrity guest how to concoct a different craft cocktail. They sit down, enjoy the fruits of their labor and with lowered inhibitions, interview one another. All participants are over 21.

What They Need:

Although impressed with what they were able to accomplish with nearly nothing, Rachel and Jaz know the show could be EVEN better. Past episodes were shot in Jaz's un-airconditioned apartment with paper thin walls and second-hand equipment. With more funds, they would be able to rent a studio or find a more comfortably convenient shooting location. And quite possibly, even get equipment that doesn't require frozen peas to stay cool/function!

 As many of you know, alcohol is expensive (especially in LA) so previous cocktails were simple. Rachel is a trained mixologist with over ten years of experience and she needs the proper tools to do her thing. There are so many elements to building a good cocktail: glassware, liqueurs, garnishes, cordials, aperitifs, digestifs, shakers, muddlers, mixers...ice. With a contribution, you can help make that happen!

Other expenses they need funding for:

  • Crew (maybe people other than just them,)
  • Food (to soak up all the alcohol,) 
  • Traveling (gotta make sure everyone gets home safe,) 
  • Set design (perhaps props NOT from Dollar Tree,)  
  • Post-production (Jaz never sleeps,)  
  • Wardrobe (Rachel currently only owns black,) 
  • Advertising (did you know it costs money to promote on Instagram now?)  

...and anything else thrown their way (safety net!) 

What You Get: 

Besides the satisfaction of helping what is quite possibly the best show ever made, donors will have the opportunity to receive things such as: 

  • Fun swag
  • Celebrity guest signed props from the show 
  • FaceTime hangouts 
  • Set visits

and more...

Other Ways You Can Help:

"We understand that not everyone is rolling in dough, but there are other ways you can help. Shout us out on Twitter (@DRINKRRP,) tell your friends about the campaign, show people our previous episodes, reach out...we need you!

Love,

Jaz & Rachel

story:
STORY

We make eye contact across a crowded room...

...Frankie walks into a crowded party with her best friend Kate, who encourages her to put herself out there, but Frankie's cruel inner monologue undercuts her at every turn. She tries to talk to guys (wearing that outfit?) and even runs into her unrequited crush (he didn't choose her), all with embarrassing results. Transitioning into her "new life" may be harder than she thought. 

New body, same problems.  

Body image is a problem everyone struggles with, especially when it comes to dating. Our waists could be smaller, our stomachs flatter, our butts bigger. The list goes on. Frankie Falls In Love serves as an exploration of the idea that changing our bodies won't change our lives-- we'll be the same people regardless of our appearance. It's important for us to accept ourselves as we are.

Now, who am I?

I'm Octavia Bray and I am the writer/director of Frankie Falls In Love. I am a third-year graduate student at Loyola Marymount University, the showrunner's assistant on BoJack Horseman, and a member of the 2017-2018 NBC Writer's on the Verge Program. I am also fat and single (tell your friends)!

I am asking that you contribute funds to this project to help bring Frankie's story to life in a way that will provide a platform to continue the conversation on body image and self-esteem. Together with my exceedingly talented  producer, cinematographer, production designers, grips, sound mixers, and so many more we hope to create a series that is not only fun but thought provoking, relatable, and inspiring.

 

FUNDING

You're Frankie, right? Can I buy you a drink?

Maybe a few for my crew...

The funds we are raising will go to various elements of our production. One of the most costly elements is craft services to feed our cast and crew. In addition, the episode requires a heavy amount of production design. The first episode takes place at a circus-themed frat party for which we will need to acquire a fog machine, kino tubes, and more. To serve the entire production, equipment and truck rental, and post-production tasks such as ADR and coloring are also pricey elements of our budget. 

If you contribute to this campaign, get ready for some awesome perks, including behind-the-scenes looks at production and swag adorned with the Frankie Falls in Love logo!

Everyone involved in this project is a starving student of either the graduate or undergraduate variety, so we'll see this project through on the strength of our desire to create. Every little bit helps, even if we don't reach our entire goal.

Even if you can't contribute, you can still get involved. Share this campaign on Facebook, gush about it to your latest Tinder date, bring it up when you're trying to look soulful and introspective in front of your crush. Every bit helps when it comes to helping people fall head over heels for Frankie Falls In Love. 

Thank you for your time and your support!

Sincerely, 

Octavia Bray and the Frankie Falls In Love Team!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY 

Welcome to the competitive world of Jewish dating in Los Angeles. We want to give you an inside look to the earliest occupation (and art) in history; Matchmaking. Kismet is a comedy about premiere (or so she claims) matchmaker, Becky Berkowitz, who is determined to take on, and fix up, a new city filled with powerful and influential jews. 

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT TO US

This project is a little piece of our childhood. It is a little piece of us, and it is a story we want to tell. Working on Kismet together has been an extremely special experience, and we want to continue on this journey and to share it with all of you! 

The message of Kismet is one that we believe in for everyone, but mostly is for women. Becky  looks to everyone and everything outside of herself for reassurance. She is a woman who has spent her life wanting to be liked more than she wanted to be herself until she finds something greater to stand for. Kismet means destiny, and to us, this is a story of what can happen when you stop trying to control everyone and everything, including fate. 

We also just want to make people laugh!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET 

Making funny stuff isn't as cheap as when we used to put on Purim musicals for our Catholic grandmother! We are asking for a total of $12,000. Your donations to the campaign will cover the following: 

- Pre- & Post- Production: 19%

-Production Insurance & Equipment Rentals-9%

-Locations & Permits- 7%

-Crowdfunding Fees and Perks- 8%

- Cast & Crew Compensation- 57%

Perks for contributing range from a hearty thank you to an executive producer credit. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't donate please please please SPREAD THE WORD! Repost the link to the campaign. Share it with a friend or a family member with a little more change in their pocket.

story:
Short Summary

This campaign is important to us because we are trying to successfully complete our television pilot for our summer TV Pilot course. We need your help to provide the necessary tools for our production. We have a total of 13 crew members and 15-30 cast members, we need your help purchasing props, set decorations, craft services and Covid-19 compliance items. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need:

$580 for craft services (to feed the cast and crew on set) and necessary PPE attire to comply with COVID-19 guidelines. 

Festival  and Competition fees

If you donate at least $10 you will receive a digital copy of the television pilot when it is completed!

If we do not reach our goal we will still put the money towards completing this production no matter what. 

The Impact

The Impact

Your contribution will make a HUGE impact on whether or not we can make our television pilot successfully because without you guys it would not be possible!

Our short film is a corky and comedic show about three alien teenagers who have been sent to earth by their mother,  the queen to learn a lesson. This pilot episode is intended to spread light fun and meaningful messages to our audience.

Between all thirteen of us, we have created and completed many projects/productions during our time at Georgia Southern University all to prepare us for this moment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please copy and share this link on all social media platforms to get the word out!

We appreciate your time, thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

Veteran NYC performers, Alix Elias, Richard Marshall, and Woody Regan's cabaret  "BAD FOR YOU!" featured songs about things we know perfectly well are bad for us (smoking, drinking, high cholesterol foods, illicit sex, etc.), --things that either kill us, or make life worth living. 

Despite getting off to a wobbly start, the show SUCCEEDED, helped along by funding from our original Indiegogo campaign (THANK YOU, donors!).

Using footage shot while the shows were performed, we want to move forward by creating a reality web-series about the struggles of getting the silly show on its feet. 

But we need help! 

Dear friends, followers, and well-wishers, please be part of our show by giving us donations for rehearsal studios, transportation, posters, copies, etc. etc.  Woody and Alix wrote a theme song, -- we'd like to record it in a studio (and hire musicians).  We need funds for marketing photos, videos, costumes, make-up and props.  We need to rent cameras, equipment, lights.  Pay a crew.   We have post production expenses.

We're just small fry, but we have the same expenses as any film (or video) production.  But we're thrifty and imaginative!  We beg, borrow, steal.  We're resourceful.

Please help us realize our goal, so we can bring "BAD FOR YOU!", the reality web-series, to your tiny screen, and share with you our creative adventures in the demi-monde world of NYC Cabaret.

Our goal is $5000, but any contribution, no matter how small, helps.  We'll find a way to use whatever we get to PUT ON A SHOW!

We have perks (we're still deciding on these), but offer signed posters, and a vintage Fun City postcard, autographed by Alix,  shot in the 1960's by famous photographer Lawrence Fink (of MOMA fame) showing Alix confronting a flasher in the subway.  In our last campaign,"BAD FOR YOU!" tote bags were a huge success, but we ran out of them.  But we'll come up with something equally good.  Stay tuned!

Finally, if you can't contribute money, please send this campaign along to your friends and family, or if you have a list of names on social media, that's EVEN BETTER.  We're grateful for any support--it's very much appreciated!  If we succeed, it's because of you, and your friends, and others like you.  Please pass this along so we can keep producing this show and building our audience.

THANK YOU from the Food of Love trio, Alix Elias, Woody Regan, and Richard Marshall.

story:
Help us Shoot Poppy in August

Who We Are: "Driven" Created and Directed by Stephen Elliott

Stephen Elliott is the creator/director of the scripted web series “Driven.” He is the founder of the popular literary magazine The Rumpus and the author of 8 books including The Adderall Diaries and Happy Baby. His first movie “About Cherry” premiered at the Berlinale and was released by IFC in 2012. In 2013, he filmed an adaptation of his novel “Happy Baby.” His newest movie “After Adderall” was the closing night feature at Slamdance Film Festival in 2017.  His latest mini web series, "Driven" is about a writer, Paul who has writer’s block and drives a Panda car. Stories center around the diverse riders who come and go from his car. “Driven” episodes are flashes of 10-15 minute episodes that contain the clashing agendas of his customers and the culture in which we live—the detours, the hassles, stoned cops and custody battles over cats as well as prickly intimacies between strangers and lovers.  

Episode "Poppy" Written by Antonia Crane

Antonia Crane is the author of the memoir, “Spent” (Barnacle Books, Rare Bird Lit). She is a performer and writing instructor in Los Angeles. She has written for The New York Times, The Believer, The Toast, Playboy, Cosmopolitan, Salon.com, The Rumpus, Electric Literature, DAME, The Los Angeles Review, Quartz: The Atlantic Media, Medium.com, Buzzfeed, Medium.com, The Establishment and lots of other places. Her screenplay “The Lusty” (co-written by Transparent director, writer Silas Howard), based on the true story of the exotic dancer’s labor union, is a recipient of the San Francisco Film Society/Kenneth Rainin Foundation Grant in screenwriting. She has appeared on CNN’s This is Life With Lisa Ling and has been interviewed on WTF with Marc Maron and Michael Smerconish on https://www.siriusxm.com/potus where he compared dancers to Uber drivers. She may be the oldest living stripper.

Summery Narrative of Episode “Poppy”

A beautifully world-weary Veteran dancer played by Breeda Wool leaves her day shift at the lap dancing club and hops in a Panda car to go home, but her shift is far from over. Instead of going home, she meets her decade-long regular client, Colin at his McMansion for their routine oral sex session but Colin tries to push the limits of their relationship. Colin has competing addictions and other sex worker “friends” who meet Poppy with conspiratorial sass. The "Poppy" episode explores the connection between desire and commerce: Where do the lines blur between long term clients and friendship and is contentment possible within conflicting desires? 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 for a two-day shoot to pay everyone involved (we are asking for $7K because there is always so much more than we plan)

  • A & B Cameras, Editor, Set Sound, Color Correction, Sound Mixer
  • Director of photography
  • Actors, Strippers, Dancers, Featured Extras
  • Styling, makeup and props
  • Craft services
  • Your car that we need to borrow to be the Panda Car
  • Our club scene will be beautiful, queer and trans filled 

The Impact

Do you want stories about sex workers written by sex workers to exist in the world? Here is your chance to make that happen. I have written a zesty episode about a Veteran stripper who gets to have joy in her life. In the past 3 years, I have successfully raised money (with a group of other friends) to assist my friend Piper battle breast cancer and then again to fund a writing fellowship-filled Summer that you all supported, big time. We want to make a TV series that is smart, sexy and timely. Help us make "Poppy" shine for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we still love you. Please share this campaign with your friends and help us fund this bad girl.
story_txt:
Help us Shoot Poppy in August
Who We Are: "Driven" Created and Directed by Stephen Elliott
Stephen Elliott is the creator/director of the scripted web series “Driven.” He is the founder of the popular literary magazine The Rumpus and the author of 8 books including The Adderall Diaries and Happy Baby. His first movie “About Cherry” premiered at the Berlinale and was released by IFC in 2012. In 2013, he filmed an adaptation of his novel “Happy Baby.” His newest movie “After Adderall” was the closing night feature at Slamdance Film Festival in 2017.  His latest mini web series, "Driven" is about a writer, Paul who has writer’s block and drives a Panda car. Stories center around the diverse riders who come and go from his car. “Driven” episodes are flashes of 10-15 minute episodes that contain the clashing agendas of his customers and the culture in which we live—the detours, the hassles, stoned cops and custody battles over cats as well as prickly intimacies between strangers and lovers.  
Episode "Poppy" Written by Antonia Crane
Antonia Crane is the author of the memoir, “Spent” (Barnacle Books, Rare Bird Lit). She is a performer and writing instructor in Los Angeles. story:
Assassin's League

Hi, I am Cory Gerard, creator of this amazing project. My producers, Shawna McGill and Stephane Legault and I have been around this crazy world of entertainment for many years. All working on major projects. I, myself have worked on a few sets as both an actor and the ever fun background actor. I have created, written, directed and produced many other indie films and web series. Shawna, as an actor has appeared in many films and T.V. shows, including a principle role on the T.V. show Wynonna Earp and Netflix hit Black Summer as both actor and stunt person. Stephane Legault, while also appearing in many T.V. shows and films, like The Revenant with Leonardo DiCaprio, is a very accomplished director, producer and contractor. Many projects both in Canada and the U.S. when coming to Calgary, look to Stephane to build their sets. 

Our project. Assassin's League is such an amazing idea and script.

- A former C.I.A. black ops agent gets brought out of retirement to hunt down a rogue assassin who has started a league that will change the face of the free world. One way or another. 

Five years after retiring from the C.I.A. to take care of his newly found out daughter, Derek Lawrence receives a visit from his mentor and main handler, now Deputy Direct of the C.I.A. Jack Riley. Jack reveals to Derek that one of his targets eight years ago, a worlds top assassin and assassin recruiter, is still alive and has created a league of international assassins. This league consists of twenty of the worlds best. The assassins are paired off into groups and each group assigned a target. The first assassin to hit their target moves onto the next round. All targets are leaders of countries with freedom. The "World Series Trophy" being the president of the United States. In complete disbelief, Derek declines, but after much thought he starts to realize that this newly formed "League" is just a cover and that maybe something much deeper is going on. Reluctantly he decides to take this into his own hands. But first, he must start to round up all his former assets like Elsa Cooper. A hard nosed no nonsense former Navy S.E.A.L. One of the first women to ever serve as a S.E.A.L. Asan Rohit, former Mossad agent who refuses to kill innocent people but quick on the trigger to those he deems guilty.  Pete Conner,  a current C.I.A. agent who Derek himself recruited many years ago and saved from a terror camp after Pete had been captured. Calm, cool and collected, Pete always gets the job done and is extremely loyal to Derek. As well as many other agents from other intelligence agencies from around the world.  

With Soriya McInnis, C.I.A station chief, and her team of analysts at the helm trying to figure out what this is all about, Derek and his team travel the world to hunt down this rogue assassin known as Alexander Lindgren. Time is not on their side. 

With your help, we can take this project to the next level. With proper funding we will able to hire Alberta based crew and pay our wonderful actors. We have filmed a proof of concept with a ZERO budget. ZERO crew. Yes ZERO. Our crew consisted of our wonderful cast doing everything behind the scenes and all on a volunteer basis. We believe this project has the potential to be taken to that next level. And funding will allow us to put together an incredible pilot in order to make that next level. Most importantly, it will employ many actors and crew.  Keep Alberta Rolling.  Keep everyone rolling.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $150,000 to be able to bring you an amazing product. These funds will go into production and being able to hire an amazing crew. Funds will go towards new equipment and top of the line equipment rental. Funds will go towards booking amazing location spots around Alberta. Funds will go towards paying our amazing actors who have been putting in countless volunteer hours over the course of the last three years. And lastly funds will go towards promotions and festivals to be sure we can get the right eyes on this amazing project

We have put together some pretty cool perks. We don't want anyone walking away with nothing. Check them out as they range from personal shout outs (that will be online forever so even when our show becomes huge, you will always have that shout out) to being an announced Producer at our pilot wrap cast party. That's right, a PRODUCER! There are just too many cool perks to list. Have a look for yourself. Any little bit helps.   

We have been working on this project for almost four years. And we will continue to do so even if we do not reach our goal. We will still do our best to create this amazing project and use funds to promote and continue to try hit our goal.

This project digs deep into the underbelly of the worlds governments. It is an incredible combination of action and political drama. 

While this is our first major project,  we have the ambition and know how to make this reality. We have shot some scenes as a proof of concept that are readily available on our YouTube page, Assassin's League. Also, the interviews with our actors should help shed a little more light on the producers as well as the project its self.

Risks & Challenges

With everything we have said, we want to make sure everyone is aware that there is always the possibility that nothing may come from this right away. But please be comforted in knowing that we will not stop pushing and promoting this project. Three months, 3 years, twenty years, we will keep going until we get this in front of the right people.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone viewing this page has the ability to contribute financially. That does not mean you cannot help us in other ways. Word of mouth is the best promotion tool we have as humans. If you still want to help, please share our pages and make all the noise you can about this incredible project. TOGETHER WE CAN DO THIS !!!

story:
THE IMPACT

Stories of immigrants are more vital than ever. In our current political climate we desperately need to bring these unique voices to light. In highlighting a show about illegal immigration with a light and humorous touch, we hope to create points of connection between different minded people. We want anyone, regardless of their personal beliefs to be able to laugh and see themselves in this story. At it's core this story is about fitting in. Who can't relate to that? 

WHO WE ARE

​Shayan Shojaee- (Actor/Executive Producer/Co-Writer) A native Iranian, Shayan was raised in South Carolina since the early age of ten. He is an award winning actor (2nd place-Best Supporting Actor in a high school production of Scapino).  Feeling the need to facade his true identity in his youth, he took shelter in many theatrical playhouses. He is a man of many masks. He has experienced an adventurous transition adjusting to a new culture and way of life. As a professional actor he has appeared in Madam Secretary,  Elementary, Unforgettable, Jessica Jones & Veep. His original sketches which he co-wrote and starred in, have also been featured on Funny or Die!

Robbie Tann (Director/Executive Producer/ Co-Writer/Actor)  is a professional actor, writer & director. As an actor, he has made over fifteen onscreen appearances ranging from network & premium television programs to feature length films. Highlights include Preacher, Orange is the New Black, The Family Fang, Limitless and Shades of Blue. Robbie has directed two short films: This New York Story & The Poet. The latter of which Robbie also participated as co-writer. The short films were featured in several film festivals in New York City. The most notable being the Big Apple Film Festival, New York No Limits Film Series & the DAMN! Film Series. As a director/writer, he has developed, written, shot & edited countless sketches, several of which have been featured on Funny or Die! He is currently in pre-production on his first full length feature entitled Swell. 

What We Need

Producing television at any level is expensive. And even the best of ideas are only as good as their execution. We're looking to raise $3,000.00 to produce our entire first season of Social Security. Each episode is 5-6 minutes in length. 

In order to bring this story to fruition we need: 

  • Locations
  • Props
  • Lenses
  • Crew
  • Actors
  • Travel
  • Post Production
  • Money for festival submission

OTHER WAYS TO HELP!

We understand that money is tight. So if you are unable to open your pocketbook please go to the nearest branch of your Bank and ask for a  loan. Taking a lien on your house is always a great way to get capital to invest. Second mortgages are more common and easy to take out than ever.

Just kidding. You can SHARE SHARE SHARE!

Like us. Love us. Share our campaign video. Share our story. You never know who might be interested in producing this kind of work. Any support helps us move closer towards our goal!

story:
Short Summary

As I said, I am an independent writer and producer of mini series, and as I go on working on other people's productions, I wanted to work on a story I want to tell.  As my debut project, I want to make sure I do everything possible to make this as successful as possible 

What We Need & What You Get

So, not going to lie, we need about 5,000 dollars for filming, it will break down as follows:  

$1000: Proper Director of Photography, so what I have written comes out looking sleek, and the visuals can match the comedic tone of the series as much as possible.  This will also be a part of the VFX/editing budget  

$750: This will go to the stars of the show: the actors! I want to be able to pay them   

$250-300: Audio engineer/ sound guy:  Anyone would tell you good sound can make or break a production.  Also want to pay a guy to compose a score and theme song for the show!     

Most of the other budget will go towards the day to day catering, transportation, and other unforeseen production circumstances such as: 

-Production tools may malfunction   

-Locations may fall through, prolonging shooting in which case, we may need to further compensate the important people involved. 

-Weather can delay or hinder production days, which refers back to the problem above! 

 

The Impact

With the funds I raise here, I will be able to put my best foot forward in this production, and properly compensate the wonderful cast and crew that has given their time and effort to make this project come to life! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes, people can't contribute money, and that is ok 

-Make sure you share this with your friends and get the word out about Kenny From the Jump! 

-Volunteer as a PA or as an on-set extra would be extremely appreciated as well!

story:
Short Summary

You agree that this is an awesome idea, and you're super excited to get to watch the finished series, because you have great taste. However, now you must be wondering, who is she and why should I trust her to actually follow through with something so insane?

I graduated from SUNY Purchase with a BFA in filmmaking in 2015. Since then I have traveled to 20 countries in between working in art direction and post production for a major web media company, all while producing and directing my own short documentary pieces while I travel. This project means the world to me (well, at least 10,000 miles of it) and nothing will stop me from making it to the finish line, with hundreds of hours of amazing women's stories on video in tow.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to raise at least $20,000. This will cover:
    • Transportation to London
    • Food, accommodation and camping equipment
    • Gas, car repairs, bribes, etc.
    • Visas
    • Additional equipment (little portable lights for interviews, better sound equipment, go pros for strapping to the hood of the car, etc.)
    • Transportation home (because we do unfortunately have to come back, eventually)
  • We want to get you involved in the adventure as much as possible, and we've created our perks with this in mind. Whether it's surprise souvenirs from the road, access to additional behind the scenes content, or the ability to choose some of what gets painted on our car, there are lots of great ways to be a part of the team.
  • If we don't make quite enough to be able to take the trip and get the series done, we will be very very sad. However, all of your money will go directly to Girls Not Brides, so it's really a win win either way.

The Impact

  • This past year has been a rough one for everyone. It can be so hard to wake up in the morning and feel good about the world we live in. We're bombarded with horror stories, fake news, endless hate, you name it. We want this series to serve as a little bit of light in the darkness, without trying to pretend the darkness doesn't exist. We won't sugar coat the stories we find or our experiences in the countries we visit. We will, however, be on a mission to find the goodness, find the hope, find the opportunity on the other side of all this darkness. 
  • I spent the majority of 2017 traveling through Eastern Europe producing and shooting documentaries on my own on a variety of subjects. I worked on pieces about a forest fire and the effects on the environment and the community in Greece, the homelessness epidemic left behind by the rapid post-Communist shift to a global economy in Romania, a group of children who have to walk three hours (each way) up and down a mountain every day just to get to school in Albania, and many more. Finding, documenting, and sharing stories is my favorite way to create stories, making this the perfect adventure for me.
  • Some of these docs will (finally!) be released during the campaign, so be sure to keep an eye open for them!

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, this journey is not without peril. The unpredictability is a large part of why this is such an excellent adventure, but of course that also means there's a fair amount of room for danger. We are almost guaranteed to break down in inconvenient places and get lost again and again and again. We could get robbed, we could get into a car accident, we could get bitten by a giant poisonous spider in the desert when we set up camp for the evening. I am not worried about any of these things, and you shouldn't be either.

  • In my experience, people are mostly good. The amount of times I've been in a foreign country totally lost, with everything I own strapped to my back and no handle of the local language (or real idea of where I was) and been helped out by a kind stranger have forced me to accept that more often than not, people are kind. My past travel experiences have equipped me to be able to handle any situation that comes my way.
  • In a lot of the countries we will be driving through, the US dollar can go a long way. Money can't buy happiness but in a lot of instances, it can buy safety.
  • We will be traveling with multiple backup cameras, sound recorders, hard drives and edit machines, so we always have a back up in the event that something essential is broken or stolen. We also will not be keeping all the equipment in the same place, ever. (For example, if we are carrying a camera or two around, we will leave back ups in the car.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Tell everyone you know about this project and SHARE this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Hit that little 'share to facebook, twitter, etc.' button, send it to anyone and everyone you can, the farther the word spreads, the better. 

We will be releasing videos throughout the duration of the campaign, to give you something to look forward to while also giving you a taste of the content you can expect from us on the road. Keep your eyes open for these releases, share them with your friends, and if you know any badass women in the tristate area who should be featured, let us know!
story_txt:
Short Summary
You agree that this is an awesome idea, and you're super excited to get to watch the finished series, because you have great taste. However, now you must be wondering, who is she and why should I trust her to actually follow through with something so insane?
I graduated from SUNY Purchase with a BFA in filmmaking in 2015. Since then I have traveled to 20 countries in between working in art direction and post production for a major web media company, all while producing and directing my own short documentary pieces while I travel. This project means the world to me (well, at least 10,000 miles of it) and nothing will stop me from making it to the finish line, with hundreds of hours of amazing women's stories on video in tow.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise at least $20,000. This will cover:
Transportation to London
Food, accommodation and camping equipment
Gas, car repairs, bribes, etc.
Visas
Additional equipment (little portable lights for interviews, better sound equipment, go pros for strapping to the hood of the car, etc.)
Transportation home (because we do unfortunately have to come back, eventually)


We want to get you involved in the adventure as much as possible, and we've created our perks with this in mind. Whether it's surprise souvenirs from the road, access to additional behind the scenes content, or the ability to choose some of what gets painted on our car, there are lots of great ways to be a part of the team.
If we don't make quite enough to be able to take the trip and get the series done, we will be very very sad. However, all of your money will go directly to Girls Not Brides, so it's really a win win either way.


The Impact

This past year has been a rough one for everyone. It can be so hard to wake up in the morning and feel good about the world we live in. We're bombarded with horror stories, fake news, endless hate, you name it. We want this series to serve as a little bit of light in the darkness, without trying to pretend the darkness doesn't exist. We won't sugar coat the stories we find or our experiences in the countries we visit. We will, however, be on a mission to find the goodness, find the hope, find the opportunity on the other side of all this darkness. 
I spent the majority of 2017 traveling through Eastern Europe producing and shooting documentaries on my own on a variety of subjects. I worked on pieces about a forest fire and the effects on the environment and the community in Greece, the homelessness epidemic left behind by the rapid post-Communist shift to a global economy in Romania, a group of children who have to walk three hours (each way) up and down a mountain every day just to get to school in Albania, and many more. Finding, documenting, and sharing stories is my favorite way to create stories, making this the perfect adventure for me.
Some of these docs will (finally!) be released during the campaign, so be sure to keep an eye open for them!


Risks & Challenges
Obviously, this journey is not without peril. The unpredictability is a large part of why this is such an excellent adventure, but of course that also means there's a fair amount of room for danger. We are almost guaranteed to break down in inconvenient places and get lost again and again and again. We could get robbed, we could get into a car accident, we could get bitten by a giant poisonous spider in the desert when we set up camp for the evening. I am not worried about any of these things, and you shouldn't be either.

In my experience, people are mostly good. The amount of times I've been in a foreign country totally lost, with everything I own strapped to my back and no handle of the local language (or real idea of where I was) and been helped out by a kind stranger have forced me to accept that more often than not, people are kind. My past travel experiences have equipped me to be able to handle any situation that comes my way.
In a lot of the countries we will be driving through, the US dollar can go a long way. Money can't buy happiness but in a lot of instances, it can buy safety.
We will be traveling with multiple backup cameras, sound recorders, hard drives and edit machines, so we always have a back up in the event that something essential is broken or stolen. We also will not be keeping all the equipment in the same place, ever. (For example, if we are carrying a camera or two around, we will leave back ups in the car.)


Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share! Tell everyone you know about this project and SHARE this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Hit that little 'share to facebook, twitter, etc.' button, send it to anyone and everyone you can, the farther the word spreads, the better. 
We will be releasing videos throughout the duration of the campaign, to give you something to look forward to while also giving you a taste of the content you can expect from us on the road. Keep your eyes open for these releases, share them with your friends, and if you know any badass women in the tristate area who should be featured, let us know!

story:
What is the project ?

Hello ! 

I'm Magpie, full time self-employed artist, I've previously worked on shows such as Hazbin Hotel and Holidaze, and done a lot of freelance art work.

 

 

I've always taken time to also develop my own projects, and this time I decided to take it a step further and develop a 4 mins short film with an amazing team of people, most of which whom I've met through my time in the Hazbin Hotel team and online career.

Villains & Co will be a 2D animated film, with fully hand painted backgrounds (yes, with good old paints and brushes !), about several super villains entering a contest to prove who can be the most evil. 
The short film will be targetting more of an adult audience, as there will be some cartoon violence/gore.

With your help, I would be able to push this project even further in quality and put more of my free time into focusing on painting all those backgrounds and directing the team. Art, and especially animation, takes a lot of time and dedication, and with some extra funds, we could really push the quality of the film and make it a better experience for everyone, both viewers and artists part of the team !
 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal would be to raise £3000. Any extra funds we might get if we exceed our goal would go right to our hard working artists in the team, and would help the project even further !

Now, what if we DON'T meet our goal ; have no fear, because the project is still going to get made. The final deadline for our project is early March 28th. If we don't meet our goal, I will make sure to work extra hard in my freelance job to bring in the extra funds, however it would mean that I sadly wouldn't have as much time to put into Villains & Co.

Now about those perks ! 

The one I'm the most excited about is to offer you guys the opportunity to purchase some of the ORIGINAL hand painted backgrounds from the film ! 


(there will be limited stock however, and first one there first served, so if you want some of the coolest ones, you might want to grab it quickly !)

I will also be printing A4 sized prints, and postcards with artworks from the film. I will be showing you some behind the scene work in progress, send hand written notes and more !

 

Here are the backgrounds currently available ! We'll keep adding more as we continue production :)


 

The Impact

Why is our project important ?

I have true passion for art and 2D animation. I want to continue making online films and show everyone that yes, a team of passionate hard working animators can make it ! 



Working on the amazing Hazbin Hotel pilote and seeing its success has immensely inspired me, and made me feel like I should start my own project too, and I hope that maybe my project could inspire more people to do the same too 

 

Risks & Challenges

Every animated film faces some bumps in the road at one point or the other, however, I have some experience in animation and films myself, and have been part of art teams before, so I'm quite confident that I can make sure Villains & Co will be completed in time and of great quality.
If the animation takes longer than expected, I will make sure to work even harder, and invest some of my personal money to bring in extra artists in the team and make sure that the deadline is met !
 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by following our official Twitter at @Villains_Co and share the work in progress and updates we consistently post on there, and share the film once it's released !

Sharing may only be a click of a button, but for us it truly means the world and helps more than you think !

Special Thanks to Hellbent for the voice over in our promo video !


No matter if you can afford to help finance this project or not, having your general support is already immensely appreciated, and for this, THANK YOU !!!

story:
Why

2020 was a year with a lot of surprises. A lot of these surprises caused a lot of pain. You worried about being safe, and keeping the people around you safe. A lot of you bought guns. You wondered about what would happen if the people and large groups who take care of you decided not to take care of you.

We are here to show how you can learn to take care of yourself and the people around you through training to fight. Training to fight trains your mind to be safe. We're not experts, so we believe that if we can learn to do it in front of you, you can do it too. The more you know about fighting, the better able you will be to avoid fighting. Training to fight through play is the best way to train to fight. Play is a strong form of learning, and through playing out what could happen in very bad times, you will be less surprised if you are ever in bad times.

You may train to fight by yourself, like hitting a bag, but training by yourself will not help you learn how to avoid getting hit by someone else while trying to hit them. To do that, you need to train with others in an always-changing contest. We will learn how to do this in the open, so you may learn from us learning.

At the moment, there is no shared way of speaking about what we learn from training to fight. Armies and police have this, but only for their members.  We aim to develop a language and a way of training that anyone, anywhere can use to learn how to fight in small groups.

What 

Arm Your Mind (AYM) will be delivered as a web series, a database, and a community- all so you may join us in developing a method collaboratively that we will share with the rest of the world. While the sports of airsoft and paintball provide similar instruction, they do not distribute information with regard to testing principles which you may use in everyday life- we will. 

How

Things we will learn include:

  • Tactical operations (terrain appreciation, urban warfare, navigation, avoiding friendly fire, etc)
  • Medical emergency response
  • Operational security
  • Communication 
  • Evacuation
  • Group dynamics

To test our training exercises and record our process, we're going to need simulated weapons, radios, medical equipment, and an action cam. We're going to do this whether we get funding or not, but without you, we're probably going to take years to find the time and resources required to get this program going. And without you, we're not going to learn as much as we will learn with you (through feedback from and collaboration with you, our community). 

Who

Foretrek is a non-profit dedicated to improving trust. Ray Doraisamy is an avid learner with a strong generalist streak and an eye for decentralization. He was once a Healthcare Specialist in the United States Army. This project is his response to Rudyard Kipling's Army of a Dream.

Objectives

  • $6740

Most of the money at our initial target will go toward a lasertag system. We've selected lasertag due to the ease at which we can use such systems without damaging our training environment (as in airsoft, paintball, or simunition) and incurring additional costs. While some systems with a range of 100m are available for US$350++ per rifle (such as those manufactured by Battle Company), systems that aim to replicate weapons tend to cost $1550-1700 per rifle (such as those manufactured by iCombat). Most vendors offer quotes directly to businesses, and the systems we'll be able to purchase (and the prices we will get) depend on our budget.  Other purchases include dual-band two-way radios ($24 per radio), medical equipment (such as tourniquets, combat gauze, and medical tape), a GoPro Hero8 Black (& assorted accessories), simulation equipment (for IEDs, wounds, and other complications), and access to varied environments. If we fail to meet this target, we will prioritize a minimum viable lasertag system and camera (such as a Polaroid cube). 

  • $15,000

At this target, we'll be able to guarantee the use of lasertag systems that are designed to simulate weapons. In addition, we will be able to afford expert feedback at a distance.

  • $25,000

We'll be able to purchase expert feedback in-person and a full field training exercise, including actors to play a hostile-but-nonviolent group to get everyone used to de-escalation. In addition, we'll include feedback from an intelligence expert on counter-surveillance and operational security techniques.

  • $35,000

We'll apply the same principles we explore to historical combat paradigms. Our primary focus will be on raiding party tactics common to small-scale societies. Employing shorter spears, knives, swords, axes, bows, clubs, and slings, we will compare ancient Greek sources, Roman sources, Norse 9th-11th century sources, as well as Maori, Aztec, Guinean, Amazonian, Bornean, and Zulu accounts. Using this exploration, we'll draw parallels between modern squad tactics and these raiding tactics.

  • $45,000

We'll travel to get feedback from experts in different paradigms. For instance, if we receive expert feedback from someone with mountainous or urban combat experience at the $25,000 level, we'll get expert feedback from someone with desert or amphibious experience at this level. 

  • $52,000++

This was always about involving you, so with funds past this point we'll travel to those among you who'd like to join us in establishing teams that will lead the way. We'll provide equipment, and guide you on nurturing your local community- which is our true aim.

Funder Awards

  • 25 funders - 'Clean Your Room Tactically' content unlocked
  • 50 funders - 'Fuel' content unlocked: the cast eats field rations as quickly as possible
  • 100 funders - stickers unlocked
  • 125 funders - 'Tactical Potty' content unlocked

Support Us Without Money

If you don't have money to spare, you're welcome to support us in several important ways. You'll receive a Perk for any of these methods!

  • Record a video sharing about something that scared you in 2020, and how you relate to that fear now
  • Create a humorous video promoting AYM
  • Get us a podcast or video interview
  • Write about a time your relationship between risk and fear changed
  • Write an article about AYM
  • Ask us a thoughtful question for our FAQ
  • Share your thoughts on our project on Reddit, Keybase, 4chan, etc

To collect your Perk without financial contribution, contact agency@foretrek.com with a link to where you uploaded your video, posted your article, etc.

story:
FACADE

Hi! My name is Rachelle Henry! I have been in the film industry for over a decade and I am passionate about cinema. From the time I was a little kid, I was always creating stories and bringing characters to life. Now as a filmmaker, I can tell my stories and share them with audiences around the world. I love action and excitement in films as well as intimacy and simplicity in emotional dramas. I love making movies/series that tap into my audiences emotions and have them laughing & crying. FACADE explores humanity by diving into the consequences of choices people make, our relationships to one another, and our own self-identity. 

When a criminal justice student is tasked to go undercover to prevent the deaths of vulnerable youth, she uncovers dark family secrets, conspiracies, and lies from those she loves most. 

FACADE is a gritty show the revolves around an atmospheric world of the criminal justice system, the scientific world of medicine, and the dark undergrounds of crime. It features clever dialogue, fast-paced action and unique characters whose true colors are about to be revealed. We all wear a façade, it's the secrets we hide that truly define us. 

This series is Extreme Measures meets Bloodline with a touch The Fall, a splash of Dark and a bite of Hannibal. The tone is similar to the works of Christopher Nolan, David Fincher, and Stanley Kubrick. 

Our financial goal for FACADE is $20,000. All of the funds go toward making and launching the FACADE Series. Production costs include paying the cast & crew, equipment rentals, locations, location permits, catering/craft services, transportation, post production, editing, composer etc. 

You're contribution to this campaign is greatly appreciated and anything you can give helps! Be sure and spread the word about FACADE and it's amazing team! Follow and invite friends to like FACADE on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter (all under username @facadeseries) and let everyone know how excited you are to see this series come to life! 

Love,

The FACADE Team

 

Game face. Ready for what is to come.

Ben Thorne and Alexa Ryan. How well do we ever know the person we're with?

Jorden and Kendra. Not everything is as smooth as it seems. 

Jorden Ryan is a family man. 

Mind over matter. Childhood best friends. Secrets.

Brenden Tate. Expert on the keys.

Family comes first.

story:
Hello Hello!

I'm Nengi Adoki and I'm THE MOST TOASTE----ok, you know that already!

I'm an actor, writer and producer who sometimes loves to sing, dance and fantasise about meeting the perfect man!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8000 for 13 webisodes. This will go towards equipment (lights, camera, sound), location, cast, crew (Director, DOP, sound, hair, make up etc), welfare, marketing, distribution and all other associated costs.

We're offering an opportunity to collaborate with Nigerian creatives to tell our own stories! Everyone gets a perk! You will gain access to all 13 episodes for free on Youtube.

The Impact
Your contribution will help us hire the right people for the job, through the right channels and with the right equipment. Most importantly, you will be supporting a production written and produced by a woman featuring a strong female lead.

Other Ways You Can Help
We're counting on you to share this campaign to help us reach the right people. We're also networking, creating more campaign videos and more content out of pocket for now to prove that what we are proposing is possible. We just need YOU!

Help us make some noise about this campaign on your social media! Ask your friends to share! Share links to any episodes of THE MOST TOASTED GIRL currently online! Become our very own indiegogo campaigner! Check out the Indiegogo share tools and see how you can help!

Together, we can find the man of her dreams! We're counting on you!

CHEERS! THE MOST TOASTED GIRL IS HERE!!!

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE ON PERKS:

Please note that there are two options for $30 and $50.

  • $30 - United States Only
  • $30 - Canada, Worldwide
  • $50 - US and Canada Only
  • $50 - Worldwide Only

We know it's a little confusing and a pain in the ass, but you're smart people and we love you bigly. Any questions?  Send us a note at adminATbingemediaDOTnet and we'll answer the damn thing.

Thanks!

ABOUT BINGE MEDIA 

BingeMedia.net is a podcast network created by Jim Law and Alyx Ancira (aka Moreno), former hosts of the JoBlo Movie Podcast.  More than that though, Binge Media is in a sense a community of like-minded movie fans who like to get together, talk a little trash and lay out their opinions.  Law and Moreno, with their staff of Binge co-hosts, deliver 2-5 podcasts a week detailing a range of topics including movies, music, television, video gaming, sports and comics.  Binge Media is the only place you can find the BingeCast, Binge GameCast, Monday Morning Moreno, Wake & Bake with Bob Ross, Small Screen Heroes, Binge Aftertaste, Binge SportsCast, Binge Movie and TV commentaries and more.  With their unique, barroom approach to all topics, the guys have accrued over 700 shows in the span of a little under five years.  You’d be hard pressed to find many podcasts out there who have dedicated themselves to the volume of content that Binge Media has, and the momentum continues to build as fans get involved in the content and find unique ways to contribute to the site. 

ABOUT THIS PROJECT 

As the site expands and the listenership and community grows, one thing we have always talked about is creating our own animated series ala the Ricky Gervais podcast.  The content itself is based on irreverent conversations between BingeCast hosts Law, Moreno and Ammon Gilbert about film and TV.  With your help, Indiegogo, we can make that dream a reality. With your contributions, we are planning on creating an entire first season of the Binge Media Animated Series "Better Call Binge", but to do that we have to cover software and labor costs. Projects such as this one are something that the community has been looking forward to, and something we think people will enjoy.  

ABOUT THE ANIMATORS

Our creative team on the project consists of Michelle Cortese and Peter Cetinich.  With Michelle’s background in creative arts and Peter’s knack for storyboarding and project management, the team is working towards creating unique character models, setting up tropes and building storylines using audio from the podcasts you already know and love. The goal for this project, outside of creating a first season for the fans, is to also gain some experience in creating video content for future Binge Media endeavors, including possible live podcasts and other unique video projects. With your backing, our animation team can get to work crafting and shaping the next step in the evolution of Binge Media.

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

We're in the process of breaking this thing down so it's transparent for all.  Stay tuned and we'll post an update for this very soon!

TIMELINE FOR PRODUCTION AND RELEASE

There's still a bit of a learning curve with the animation software, as it's the first time the animators have used it.  Saying all that, since we have a small team (seriously, they're super short), it may take up to a month/month and a half from storyboard to finished episode.  We wish it would take a shorter amount of time but we all have jobs and kids and pets and we're doing this in our spare time.  We will definitely be updating our progress throughout this whole process to maintain transparency.   In the immortal words of one of our wisest men:  Trust, bruv.

ONCE DONE, THEN WHAT?

Once the project is created, we plan on rolling it out via YouTube and social media. There will be no additional cost to view the episodes online, and they will be released on a week-by-week basis, rather than a typical Netflix-N-Binge type style. At some point, if there is interest in it, we may release some sort of package box set with all the episodes in high-definition release, but we will not be putting up any additional paywall for you to view the content.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The Binge Media team is used to putting themselves out there, and as such we’re anything but shy.  The biggest challenge we face on this journey is, simply put, acquiring the funds to make it possible.  While we do make some income off our Patreon subscriptions, that goes directly into site maintenance and upkeep.  This project, due to its very nature, requires a more specific investment to make happen.  That’s where YOU come in.  Our Indiegogo goal covers the cost of the entire first season, so once we hit our goal we will immediately get to work delivering on the series.  Any additional funds gained from the project will go towards increased production value and, we hope, the start of a second season, or maybe even some bonus episodes.  It depends on where this project ends up, but again, that depends squarely upon YOU, the contributors.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand that you may not have anything to monetary to spare.  Which is fine.  You're breaking our hearts BUT IT'S FINE.  Here's a few other ways you can help make this project a reality.  

  • Share this page on any social media outlet you have.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for an easier sharing experience.
  • Target people who's interest this may align to and share with them personally.
