story:
Who We Are

Hello! Filmora is an original content channel ran by a team of NorCal actors. Our mission is to create a channel that offers a selection of films, both dramatic and comedic, interviews, and shorts that are inclusive of all peoples. 

This campaign is close to all our hearts here at Filmora because it marks our first! Although we all have our fair share of film experience, whether it be in videography or acting, this is the start of a new chapter, and we want to bring you along!

Being in the film industry has given us a lot of ideas, and we can't wait to share them on our new platform. Your contributions will fuel this venture and support young and hungry artists making a name for themselves! 

What We Need & What You Get

Since this is our first campaign we are keeping the goal to a very humble $500. The money will go directly to food and transportation, and from there will be used for gear such as lights,  batteries, nifty camera stabilizers and fancy-smancy audio equipment.

We love you for donating and we want to show you by offering exclusive perks! From a digital photo on set to a credit on the film, we have a variety of ways we are saying "Thank you" for helping us out!

So what if we don't get $500? The money that is donated will be used to feed  and transport our talent and crew. Any left over will be used for other necessities like an extra camera battery or lights.

The Impact

Negative Five touches on mental health, race, sexuality, and gender dynamics. It explores the prevalence of anxiety and depression in young adults. It will discuss prejudice and racism. This series takes life in today's society and looks at it through the lens of science fiction. We want this series to allow people who are struggling with identity, mental health, and judgement know that what they are feeling is real and worthy of a conversation in today's world. 

The first few episodes will establish the characters and the disappearance, but as the series progresses it will become quite obvious that the fictional parts of the story are symbolic of everyday problems.

All of us at Filmora agree that a discussion on these themes is a necessity. 

That's why this project is our first together. We want to set the scene for what Filmora represents: a hub of ideas. 

Risks & Challenges

For this series we will be filming outdoors in breathtaking South Lake Tahoe. Of course many challenges arise from filming outdoors, most common being lighting fluctuations (that dang sun just has to move) and sound pollution (planes I'm talking to you.).

Thankfully we are stretching filming up in Tahoe over several days, reviewing footage in between to make sure everything is in check. This offers us an opportunity to re-shoot any scenes that don't meet our technical criteria. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust me, everyone here at Filmora understands if donating is just not an option for you. But thankfully there are other ways you can help! Share this campaign on social media, text your Thursday brunch group, and call your aunt (she's been wanting to hear from you anyways).

By getting the word around we can increase the chances of this project being funded and many more! 

Meet the Cast

Kevin Hayer playing Darrin

Krystina Whalen playing Lorrel

Thomas Ross playing Isaac

Elizabeth Hayes playing Sutton

Calvin Sawyer playing Eugene

Mollimykenna Whalen playing Megan

Ethel England playing Izzy

Dan Anderson playing Erik

And more to come...

 

Welcome to Filmora!

story:
Nestled in somewhere between Harmonquest and Archer, Critical failures is a unique and hilarious RPG fantasy/comedy currently in preproduction, based on Robert Bevan's book by the same title.

Tim and his friends find out the hard way that you shouldn't question the game master, and you shouldn't make fun of his cape. One minute, they're drinking away the dreariness of their lives, escaping into a fantasy game and laughing their asses off. The next minute, they're in a horse-drawn cart surrounded by soldiers pointing crossbows at them. Tim now has the voice and physique of a prepubescent girl. Dave finds that while he lost a foot or two in height, he somehow acquired a suit of armor and a badass beard. Julian's ears have grown ridiculously long and pointy. And Cooper... well Cooper has gotten himself a set of tusks, a pair of clawed hands, and a bad case of the shits. He also finds that he's carrying a bag with a human head in it - a head that he had chopped off when they were still just playing a game. Shit just got real.

story:
Family feuds, a corrupt MP and insufferable competitors- welcome to the crazy world of craft beer...

First things first: the vast majority of people working on this series, including the creators, are working entirely voluntarily, because we love what we do! We just need your help to make this series as stunning and wonderful as it can possibly be!

WHAT'S THE PLOT, THEN?

"Birchall's Pints is a vibrant, exciting and lively six part miniseries following the ups and downs of a Liverpool craft brewery ran by the young Birchall brothers and their eccentric friends. When the charismatic Alfie Gigglesburg sets up a trendy rival brewery, the brothers must blackmail a corrupt Member of Parliament, David Bugle, into lowering their beer tax."

WHAT WILL MY DONATION GO TOWARDS?

We recognise that £2,000 may sound like a large goal, but with our years of experience working on low-budget productions, this goal would allow us to fund the entire project. Every penny will go towards:

  • Cast and crew wellbeing
  • Securing select experienced professional actors
  • Stunning locations such as mansions, a penthouse and a brewery
  • Props and costumes designed by our brilliant costume designer, that will make the world feel as immersive and authentic as possible.

NOTE: This budget breakdown is an early estimate that may be changed based on circumstances

OUR STORY

Birchall's Pints is the latest exciting project of Some Guys With A Camera, a bold, experimental group of young filmmakers based in Liverpool.

We first met in February 2017 on a production course with the Plaza Community Cinema. The creative freedom we were given inspired us to go independent and work on our own projects the following year. After shooting our first film 'Look What I've Got In My Shopping Bag!', we have rapidly expanded, gaining thousands of views and social media followers, with more and more talented young people working on our productions. We believe strongly in celebrating the North West's undiscovered talent, and telling diverse and unique stories.

Our past ventures have included:

  • Producing a no-budget feature film
  • Premiering our work in multiple cinemas 
  • Articles written about us in almost every local newspaper
  • Releasing a comedy Christmas album for charity
  • Appearing on podcasts around the world

Here are some links to our previous work:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mkSYkdcyLxM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uvG0j5KS58o

TEST FOOTAGE

We've been filming some improvised demo footage of the sort of thing you'll see in the show! 

#1 - Taste Test

#2 - 'Small Businesses

#3 - A Message From David Bugle MP

 

MAIN CAST AND CREW

John Reynolds as William Birchall

Liverpool-born actor John Reynolds will be portraying our protagonist William Birchall, a conflicted young man whose responsibility to protect the business comes into conflict with his own sensitive nature. Amongst having the same childhood milkman as Ringo Starr, John has achieved many other successes, such as starring in Some Guys With A Camera's upcoming romantic drama 'Nick & Liv Together' and hosting the 'Art Imitates Life' podcast
 

  Conor O'Neill as Thomas Birchall

Eccentric young character actor Conor O'Neill will be portraying William's younger brother Thomas Birchall, a free-sprited, hot-headed young man who does much of the company's dirty work. Conor's outrageous, expressive performances have become a staple of Some Guys With A Camera productions, most notably as Sergeant Ian Lynch in the surrealist 'Shopping Bag' franchise. Love him or hate him, you'll never see an actor quite like Conor O'Neill.


 Naomi Reddy as Sian Laurent

Chester-based stage turned screen actor Naomi Reddy will be portraying Sian Laurent, a former nurse whose insensitivity to suffering turns her into a ruthless business mind to be reckoned with. Naomi's past credits include a role in 'Snatch' alongside Rupert Grint, and appearances as an extra in huge productions from Channel 4's 'It's A Sin', Sky's 'COBRA' and scenes with Sean Bean and Stephen Graham in BBC's upcoming drama 'Time'.

 Phillip Redgrave as Alfie Gigglesburg

Phillip Redgrave will be playing Alfie Gigglesburg, the charismatic face of the Birchalls' rival brewery; Gigglesbrew. Phillip is a drama graduate of Liverpool John Moores University, and has acted in numerous theatre productions, such as Closer, Hard Times and Female Transport, and also directed the show Love & Money.

 Paul Duckworth as Burt Birchall

Paul Duckworth, one of the Liverpool theatre scene's most recognisable and talented actors, will be portraying Burt Birchall. Burt, the father of the two lead characters, is a has-been stand-up comedian attempting to re-enter his sons' lives now they own a succesful brewery. 

If you've ever been to the Royal Court theatre in Liverpool, you'll more than likely have enjoyed one of his many outrageous performances. Paul is also recognisable from his starring role in football-themed cult comedy Reds & Blues: The Ballad of Dixie and Kenny (2010), where he plays a hilarious role as an Everton obsessee in a bitter rivalry with a Liverpool-supporting hooligan he has the misfortune of having as his next-door neighbour. Paul also played none other than Ringo Starr in Beatles biopic Backbeat (1994) alongside Ian Hart and Twin Peaks' Sheryl Lee.

Connor Simkins as The Bartender

Connor Simkins will be playing the role of The Bartender, William Birchall's 'imaginary fiend', a mischievous, troublemaking mixologist. Connor is a rising star well experienced in the entertainment world, working in a wide range of theatre productions around Liverpool and beyond. He is most recognisable from starring as the lead in upcoming feature length romantic musical 'Perfectly Frank' and recently starred as John Lennon in a Beatles production touring Italy. 

Written and Directed by Matthew Reynolds

Matthew is a young filmmaker who made his first web series at the age of 14, going on to study A-Level Film at Winstanley College. Since then, he has directed ten short films and a feature film for Some Guys With A Camera, and worked as a runner on romantic musical 'Perfectly Frank'. Matthew is also an occasional actor and will be portraying dodgy, verbose lawyer 'Manny Bosewellox' in episode 5.

FULL CAST

We have an incredibly diverse ensemble cast from a range of experience levels, backgrounds and performance styles that we are very excited to work with!

John Reynolds as William Birchall, the CEO of Birchall's brewery

Conor O'Neill as Thomas Birchall, the short-tempered, ruthless younger Birchall brother

Naomi Reddy as Sian Laurent, a former nurse turned fierce business mind

Phillip Redgrave as Alfie Gigglesburg, figurehead of trendy rival brewery 'Gigglesbrew'

Scott Garner as The College Fryer, the company's brutal enforcer and bodyguard

Joe Campbell as David Bugle, a corrupt right-wing MP who the Birchalls blackmail

Cynthia Shokoya as Mia Agrinya, a mysterious, cunning businesswoman

Phawut Promsorn as Bruce Wong, the company's loveable head chemist

Harry Privett as Jerry Potkin, a lively, creative minded friend of the Birchalls

Sam Bolton as Hugh Milton, a bumbling, foolish accountant

Liv Chandler as Maisie, an influencer who has worked with the Birchalls and become their friend

Connor Simkins as The Bartender, William's 'imaginary fiend'

Paul Duckworth as Burt Birchall, the Birchalls' father

Pruthvi Khilosia as Sanjeev Kapoor, a loveable newsreader

WHERE IS THE SERIES GOING?

Birchall's Pints will be available to stream on Amazon Prime Video once completed.

WHAT IS THE SHOW'S FEEL?

The show is an ode to friendship, exploring themes such as togetherness, loyalty and living life to the full, which are very topical considering the past year. The hard-hitting but ultimately enjoyable nature of the show will be similar to Netflix's BoJack Horseman, or other crime boxsets such as Peaky Blinders. The episodes will have a party atmosphere reminiscent of Martin Scorsese and Edgar Wright films, with a fantastic pop-rock soundtrack of up-and-coming local artists.  

^ Early concept art from our brilliant costume designer

WHEN ARE YOU FILMING?

We aim to be filming the project between July and August 2021.

HOW CAN I FOLLOW THE PRODUCTION?

The best way to keep up to date with the production of 'Birchall's Pints' will be on our Instagram page @someguyswithacamera

To keep up excitement, we also have regularly updated Instagram pages for the Birchall's Brewery (@birchallspints), Gigglesbrew Brewery (@gigglesbrew) and David Bugle MP (@davidbuglemp). We have had a lot of fun getting into character with these pages and we hope you enjoy following them!

All that's left to say is an enormous thank you from the cast and crew of Birchall's Pints for helping to make this exciting production a reality!

 

And, of course, CHEERS!

Phillip is a drama graduate of Liverpool John Moores University, and has acted in numerous theatre productions, such as Closer, Hard Times and Female Transport, and also directed the show Love & Money. Paul Duckworth as Burt BirchallPaul Duckworth, one of the Liverpool theatre scene's most recognisable and talented actors, will be portraying Burt Birchall. Burt, the father of the two lead characters, is a has-been stand-up comedian attempting to re-enter his sons' lives now they own a succesful brewery. If you've ever been to the Royal Court theatre in Liverpool, you'll more than likely have enjoyed one of his many outrageous performances. Paul is also recognisable from his starring role in football-themed cult comedy Reds & Blues: The Ballad of Dixie and Kenny (2010), where he plays a hilarious role as an Everton obsessee in a bitter rivalry with a Liverpool-supporting hooligan he has the misfortune of having as his next-door neighbour. Paul also played none other than Ringo Starr in Beatles biopic Backbeat (1994) alongside Ian Hart and Twin Peaks' Sheryl Lee.Connor Simkins as The BartenderConnor Simkins will be playing the role of The Bartender, William Birchall's 'imaginary fiend', a mischievous, troublemaking mixologist. Connor is a rising star well experienced in the entertainment world, working in a wide range of theatre productions around Liverpool and beyond. He is most recognisable from starring as the lead in upcoming feature length romantic musical 'Perfectly Frank' and recently starred as John Lennon in a Beatles production touring Italy. Written and Directed by Matthew ReynoldsMatthew is a young filmmaker who made his first web series at the age of 14, going on to study A-Level Film at Winstanley College. Since then, he has directed ten short films and a feature film for Some Guys With A Camera, and worked as a runner on romantic musical 'Perfectly Frank'. Matthew is also an occasional actor and will be portraying dodgy, verbose lawyer 'Manny Bosewellox' in episode 5.FULL CASTWe have an incredibly diverse ensemble cast from a range of experience levels, backgrounds and performance styles that we are very excited to work with!John Reynolds as William Birchall, the CEO of Birchall's breweryConor O'Neill as Thomas Birchall, the short-tempered, ruthless younger Birchall brotherNaomi Reddy as Sian Laurent, a former nurse turned fierce business mindPhillip Redgrave as Alfie Gigglesburg, figurehead of trendy rival brewery 'Gigglesbrew'Scott Garner as The College Fryer, the company's brutal enforcer and bodyguardJoe Campbell as David Bugle, a corrupt right-wing MP who the Birchalls blackmailCynthia Shokoya as Mia Agrinya, a mysterious, cunning businesswomanPhawut Promsorn as Bruce Wong, the company's loveable head chemistHarry Privett as Jerry Potkin, a lively, creative minded friend of the BirchallsSam Bolton as Hugh Milton, a bumbling, foolish accountantLiv Chandler as Maisie, an influencer who has worked with the Birchalls and become their friendConnor Simkins as The Bartender, William's 'imaginary fiend'Paul Duckworth as Burt Birchall, the Birchalls' fatherPruthvi Khilosia as Sanjeev Kapoor, a loveable newsreaderWHERE IS THE SERIES GOING?Birchall's Pints will be available to stream on Amazon Prime Video once completed.WHAT IS THE SHOW'S FEEL?The show is an ode to friendship, exploring themes such as togetherness, loyalty and living life to the full, which are very topical considering the past year. The hard-hitting but ultimately enjoyable nature of the show will be similar to Netflix's BoJack Horseman, or other crime boxsets such as Peaky Blinders. The episodes will have a party atmosphere reminiscent of Martin Scorsese and Edgar Wright films, with a fantastic pop-rock soundtrack of up-and-coming local artists.  ^ Early concept art from our brilliant costume designerWHEN ARE YOU FILMING?We aim to be filming the project between July and August 2021.HOW CAN I FOLLOW THE PRODUCTION?The best way to keep up to date with the production of 'Birchall's Pints' will be on our Instagram page @someguyswithacameraTo keep up excitement, we also have regularly updated Instagram pages for the Birchall's Brewery (@birchallspints), Gigglesbrew Brewery (@gigglesbrew) and David Bugle MP (@davidbuglemp). We have had a lot of fun getting into character with these pages and we hope you enjoy following them!All that's left to say is an enormous thank you from the cast and crew of Birchall's Pints for helping to make this exciting production a reality! And, of course, CHEERS!

story:
Confessions of a Newy Driver 

Hi! My name is Brooke Lidbury and I am the creator of Confessions of a Newy Driver.  I'm a Newcastle born and bred woman who has a passion for performing arts. This is my directorial debut and  it's based on my experiences as an Uber driver. 

I produced the first episode of Confessions of a Newy Driver and it was released on 7th December 2019, via Facebook, Youtube and Instagram.  I am campaigning to produce the next instalment - Episode 2.  I have a passion for original work and believe there is a real need to recognise the talent in Newcastle through sharing my stories with you. 

By your contributions, you will help me to produce the next episode by:

* Funding for a DOP  (Director of photography) and Editor

* Funding for promotion - Graphic designer, promotional videos

* Funding for Production costs 

Our goal is $1,200. 

As a thank you for contributing to our project, we want you to be a part of it!

If you donate $250+, you will be invited to join us on set for the day and have the opportunity to be an extra in episode 2 and have your name in the credits. (Limited to 5 spaces)

If you donate $100, you will be named in the credits as a sponsor and invited to be witness the behind the scenes action on set for the day.

If you donate $50, you will receive a VIP ticket to the launch of Episode 2 

If you donate $20, you receive a ticket to the launch of Episode 2. 

If we don't reach our entire goal of $1,200, the funds will still be put back into the project. If you can't make a donation, we would appreciate your support by following and sharing our Facebook , Instagram and Youtube channel. The links for those pages are below. There is also the Indiegogo share tools if you would prefer to support us this way. 

https://www.facebook.com/confessionsofanewydriver/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx-5YRF-S_B1O0...

https://www.instagram.com/brittanyconfesses/

Thank you for visiting our page!

story:
What is Reimagined?

Hello my name is Rachel Patrice, and I am the Creator and Head Producer of ReImagined TV series. This is an original television series that reinterprets famous works from films, tv shows and plays. The concept is to reinterpret everything. Each scene will be originally directed, shot, cast, edited and produced. The only thing we will stick to is the dialogue of the characters. Scene interpretations include scenes from Silence of the Lambs, Good Will Hunting and Romeo and Juliet. We plan to shoot this fall, every other Saturday. There are six episodes in total, the first shoot date being September 12th, and the last, November 21st.  

Funding 

As of now, we need financial support in the following areas:

Production Design: $400

Costumes: $400

Catering: $600

Transportation: $150

*We are currently determining our final goal for budgeting. We may or may not need financial assistance for film equipment. 

 

Total: $1,550

 

The Impact

I got the idea to create this show after a conversation with one of my best friends, and fellow actor, Mariama Conde. We were heartbroken over the fact that, as women of color, we would now always get cast in roles we wanted to play. And, how unfair it can be when people aren’t always chosen to play a role they could be perfect before because of their race, gender, sexual orientation, gender orientation, etc. This is a show meant to elevate BIPOC, LBGTQ folks, and Non-Binary individuals- as well as pay homage to beloved classics. We hope you can support us in our journey to expand the art of cinematic storytelling, and to explore new depths of what it could be.

story:
About Baby Steps

"Baby Steps" is a single-camera comedy about a career woman turned stay-at-home mom trying to reconcile her feminism while scraping banana off the floor. A dark comedy in the vein of Catastrophe, Casual, "Baby Steps" explores the tensions between modern feminism and motherhood. 

About Me 

I have a background in comedy — I was a nationally touring stand-up comedian for over a dozen years. I’ve written and produced three of my own viral web series and worked on the production team for countless digital shorts for Don’t Think Productions, the in-house production company at the Upright Citizens Brigade. I also produced Two Little B*#ches, an independent film which won first place for narrative feature at The Bowery Film Festival. I currently live in Brooklyn with my husband, two daughters and a menagerie of rescue animals. You can check out all my various projects at DavaKrause.com.

The Creative Team

We are proud to say our amazing crew both above and below is over 75% female.  

Our Executive Producer and Co-Director Fia Perera is an accomplished writer, actress and comedian, who has performed in numerous comedy clubs throughout the country as well as top clubs in NYC and LA. She co-created, wrote and produced ITV's fan favorite comedic web series Inappropriate Fairy Tales and Ghost Shrink with Dava Krause and most recently has co-created, produced and written the award-winning show Do The Voice with Lori Alan. Fia has also scribed several feature films. Currently, her feature film, Mermaid, about a trans-nine-year-old girl living in the deep south, is in pre-production. For more go to FiaPerera.com

Inspiration 

Growing up, I went to an all-girls’ school for 13 years where I was basically trained to be a feminist. (Shout out to any Baldwin Bears reading this!)  We were taught to be the best at what we did and be at the top of our fields. For many years, I felt like a horse with blinders charging hard towards a successful career. When I got pregnant, I swore to myself that having a baby wouldn’t change anything. I would be as ambitious as ever. I wouldn’t let motherhood change me.

But it did.

Motherhood did to my identity what it did to my vagina — tore it to pieces. When I put them back together they weren’t the same. I wasn’t the same. I had spent my whole life pursuing a career in "The Biz" as they call it (btw, no one calls it that) while working odd jobs to pay the bills. Financially, my husband and I decided that it would be best for me to stay home with the baby instead of sending her to daycare, while I waited tables.  It was the hardest thing I've ever done and I did stand-up for over a decade. While spending 24/7 with my baby was often joyous, it was also boring, frustrating and isolating.  By the time my daughter was five months old, I hadn’t spent ten minutes alone with myself outside of my apartment. Where was the independent go-getter I once knew and who was this overwhelmed underslept shell of a woman that I had become? And was she still a feminist?

As I started to reach out to other new moms in my life, I discovered that they were going through a similar kind of identity crisis. I knew I wanted to create a series exploring this issue especially in the light of this new wave of feminism since the 2016 election. 

This project itself would not be possible without the supportive and generous community of women and moms that I am lucky enough to have in my life.  From the folks in the parents writer's group that I founded 8 weeks postpartum to the amazing mother in my neighborhood, who is allowing us to film an integral scene in her incredible home designed by DXA Studio.  This pilot is for YOU.

The Importance Of This Project

Today, we are at a turning point in feminist history. There are countless articles and think pieces about "having it all," emotional labor and leaning in (and out). The Baby steps Pilot is semi-autobiographical but it has the potential to be the start of a series that explores what modern feminism and motherhood and looks like for different women. Our voices are unique and important!

What We Need & What You Get

For this initial pilot episode, we are fundraising $15,000. That money will go to pay our actors, our crew, the costs of renting our filming equipment, and other production costs such as insurance, food, lighting, hair and makeup, etc. No matter how much or how little we raised, every single dollar will go toward making the Baby Steps pilot happen. Truly, no donation is too small.

Our donors will be able to select from different levels of perks, depending on the amount you donate! We're offering items made by female artists and boutique owners such as Tara McPherson, Natalie Kocsis, and Global Guardian Designs, who have already donated their gifts and services to the cause. We've made a point of sourcing from women- and mother-owned businesses, and to people with a track record of supporting feminist causes.

Risks & Challenges

While I only carried my two daughters for nine months - nine and a half for my older daughter, god help me -  I’ve been carrying Baby Steps for over three years. I am terrified and exhilarated that I am finally making it come to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't financially contribute, you can still help us make Baby Steps' pilot. Please share this campaign link with mothers' groups and women's empowerment networks — and anywhere else where moms and feminists are making a difference in the world!
